original: mtshon chas tshar gcod pa med pa'i phyir mtshon cha med pas so //
analyzed: mtshon chas tshar gcod pa med pa'i phyir mtshon cha med pas so //
translated: Because there is no weapon that can destroy them, they are weaponless.

original: chos kyi zhes bya ba ni tshul gyis te /
analyzed: chos kyi zhes bya ba ni tshul gyis te /
translated: Dharma is the way,

original: sems can rnams dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la so sor 'god par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can rnams dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la so sor 'god par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they cause sentient beings to be established in the ten wholesome courses of action.

original: snyoms par zhes bya ba ni bag med pa ste /
analyzed: snyoms par zhes bya ba ni bag med pa ste /
translated: Evenness is heedfulness,

original: shes rab phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because they are endowed with the perfection of wisdom.🔽The worldly are called even,

original: gang 'jig rten pa ni snyoms par zhes bya ba snyan pa'i tshig gis zhes rjod par byed do /
analyzed: gang 'jig rten pa ni snyoms par zhes bya ba snyan pa'i tshig gis zhes rjod par byed do /
translated: because they are heedful.

original: de ste skra dang kha spu bregs nas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ste skra dang kha spu bregs nas zhes bya ba la /
translated: If they shave off their hair and beard,

original: na tshod la bab pa'i skra dang kha spu nang gi spras pa yod na rgyags pa skyed par byed pa nyid kyi phyir de bregs pa yin la /
analyzed: na tshod la bab pa'i skra dang kha spu nang gi spras pa yod na rgyags pa skyed par byed pa nyid kyi phyir de bregs pa yin la /
translated: because hair and beard that are in proportion to one’s age cause pride to arise, they shave them off.

original: phyi rol gyi spras pa gos dkar po de yongs su spangs nas ngur smrig gis kha ba sgyur ba'i gos bgos nas so //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi spras pa gos dkar po de yongs su spangs nas ngur smrig gis kha ba sgyur ba'i gos bgos nas so //
translated: Having completely abandoned the external ornament of white clothes, they wear the robes that are dyed with the color of myrobalan bark.

original: yang dag pa kho na'i dad pas zhes bya ba ni yon tan sngon du song ba'i dad pa ni /
analyzed: yang dag pa kho na'i dad pas zhes bya ba ni yon tan sngon du song ba'i dad pa ni /
translated: “With right faith” means with faith in the virtues of the Buddha.

original: yang dag pa'i dad pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i dad pa ste /
translated: “Right faith” is faith in the virtues of the Buddha.

original: des rab tu byung bar gyur na'o //🔽'dir byung ba ni /
analyzed: des rab tu byung bar gyur na'o // 'dir byung ba ni /
translated: “Having gone forth” means having gone forth with that faith.

original: byung ba dang 'gro ba la @156b 'jug pa ste /🔽khyim nas 'byung bar bya zhing /
analyzed: byung ba dang 'gro ba la @156b 'jug pa ste / khyim nas 'byung bar bya zhing /
translated: Here, “having gone forth” means having gone forth and having gone to the destination.🔽“Having gone forth from home” means having gone forth from home.

original: khyim med par 'gro bar gyur na'o //
analyzed: khyim med par 'gro bar gyur na'o //
translated: “Having gone to the destination” means having gone to the destination of homelessness.

original: gnas chung ngu ni khyim yin te /🔽khyim nas byung ba la chung ma dang 'dre ba zhes bya ba khyim chung du de yang med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gnas chung ngu ni khyim yin te / khyim nas byung ba la chung ma dang 'dre ba zhes bya ba khyim chung du de yang med pa'i phyir /
translated: “Home” is a small dwelling.🔽“Having gone forth from home” means having gone forth from that small dwelling.

original: khyim med par 'gro bar 'gyur ba'o //🔽de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khyim med par 'gro bar 'gyur ba'o // de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Having gone to the destination” means having gone to the destination of homelessness, because one does not associate with a wife.

original: phyin ci ma log par gsungs pa yin la /
analyzed: phyin ci ma log par gsungs pa yin la /
translated: “Tathāgata” means one who has spoken without error.

original: nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i dgra nges par bcom pa'i phyir dang / khams gsum po ma lus pas mchod par 'os pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dgra bcom pa yin zhing /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i dgra nges par bcom pa'i phyir dang / khams gsum po ma lus pas mchod par 'os pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dgra bcom pa yin zhing /
translated: “Arhat” means one who has destroyed the enemies such as the afflictions, and one who is worthy of worship by all the three worlds.

original: dngos po thams cad phyin ci ma log par thugs su chud pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad phyin ci ma log par thugs su chud pa'i phyir /
translated: Because he has understood all things without error,

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas yin no //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas yin no //
translated: he is the Perfectly Enlightened One.

original: sgra grags par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten ma lus par snyan par rab tu grags par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: sgra grags par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten ma lus par snyan par rab tu grags par gyur pa'o //
translated: He will be renowned means that he will be renowned in all the world.

original: mchog tu brtsams la zhes bya ba de ni 'bras bu gtso bor gyur pa la'o //
analyzed: mchog tu brtsams la zhes bya ba de ni 'bras bu gtso bor gyur pa la'o //
translated: The phrase he has undertaken the supreme refers to the fruit of his undertaking.

original: rab tu rgan pa dag dang zhes bya ba ni rgan pa dag las kyang shin tu rgan pa ste /🔽rgan zhing rgan pa de dag dang ngo ;
analyzed: rab tu rgan pa dag dang zhes bya ba ni rgan pa dag las kyang shin tu rgan pa ste / rgan zhing rgan pa de dag dang ngo ;
translated: The phrase the most venerable means that he is more venerable than the venerable.

original: / bcom ldan 'das gang na ba zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das phyogs gang na bzhugs pa'i phyogs rgyur gyur pa der song ba'o //
analyzed: / bcom ldan 'das gang na ba zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das phyogs gang na bzhugs pa'i phyogs rgyur gyur pa der song ba'o //
translated: The phrase in the presence of the Blessed One means that he went to the place where the Blessed One was.

original: mngon du zhes bya ba ni mngon sum du'o //🔽yang dag par dga' ba ni phan tshun dge ba'i gtam 'dri bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: mngon du zhes bya ba ni mngon sum du'o // yang dag par dga' ba ni phan tshun dge ba'i gtam 'dri bar byed pa'o //
translated: The phrase in the presence of means in person.🔽The phrase they gladdened the mind means that they asked each other about wholesome things.

original: yang dag par mgu ba ni phan tshun yon tan rjod par byed pa'i //
analyzed: yang dag par mgu ba ni phan tshun yon tan rjod par byed pa'i //
translated: The phrase they delighted the mind means that they praised each other's good qualities.

original: byas nas 'khod do zhes bya ba ni rdzogs par byas nas spangs pa'am 'phangs par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: byas nas 'khod do zhes bya ba ni rdzogs par byas nas spangs pa'am 'phangs par gyur pa'o //
translated: Having done so, they settled down means having completed it, they either abandoned it or cast it aside.

original: chos dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni chos dang bral bar ma gyur pa'o //
analyzed: chos dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni chos dang bral bar ma gyur pa'o //
translated: Endowed with the Dharma means not devoid of the Dharma.

original: yang dag par bstan zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: yang dag par bstan zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: With regard to the correct teaching and so on,

original: mi shes pa shes par byed pa ni yang dag par ston par byed pa ste /
analyzed: mi shes pa shes par byed pa ni yang dag par ston par byed pa ste /
translated: the teaching of the unknown is the correct teaching.

original: bya ba lung phog pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bya ba lung phog pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that the injunction is given.

original: yongs su shes pa dang ldan pa le los bcom pa dag yang dag par bkod pa yin no //
analyzed: yongs su shes pa dang ldan pa le los bcom pa dag yang dag par bkod pa yin no //
translated: Those endowed with full knowledge who are overcome by laziness are correctly established.

original: bya ba'i sgo nas dge ba la yang dag par bkod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bya ba'i sgo nas dge ba la yang dag par bkod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are correctly established in virtue by way of action.

original: yang dag par gzengs bstod pa ni mos pa dman pa dag dngos po khyad par du 'phags pa la mngon par sbyor ba skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par gzengs bstod pa ni mos pa dman pa dag dngos po khyad par du 'phags pa la mngon par sbyor ba skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: Correctly encouraging means generating the application to the special entity of those with inferior interest.

original: yang dag par dga' bar byas pa ni mos pa rgya che ba dag kyang las su bya ba chen po la spro ba yang dag par skyed pa'i phyir las su bya ba de brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: yang dag par dga' bar byas pa ni mos pa rgya che ba dag kyang las su bya ba chen po la spro ba yang dag par skyed pa'i phyir las su bya ba de brjod pa yin no //
translated: The phrase having delighted them means that he has described the work to be done in order to generate enthusiasm for that work in those who have a vast aspiration.

original: skabs skabs su gtam zer ba la zhes bya ba ni bar bar du gtam @157a * //🔽rab tu 'jug par byed pa'o //
analyzed: skabs skabs su gtam zer ba la zhes bya ba ni bar bar du gtam @157a * // rab tu 'jug par byed pa'o //
translated: The phrase at appropriate times means that he engages in conversation at appropriate times.🔽The phrase in an appropriate manner means that he engages in conversation in a manner that is appropriate to the situation.

original: bla ma'i yul la gus pa med pa'i phyir ma gus pa yin la /
analyzed: bla ma'i yul la gus pa med pa'i phyir ma gus pa yin la /
translated: He is without disrespect because he is not disrespectful toward his superiors.

original: bdag nyid 'ga' zhig la yang bdag po nyid du lta ba med pa'i phyir zhes gus pa med pa ste /
analyzed: bdag nyid 'ga' zhig la yang bdag po nyid du lta ba med pa'i phyir zhes gus pa med pa ste /
translated: He is without pride because he does not consider himself to be the master of anything.

original: rang dbang gis 'jug par byed ces bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: rang dbang gis 'jug par byed ces bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: He engages in conversation freely because he does not engage in conversation for the sake of material reward.

original: sems so zhes bya ba ni smra bar 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: sems so zhes bya ba ni smra bar 'dod pa'o //
translated: The phrase he is attentive means that he is desirous of speaking.

original: rig pa gsum gang la yod pa de ni gsum rig pa yin te /
analyzed: rig pa gsum gang la yod pa de ni gsum rig pa yin te /
translated: One who possesses the three forms of knowledge is called one who possesses the three forms of knowledge.

original: de yang nges brjod dang / snyan dngags dang / mchod sbyin gyi rig byed do //🔽ji lta ji ltar zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de yang nges brjod dang / snyan dngags dang / mchod sbyin gyi rig byed do // ji lta ji ltar zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The three forms of knowledge are knowledge of grammar, knowledge of metrics and poetics, and knowledge of sacrificial rites.

original: yang dag par brjod pa la 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: yang dag par brjod pa la 'jug pa yin no //
translated: The phrase in whatever manner means that he engages in conversation in a manner that is appropriate to the situation.

original: rnam pa gang gis 'gro ba dang 'ong ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis 'gro ba dang 'ong ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In what way is there going and coming, etc.?

original: de lta bu rjod par byed pa na gus pa med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu rjod par byed pa na gus pa med pa ma yin no //
translated: When one expresses it in this way, one is not being disrespectful.

original: gang de dag ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gang de dag ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: As for the passage that begins with “those who,”

original: gtsug phud bsal bas sgra med pa nyid kyi phyir mgo reg ste smad pa yin la /
analyzed: gtsug phud bsal bas sgra med pa nyid kyi phyir mgo reg ste smad pa yin la /
translated: they are called “shaven-headed” because they have removed their topknots, and this is a contemptuous term.

original: mgo reg smod pa'i dge sbyong dag ni dge sbyong ngan pa mgo reg go //
analyzed: mgo reg smod pa'i dge sbyong dag ni dge sbyong ngan pa mgo reg go //
translated: Those who are shaven-headed and contemptible are bad śramaṇas, shaven-headed bad men.

original: gnyen nag gi tshogs gang la yod pa de dag ni gnyen nag po can yin te /
analyzed: gnyen nag gi tshogs gang la yod pa de dag ni gnyen nag po can yin te /
translated: Those who have a group of dark relatives are “dark-skinned.”

original: de ltar yang bram ze'i rigs ni dkar po yin la /
analyzed: de ltar yang bram ze'i rigs ni dkar po yin la /
translated: For example, it is said that the brahmin caste is white,

original: rigs gzhan dag ni nag po yin no zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: rigs gzhan dag ni nag po yin no zhes 'byung ste /
translated: and the other castes are dark.

original: khyed shin tu rigs gzhan du gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: khyed shin tu rigs gzhan du gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that you are of a very different caste.

original: skye dgu rnams kyi bdag po ni skye ba'i sgo nas bud med kyi yul skye dgu'i bdag po yin te /
analyzed: skye dgu rnams kyi bdag po ni skye ba'i sgo nas bud med kyi yul skye dgu'i bdag po yin te /
translated: The lord of the people is the lord of the people who are born from the womb.

original: skye dgu'i bdag po yongs su len pa gang dag yod pa ma yin pa de dag ni skye dgu'i bdag po med pa ste /
analyzed: skye dgu'i bdag po yongs su len pa gang dag yod pa ma yin pa de dag ni skye dgu'i bdag po med pa ste /
translated: Those who do not have a master of beings are without a master of beings.

original: bu mo yongs su 'dzin pa gang la yod pa ma yin pa de dag ni 'jig rten pa rnams kyis shin tu smad pa yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: bu mo yongs su 'dzin pa gang la yod pa ma yin pa de dag ni 'jig rten pa rnams kyis shin tu smad pa yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Those who do not have a master of beings are greatly despised by the world.

original: de dag dang lhan cig tu nga 'di ltar gus pa med pa'i gtam yang dag par 'dre bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de dag dang lhan cig tu nga 'di ltar gus pa med pa'i gtam yang dag par 'dre bar byed pa'o //
translated: I am like that, engaging in conversation with them without respect.

original: don de dgos pa gang la yod pa de la ni don dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: don de dgos pa gang la yod pa de la ni don dang ldan pa ste /
translated: One who has a purpose is one who has a goal.

original: don dang ldan pa yang yin la 'ongs pa yang yin pas na don dang ldan pas 'ongs pa'o //
analyzed: don dang ldan pa yang yin la 'ongs pa yang yin pas na don dang ldan pas 'ongs pa'o //
translated: One who has a purpose and has come is one who has come with a purpose.

original: gang zhig dgos pas rab tu 'jug pa de ni don dang ldan pas 'ongs ba yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig dgos pas rab tu 'jug pa de ni don dang ldan pas 'ongs ba yin no //
translated: One who engages with a purpose is one who has come with a purpose.

original: khyod dgos pas da ltar yang bla ma'i khyim du gnas bcas pa de'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang dang mngags pa yin pa'am /
analyzed: khyod dgos pas da ltar yang bla ma'i khyim du gnas bcas pa de'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang dang mngags pa yin pa'am /
translated: You are now staying in the teacher's house with a purpose. Therefore, you are dependent on others and are an emissary.

original: yang na bla ma'i khyim du gnas bcas pa dag gi bla mar byed pa sngon du song ba can gyi kun du spyod pa mi gnong ba de ni rigs pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: yang na bla ma'i khyim du gnas bcas pa dag gi bla mar byed pa sngon du song ba can gyi kun du spyod pa mi gnong ba de ni rigs pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Or, if they are not angry with their guru, they are not angry with those who live in the guru’s house.

original: de'i phyir de ni gnas ma bcas pa ste zhes bya ba smos pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni gnas ma bcas pa ste zhes bya ba smos pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, the root text says, “They are not angry with those who live in the guru’s house.”

original: de dag ni bla ma'i skye bo @157b la bsnyen bkur ma byas par 'dir 'ongs pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni bla ma'i skye bo @157b la bsnyen bkur ma byas par 'dir 'ongs pa yin te /
translated: They do not come here out of respect for the guru.

original: bram ze'i bu aambasta bla ma'i khyim du gnas pa'i 'bras bu bla mar byed pa med pa'i phyir bla ma'i khyim na 'dug pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bram ze'i bu aambasta bla ma'i khyim du gnas pa'i 'bras bu bla mar byed pa med pa'i phyir bla ma'i khyim na 'dug pa ma yin no //
translated: They are not living in the guru’s house because they do not respect the guru, as in the case of Ambattha, the young brahmin.

original: ma mgu ba ni thog mar khro bas zil gyis mnan pa yin no //
analyzed: ma mgu ba ni thog mar khro bas zil gyis mnan pa yin no //
translated: They are not angry because they are not overcome by anger at first.

original: khro ba sngon du song ba can gyis lus 'gyur bar byed pa'i phyir khros pa yin no //
analyzed: khro ba sngon du song ba can gyis lus 'gyur bar byed pa'i phyir khros pa yin no //
translated: They are not wrathful because they do not make their bodies change in an angry way.

original: khro ba'i tshig brjod par 'dod pa ni gtum por gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: khro ba'i tshig brjod par 'dod pa ni gtum por gyur pa yin no //
translated: They are not fierce because they do not want to speak angry words.

original: yi ma rangs pa ni sems mgu bar ma gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: yi ma rangs pa ni sems mgu bar ma gyur pa yin no //
translated: They are not displeased because their minds are not unhappy.

original: smra bar 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni tshig ngan pa'o //🔽smod par 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni tshar gcod par byed 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: smra bar 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni tshig ngan pa'o // smod par 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni tshar gcod par byed 'dod pa'o //
translated: The phrase one who wishes to speak refers to one who wishes to speak harshly.🔽The phrase one who wishes to disparage refers to one who wishes to humiliate.

original: gleng bar 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'dod pa ma yin pa'i tshig smra bar 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: gleng bar 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'dod pa ma yin pa'i tshig smra bar 'dod pa'o //
translated: The phrase one who wishes to reprove refers to one who wishes to speak words that are not agreeable.

original: dran par bya ba nyid du 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni dran pa med pa dran pa bskyed par mngon par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: dran par bya ba nyid du 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni dran pa med pa dran pa bskyed par mngon par 'dod pa'o //
translated: The phrase one who wishes to remind refers to one who wishes to arouse recollection in one who is absentminded.

original: da ltar gyi zhes bya ba ni yongs su shes pa med par skyes pa da ltar gyi dus su byung ba ste /
analyzed: da ltar gyi zhes bya ba ni yongs su shes pa med par skyes pa da ltar gyi dus su byung ba ste /
translated: The phrase one who is present refers to one who has been born without having attained the realization of the spiritual levels.

original: go rims gzhan ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: go rims gzhan ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase in the same order means in the same sequence.

original: yang na glang po che 'os pa gang yin pa de dag ni rgyal rigs yin te /🔽bram ze dag las dman par gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na glang po che 'os pa gang yin pa de dag ni rgyal rigs yin te / bram ze dag las dman par gyur pa yin no //
translated: Alternatively, the phrase one who is fit to be a king means one who is fit to be an elephant rider, one who is fit to be a minister, and one who is fit to be a brahmin.🔽The phrase one who is not fit to be a brahmin means one who is inferior to a brahmin.

original: bsnyen bkur mi byed ces bya ba ni 'di chen po yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu'i sems kyis 'dzin par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: bsnyen bkur mi byed ces bya ba ni 'di chen po yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu'i sems kyis 'dzin par mi byed pa'o //
translated: The phrase one who does not show respect means one who does not hold the view that a brahmin is great.

original: bla mar mi byed ces bya ba ni kho bo la bla ma'i gnas su lta bar mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: bla mar mi byed ces bya ba ni kho bo la bla ma'i gnas su lta bar mi byed pa'o //
translated: “One does not take him as one’s teacher” means one does not regard him as a teacher.

original: btsun par mi byed ces bya ba ni rigs bzang po yin no zhes de ltar lta bar mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: btsun par mi byed ces bya ba ni rigs bzang po yin no zhes de ltar lta bar mi byed pa'o //
translated: “One does not revere him” means one does not regard him as a person of good family.

original: mchod par mi byed ces bya ba ni lus kyis phyag 'tshal ba la sogs pa'i mchod pa mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: mchod par mi byed ces bya ba ni lus kyis phyag 'tshal ba la sogs pa'i mchod pa mi byed pa'o //
translated: “One does not worship him” means one does not worship him with prostrations and so on.

original: khug rta zhes bya ba ni bya'i rigs lus kyi tshad chung ba'o //
analyzed: khug rta zhes bya ba ni bya'i rigs lus kyi tshad chung ba'o //
translated: “A small bird” is a type of bird whose body is small.

original: bdag nyid ces bya ba ni sh'akya rnams kyi grong khyer ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid ces bya ba ni sh'akya rnams kyi grong khyer ro //
translated: “One’s own city” is the city of the Śākyas.

original: bdag nyid kyis zhes bya ba gnyis pa smos pas ni grong khyer bdag nyid kyis byas pa nyid du ston par byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis zhes bya ba gnyis pa smos pas ni grong khyer bdag nyid kyis byas pa nyid du ston par byed pa yin gyi /
translated: The second “one’s own” shows that the city was built by the Śākyas themselves.

original: grong khyer de dag gzhan gyi stobs kyis bzung bar gyur pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: grong khyer de dag gzhan gyi stobs kyis bzung bar gyur pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It was not captured by the power of others.

original: rgyud btsal ba ni dang por rgyud bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: rgyud btsal ba ni dang por rgyud bsgrub pa'o //
translated: The investigation of the continuum is the establishment of the continuum in the beginning.

original: shin tu bya ba ni shin tu rgal ba'i don dang / brdzun ba zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: shin tu bya ba ni shin tu rgal ba'i don dang / brdzun ba zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: The word very is to be supplied from the preceding verse.

original: skabs zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs yin no //
analyzed: skabs zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs yin no //
translated: Opportunity means occasion.

original: chos bzhin du zhes bya ba ni tshul gyis so //
analyzed: chos bzhin du zhes bya ba ni tshul gyis so //
translated: In accordance with the Dharma means in accordance with the rules.

original: rab tu 'dud pa ni tshar bcad cing gnas med pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽ljongs tha mal pa ni yul 'khor yin la /🔽ljongs kyi @158a * //

analyzed: de yan chad gsad par bya ba'i phyir yid la byas pa'am /
translated: up to this point, he has the intention to kill.

original: de la sogs pa'i srog chags gsod pa las slar ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: de la sogs pa'i srog chags gsod pa las slar ldog pa yin no //
translated: He turns away from killing living beings, and so on.

original: des ma byin par len pa zhes bya ba la //
analyzed: des ma byin par len pa zhes bya ba la //
translated: With regard to what is called “taking what is not given,”

original: de kun nas len pa'i phyir len pa yin la //
analyzed: de kun nas len pa'i phyir len pa yin la //
translated: it is taking because it is the complete taking of something.

original: ma byin par len pa ni ma byin par len pa ste /
analyzed: ma byin par len pa ni ma byin par len pa ste /
translated: Taking what is not given is taking what is not given.

original: ma byin par rku ba'i sems kyis len pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ma byin par rku ba'i sems kyis len pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that it is taking with a mind that steals what is not given.

original: ji ltar ldog par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar ldog par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does one turn away from it?

original: byin pa len pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: byin pa len pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sogs pa smos te /
translated: With regard to what is said, “taking what is given,” and so on, “and so on” refers to

original: byin pa len pa ni dngos po kun nas len cing 'dzin par byed pa'i phyir byin pa len pa'o //
analyzed: byin pa len pa ni dngos po kun nas len cing 'dzin par byed pa'i phyir byin pa len pa'o //
translated: taking what is given because it is the complete taking and holding of a thing.

original: byin pa'i dngos po la sems kyi sgo nas rtag tu mngon par dga' bas na byin pa la dga' ba yin no //
analyzed: byin pa'i dngos po la sems kyi sgo nas rtag tu mngon par dga' bas na byin pa la dga' ba yin no //
translated: One is pleased with what is given because one always delights in the thing that is given through the mind.

original: dngos po byin pa dang / spangs pa dang / btang ba len par 'dod pa'i ngang tshul can ni byin pa dang spangs pa dang / btang ba la re bar gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: dngos po byin pa dang / spangs pa dang / btang ba len par 'dod pa'i ngang tshul can ni byin pa dang spangs pa dang / btang ba la re bar gyur pa yin te /
translated: He is inclined to take what is given, what is abandoned, and what is relinquished.

original: ltos pa med pa'i sems kyis byin pa gang yin pa de ni byin ba yin zhing /🔽grong la sogs par gang du dus de srid du byin pa ni spangs pa yin la /
analyzed: ltos pa med pa'i sems kyis byin pa gang yin pa de ni byin ba yin zhing / grong la sogs par gang du dus de srid du byin pa ni spangs pa yin la /
translated: What is given is that which is given with a mind free from expectation.🔽What is abandoned is that which is given for a certain period of time in a certain place, such as a village.

original: gang mu ge la sogs par bang mdzod la sogs pa dag ji ltar bde bar yongs su longs spyod pa'i phyir yongs su btang ba ni btang ba yin no //
analyzed: gang mu ge la sogs par bang mdzod la sogs pa dag ji ltar bde bar yongs su longs spyod pa'i phyir yongs su btang ba ni btang ba yin no //
translated: What is relinquished is that which is given to others for their use, such as a granary, in times of famine.

original: mi rku ba zhes bya ba ni 'di la rku ba'i sems med pa yin la /
analyzed: mi rku ba zhes bya ba ni 'di la rku ba'i sems med pa yin la /
translated: He is not a thief, because he has no intention to steal.

original: gzhan gyi rdzas kyi yul la 'dod pa med pa'i phyir chags pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rdzas kyi yul la 'dod pa med pa'i phyir chags pa med pa yin no //
translated: He is not greedy, because he has no desire for the possessions of others.

original: bdag nyid dor ba ni ma byin par len pa'i kha na ma tho ba las srung bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid dor ba ni ma byin par len pa'i kha na ma tho ba las srung bar byed pa'o //
translated: He is not one who rejects himself, because he protects himself from the sin of stealing.

original: dag pa zhes bya ba ni ma byin par len pa'i dri ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dag pa zhes bya ba ni ma byin par len pa'i dri ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Purity means that it is free from the stain of taking what is not given.

original: gzhan gyi nor la chags pa med pa'i phyir btang ba yin no ;
analyzed: gzhan gyi nor la chags pa med pa'i phyir btang ba yin no ;
translated: It is generosity because it is not attached to the wealth of others.

original: / ma byin par len pa'i rkyen gyi bar gyis nyes pa 'byung ba med pa'i phyir kha na ma tho ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: / ma byin par len pa'i rkyen gyi bar gyis nyes pa 'byung ba med pa'i phyir kha na ma tho ba med pa yin no //
translated: It is irreproachable because it is free from the fault of taking what is not given.🔽Abandoning sexual misconduct means that it is the practice of Brahma.

original: mi tshangs par spyod pa spangs te zhes bya ba la tshangs pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin la /
analyzed: mi tshangs par spyod pa spangs te zhes bya ba la tshangs pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin la /
translated: Brahma is nirvana.

original: de'i rgyu mtshan gyi spyod pa ste /
analyzed: de'i rgyu mtshan gyi spyod pa ste /
translated: The practice of that is the practice of Brahma.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i bya ba can no //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i bya ba can no //
translated: It is the practice of nirvana.🔽Sexual misconduct is not the practice of Brahma.

original: tshangs par @161b spyod pa ma yin pa ni mi tshangs par spyod pa ste 'khor ba'i 'bras bu'i bya ba can no //
analyzed: tshangs par @161b spyod pa ma yin pa ni mi tshangs par spyod pa ste 'khor ba'i 'bras bu'i bya ba can no //
translated: It is the practice of the result of samsara.

original: ji ltar srog gcod pa la sogs pa dag kyang spyir tshangs par spyod pa ma yin pa nyid du zin kyang ming 'di ni 'khrig pa'i yul la grags pa'i sgra yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar srog gcod pa la sogs pa dag kyang spyir tshangs par spyod pa ma yin pa nyid du zin kyang ming 'di ni 'khrig pa'i yul la grags pa'i sgra yin te /
translated: Although killing and so on are generally not the practice of Brahma, this term is a term of common usage in regard to sexual objects.

original: grags pa ni yul phrogs par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tshul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grags pa ni yul phrogs par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tshul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and fame is the cause of the loss of one's country.

original: ji ltar na mi tshangs par spyod pa spangs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na mi tshangs par spyod pa spangs pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that he has abandoned unchastity?

original: tshangs par spyod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says: He is chaste, etc.

original: tshangs pa'i rgyu mtshan du spyod par byed pa'i phyir tshangs par spyod pa yin la /
analyzed: tshangs pa'i rgyu mtshan du spyod par byed pa'i phyir tshangs par spyod pa yin la /
translated: He is chaste because he practices the cause of Brahma.

original: sems kyis kyang dran pa med pa'i phyir ring du spyod pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyis kyang dran pa med pa'i phyir ring du spyod pa'o //
translated: He practices far away because he is without memory even in his mind.

original: skyes pa dang bud med kyi kun du sbyor ba'i dri ma med pa'i phyir dag pa yin no //
analyzed: skyes pa dang bud med kyi kun du sbyor ba'i dri ma med pa'i phyir dag pa yin no //
translated: He is pure because he is without the stain of the fetters of men and women.

original: sems kyi sgo nas lhag par chags pa med pa'i phyir gtsang ba yin no //
analyzed: sems kyi sgo nas lhag par chags pa med pa'i phyir gtsang ba yin no //
translated: He is clean because he is without attachment in his mind.

original: 'khyud pa dang / 'o byed pa dang / khyim gcig tu 'jug pa la sogs pa med pa'i phyir dri nga ma med pa yin no //
analyzed: 'khyud pa dang / 'o byed pa dang / khyim gcig tu 'jug pa la sogs pa med pa'i phyir dri nga ma med pa yin no //
translated: He is without bad odor because he is without embracing, kissing, entering the same house, and so on.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de rgya'i rna ru las ldog pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de rgya'i rna ru las ldog pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: For that very reason, he is called the one who turns away from the lotus.

original: gang bud med kyi yul la chags pa'i sems 'ga' 'jug pa de thams cad grong ba'i chos yin la /
analyzed: gang bud med kyi yul la chags pa'i sems 'ga' 'jug pa de thams cad grong ba'i chos yin la /
translated: All those who are attached to women are attached to the Dharma of the village.

original: dam pa rnams kyis smad pa'i phyir smad pa yin te /
analyzed: dam pa rnams kyis smad pa'i phyir smad pa yin te /
translated: They are despised by the holy ones, and are despised because of that.

original: de dang bral ba dang / dben pa dang / spangs pa dang / ldog pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: de dang bral ba dang / dben pa dang / spangs pa dang / ldog pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: They are free from that, they are secluded, they have abandoned it, they have turned away from it.

original: brdzun du smra ba spangs nas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: brdzun du smra ba spangs nas zhes bya ba la /
translated: Having abandoned lying,

original: gang zhig bden pa mngon par shes pa'i yul la yang dag pa'i ye shes rnam par gzhag pa'i tshig rjod par byed cing de la smra ba yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig bden pa mngon par shes pa'i yul la yang dag pa'i ye shes rnam par gzhag pa'i tshig rjod par byed cing de la smra ba yin no //
translated: one speaks and utters words that are established by true knowledge in the domain of the superknowledges of the truths.

original: ji ltar na brdzun du smra ba las slar ldog par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na brdzun du smra ba las slar ldog par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does one turn away from lying?

original: bden par smra ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: bden par smra ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: By speaking the truth, and so on.

original: bden par smra bar byed pa dang / de'i ngang tshul can ni bden bar smar ba'o //
analyzed: bden par smra bar byed pa dang / de'i ngang tshul can ni bden bar smar ba'o //
translated: One speaks the truth, and one is of that nature, thus one speaks the truth.

original: bden pa la dga' ba zhes bya ba ni sems kyi sgo nas kyang bden pa'i tshig la mngon par dga' ba'o //
analyzed: bden pa la dga' ba zhes bya ba ni sems kyi sgo nas kyang bden pa'i tshig la mngon par dga' ba'o //
translated: One delights in the truth, one delights in the words of truth even mentally.

original: dad par gyur pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dad par gyur pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: He is one in whom others have faith.🔽In this regard, he is one in whom others generate faith.

original: gang zag 'di la gzhan dag dad pa skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas nas bden par smra ba nyid kyis skye bo thams cad dad par 'gyur ba'i tshig can yin no //
analyzed: gang zag 'di la gzhan dag dad pa skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas nas bden par smra ba nyid kyis skye bo thams cad dad par 'gyur ba'i tshig can yin no //
translated: He is one who has the words that cause all beings to have faith, because he is one who speaks the truth.

original: gang la yid ches pa skye bar 'gyur ba ni yid ches pa yin te /
analyzed: gang la yid ches pa skye bar 'gyur ba ni yid ches pa yin te /
translated: He is one in whom others have confidence.

original: bden par smra ba nyid kyis gzhan yid ches pa'i gnas nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bden par smra ba nyid kyis gzhan yid ches pa'i gnas nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is one who speaks the truth and is a basis for the confidence of others.

original: brtan pa zhes bya ba ni bden @162a * //
analyzed: brtan pa zhes bya ba ni bden @162a * //
translated: He is steadfast.

original: pa'i tshig smra ba la brtan zhing g-yo ba med pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: pa'i tshig smra ba la brtan zhing g-yo ba med pa nyid yin no //
translated: He is one who speaks the truth and is firm and unwavering.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de ni gang smras pa de byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas nas 'jig rten la mi slu bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de ni gang smras pa de byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas nas 'jig rten la mi slu bar byed pa yin no //
translated: For this very reason, he is one who does not deceive the world, in the sense that he does what he says he will do.

original: des phra ma spangs nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: des phra ma spangs nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: He is one who, having abandoned divisive speech, etc.

original: gang zhig dbye ba'i bsam bas sems nyon mongs pa can gyi tshig brjod pa de ni phra ma yin la /
analyzed: gang zhig dbye ba'i bsam bas sems nyon mongs pa can gyi tshig brjod pa de ni phra ma yin la /
translated: Divisive speech is the offensive speech of one who wishes to divide others.

original: phra ma'i las sam phra ma'i dngos po ni phra ma nyid yin no //
analyzed: phra ma'i las sam phra ma'i dngos po ni phra ma nyid yin no //
translated: The action or object of divisive speech is divisive speech itself.

original: de dag las bya ba tshogs gzhan du rnam par gzhag pa dag las so //
analyzed: de dag las bya ba tshogs gzhan du rnam par gzhag pa dag las so //
translated: From among the other categories of action,

original: de dag la zhes bya ba ni tshogs gzhan du rnam par dag pas na dag pa'o //🔽sdum par byed ces bya ba ni 'brel par byed pa'i ngang tshul can yin no //
analyzed: de dag la zhes bya ba ni tshogs gzhan du rnam par dag pas na dag pa'o // sdum par byed ces bya ba ni 'brel par byed pa'i ngang tshul can yin no //
translated: it is the pure speech of one who is pure in terms of the other categories of action.🔽It is the speech of one who is inclined to reconcile those who are divided.

original: rjes su 'chos par byed pa zhes bya ba ni gcig tu byed pa'i ngang tshul can yin no //🔽'dus pa dag la dga' ba zhes bya ba ni lus kyi sgo nas so //
analyzed: rjes su 'chos par byed pa zhes bya ba ni gcig tu byed pa'i ngang tshul can yin no // 'dus pa dag la dga' ba zhes bya ba ni lus kyi sgo nas so //
translated: It is the speech of one who is inclined to unite those who are divided.🔽It is the delight in the assemblies of those who are united.

original: 'dus pa dag la mgu ba zhes bya ba ni sems kyi sgo nas so //
analyzed: 'dus pa dag la mgu ba zhes bya ba ni sems kyi sgo nas so //
translated: It is the mental delight in the assemblies of those who are united.🔽It is the speech that causes assemblies to unite.

original: 'du bar byed pa'i tshig smras te zhes bya ba ni rtag tu 'dus pa byed pa'i tshig brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'du bar byed pa'i tshig smras te zhes bya ba ni rtag tu 'dus pa byed pa'i tshig brjod pa yin no //
translated: It is the speech that causes those who are divided to unite.

original: des tshig rtsub po spangs nas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: des tshig rtsub po spangs nas zhes bya ba la /
translated: He, having abandoned harsh speech,

original: tshig snyan pa ma yin pa ni tshig rtsub po yin te /
analyzed: tshig snyan pa ma yin pa ni tshig rtsub po yin te /
translated: harsh speech is unpleasant speech.

original: de spangs nas so //
analyzed: de spangs nas so //
translated: Having abandoned that,

original: ji ltar spangs nas she na /
analyzed: ji ltar spangs nas she na /
translated: how is it abandoned?

original: de dag gdug pa'i tshig dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag gdug pa'i tshig dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: He says, “those words which are poisonous, etc.”

original: kun nas bar byed pas na gdug pa ste /
analyzed: kun nas bar byed pas na gdug pa ste /
translated: Poisonous means that which causes complete harm,

original: sbrul gyis zos pa dang 'dra bar sdug bsngal skyed par byed pa'i tshig gam /
analyzed: sbrul gyis zos pa dang 'dra bar sdug bsngal skyed par byed pa'i tshig gam /
translated: words which cause suffering as if one were bitten by a snake,

original: shin tu gnod pa ni gdug pa yin no //
analyzed: shin tu gnod pa ni gdug pa yin no //
translated: or which are extremely harmful are poisonous.

original: rang bzhin gyis drag pa nyid kyi phyir rtsub pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis drag pa nyid kyi phyir rtsub pa'o //
translated: Harsh means that which is naturally strong.

original: gzhan sdug bsngal skyed pa nyid kyi phyir gzhan la gnod pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan sdug bsngal skyed pa nyid kyi phyir gzhan la gnod pa'o //
translated: Harmful to others means that which causes suffering to others.

original: gzhan la mngon bar zhen pa zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'dzin pa bag 'khums pa yin no zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas te /🔽gzhan bag 'khums pa skyed par byed pa'am /
analyzed: gzhan la mngon bar zhen pa zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'dzin pa bag 'khums pa yin no zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas te / gzhan bag 'khums pa skyed par byed pa'am /
translated: As for “attachment to others,” it is the clinging to others, i.e., the grasping.🔽It is that which causes others to be timid,

original: gzhan zhe sdang skyed par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan zhe sdang skyed par byed pa yin no //
translated: or that which causes others to be angry.

original: 'dod pa'i yul las shin tu 'das pa nyid kyi phyir mi 'dod pa'o //🔽'dod par bya ba nyid ma yin pa'i phyir mi dga' ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yul las shin tu 'das pa nyid kyi phyir mi 'dod pa'o // 'dod par bya ba nyid ma yin pa'i phyir mi dga' ba'o //
translated: It is not desired because it is completely beyond the realm of desire.🔽It is not pleasing because it is not something that one desires.

original: dga' ba'i rgyud nyid ma yin pa'i phyir mi mgu ba'o //
analyzed: dga' ba'i rgyud nyid ma yin pa'i phyir mi mgu ba'o //
translated: It is not satisfying because it is not the cause of satisfaction.

original: yid kyi skad cig mar yang bsam par bya ba ma yin pas na yid du mi 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: yid kyi skad cig mar yang bsam par bya ba ma yin pas na yid du mi 'ong ba'o //
translated: It is not agreeable because it is not something that one can think about in a single moment of thought.

original: ting nge 'dzin dang mi mthun pa nyid kyi phyir g-yeng ba'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang mi mthun pa nyid kyi phyir g-yeng ba'o //
translated: It is distracting because it is not in accord with meditative concentration.

original: sems 'khrug par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ting nge 'dzin dang mi @162b mthun pa'o //
analyzed: sems 'khrug par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ting nge 'dzin dang mi @162b mthun pa'o //
translated: It is not in accord with meditative concentration because it disturbs the mind.

original: yid du 'ong ba nyid yin pas na mgu bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: yid du 'ong ba nyid yin pas na mgu bar byed pa'o //
translated: It is satisfying because it is agreeable.

original: rnam bar 'ong ba ni rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i bde ba skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rnam bar 'ong ba ni rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i bde ba skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: It is pleasing because it produces the pleasure of auditory consciousness.

original: yid dang 'thad pa nyid kyi phyir dang / rtag tu snyid la 'bab pa nyid kyi phyir yid du 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: yid dang 'thad pa nyid kyi phyir dang / rtag tu snyid la 'bab pa nyid kyi phyir yid du 'ong ba'o //
translated: It is agreeable because it is in accord with the mind and because it is always acceptable to the mind.

original: rab tu mgu ba skye ba dang rjes su mthun pa nyid kyi phyir dga' bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: rab tu mgu ba skye ba dang rjes su mthun pa nyid kyi phyir dga' bar bya ba'o //
translated: It is delightful because it is in accord with the arising of satisfaction.

original: grong khyer du byung bas na grong khyer pa ste /
analyzed: grong khyer du byung bas na grong khyer pa ste /
translated: The word city is used because it occurs in the city.

original: grong la brten pa'i skye bo dam pa'i zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: grong la brten pa'i skye bo dam pa'i zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: It is the best of all beings who live in the city up to who live in the village.

original: mdzes pa la gsal ba zhes bya ba ni yi ge mdzes shing gsal bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mdzes pa la gsal ba zhes bya ba ni yi ge mdzes shing gsal bar gyur pa'o //
translated: It is beautiful because it is beautiful in form and clear in sound.

original: don mdzes pa nyid kyi phyir rnam par shes par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: don mdzes pa nyid kyi phyir rnam par shes par bya ba yin no //
translated: It is understandable because it is beautiful in meaning.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mnyan par bya ba ni thos pa dang rjes su mthun pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mnyan par bya ba ni thos pa dang rjes su mthun pa yin no //
translated: For that very reason, it is worth listening to because it is suitable for hearing.

original: don du gnyer ba'i sgo nas 'ga' zhig la yang gnas pa med pa'i phyir mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: don du gnyer ba'i sgo nas 'ga' zhig la yang gnas pa med pa'i phyir mi gnas pa'o //
translated: It is unobstructed because it is not obstructed by any desire for gain, etc.

original: skye bo thams cad mngon par 'dod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir mi 'gal ba ste /🔽rjes su mthun pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: skye bo thams cad mngon par 'dod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir mi 'gal ba ste / rjes su mthun pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: It is agreeable up to pleasing to all beings because it is desired by all beings.

original: rnam pa gang gi sgo nas kyang nyon mongs pa dag gis ma zin pa'i phyir mtha' med pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gang gi sgo nas kyang nyon mongs pa dag gis ma zin pa'i phyir mtha' med pa'o //
translated: It is endless because it is not seized by the afflictions in any way.

original: mi 'dod pa la sogs pa bzlog pas 'dod pa la sogs pa dag tu 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mi 'dod pa la sogs pa bzlog pas 'dod pa la sogs pa dag tu 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that desirable and so on are the opposites of undesirable, etc.

original: ting nge 'dzin dang rjes su mthun pa'am /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang rjes su mthun pa'am /
translated: It is in harmony with meditative concentration,

original: bden pa nyid kyis ma g-yengs pa'o //
analyzed: bden pa nyid kyis ma g-yengs pa'o //
translated: or it is undistracted by the truth.

original: gang gi phyir rnam pa thams cad du ting nge 'dzin skyed par byed pa de nyid kyi phyir ting nge 'dzin dang mthun pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnam pa thams cad du ting nge 'dzin skyed par byed pa de nyid kyi phyir ting nge 'dzin dang mthun pa yin no //
translated: It is in harmony with meditative concentration because it generates meditative concentration in every way.

original: des tshig kyal ba spangs nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: des tshig kyal ba spangs nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Having abandoned idle chitchat, etc.

original: don 'brel pa med cing don smad pa du ma 'dren par gyur pa'i tshig ni kyal ba yin la /
analyzed: don 'brel pa med cing don smad pa du ma 'dren par gyur pa'i tshig ni kyal ba yin la /
translated: Idle chitchat is speech that is unrelated to a purpose and that leads to many kinds of censurable actions.

original: de rjod par byed pa'i phyir tshig kyal ba ste /
analyzed: de rjod par byed pa'i phyir tshig kyal ba ste /
translated: It is idle chitchat because it causes that.

original: de spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: de spangs pa yin no //
translated: He has abandoned that.

original: ji ltar spangs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar spangs pa yin zhe na /
translated: How has he abandoned it?

original: de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, “He speaks at the proper time, etc.”

original: skabs dang ldan pa'i tshig brjod pa'i phyir dus su smra ba yin no //
analyzed: skabs dang ldan pa'i tshig brjod pa'i phyir dus su smra ba yin no //
translated: He speaks at the proper time because he speaks words that are appropriate to the occasion.

original: yod pa'i dngos po brjod pa'i phyir bden par smra ba yin no //
analyzed: yod pa'i dngos po brjod pa'i phyir bden par smra ba yin no //
translated: He speaks the truth because he speaks words that correspond to reality.

original: don dang ldan pa'i tshig brjod pa'i phyir don smra ba yin no //
analyzed: don dang ldan pa'i tshig brjod pa'i phyir don smra ba yin no //
translated: He speaks meaningfully because he speaks words that are related to the purpose.

original: dngos po'i rnag gi ngo bo rjod par byed pa'i phyir de kho na nyid smra ba yin no //
analyzed: dngos po'i rnag gi ngo bo rjod par byed pa'i phyir de kho na nyid smra ba yin no //
translated: He is a teacher of reality because he expresses the nature of things as they are.

original: chos rjod par byed pa'i phyir chos smra ba yin no //
analyzed: chos rjod par byed pa'i phyir chos smra ba yin no //
translated: He is a teacher of the Dharma because he expresses the Dharma.

original: shes pas yongs su bcad pa smra ba'i phyir brtags pa smra ba yin no //
analyzed: shes pas yongs su bcad pa smra ba'i phyir brtags pa smra ba yin no //
translated: He is a teacher of what is well analyzed because he expresses what is well analyzed by knowledge.

original: gzhan gyi rgyud kyi don dpyod par nus pa rig par byed pa yin pa'i phyir brtags pa dang @163a * //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rgyud kyi don dpyod par nus pa rig par byed pa yin pa'i phyir brtags pa dang @163a * //
translated: He is endowed with what is well analyzed because he is able to analyze the meaning in the mind of another.

original: ldan pa'o // nyan pa po skye bo mngon par 'dod pa'i dus su tshig brjod pa'i phyir dus su'o //
analyzed: ldan pa'o // nyan pa po skye bo mngon par 'dod pa'i dus su tshig brjod pa'i phyir dus su'o //
translated: He is timely because he expresses the word at the time desired by the audience.

original: yongs su bsdus pa'i don 'brel can rjod par byed pa'i phyir cal col ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su bsdus pa'i don 'brel can rjod par byed pa'i phyir cal col ma yin pa'o //
translated: He is not incoherent because he expresses the connected meaning of the collection.

original: rgyu las skyes pa dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir rgyu dang bcas pa yin no //🔽rig pa dang dpe dang ma bral bas na /
analyzed: rgyu las skyes pa dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir rgyu dang bcas pa yin no // rig pa dang dpe dang ma bral bas na /
translated: He is not without cause because he is endowed with the cause of birth.

original: lung dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: lung dang bcas pa'o //
translated: He is not without example because he is not without knowledge and scripture.

original: chos las ma g-yos pa nyid kyi phyir chos dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: chos las ma g-yos pa nyid kyi phyir chos dang ldan pa'o //
translated: He is not without Dharma because he does not deviate from the Dharma.

original: don dang 'byor pa nyid kyi phyir don dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: don dang 'byor pa nyid kyi phyir don dang ldan pa'o //
translated: It is meaningful because it is endowed with the meaning of reality and wealth.🔽Having abandoned buying and selling, he should practice with body, speech, and mind turned away from buying and selling.

original: nyo tshong spangs nas zhes bya ba la gos la sogs pa dag la brkam zhing chags pas yul dang rjes su mthun pa dang / dus dang rjes su mthun par rin yang bar nyos pa'i sgo nas len pa'i nyos pa yin zhing /
analyzed: nyo tshong spangs nas zhes bya ba la gos la sogs pa dag la brkam zhing chags pas yul dang rjes su mthun pa dang / dus dang rjes su mthun par rin yang bar nyos pa'i sgo nas len pa'i nyos pa yin zhing /
translated: Buying is the taking up of cloth and so on through greed and attachment, in accordance with the place and in accordance with the time, by paying the proper price.

original: rin shin tu mang po'i sgo nas yongs su gtong ba ni btsongs pa yin te /
analyzed: rin shin tu mang po'i sgo nas yongs su gtong ba ni btsongs pa yin te /
translated: Selling is the giving up of cloth and so on for a high price.

original: de spangs nas kun du spyod pa'i dus su lus dang ngag dang yid slar ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: de spangs nas kun du spyod pa'i dus su lus dang ngag dang yid slar ldog pa yin no //
translated: Having abandoned both of these, he should practice with body, speech, and mind turned away from buying and selling.🔽Having abandoned the deceit of weights and measures, he should practice with body, speech, and mind turned away from deceit.

original: des bre la sogs pa'i sgyu spangs nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gro la sogs pa 'jal ba'i snod ni 'dir bre yin la /🔽gser la sogs pa 'jal ba'i thabs su gyur ba ni srang yin zhing /
analyzed: des bre la sogs pa'i sgyu spangs nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gro la sogs pa 'jal ba'i snod ni 'dir bre yin la / gser la sogs pa 'jal ba'i thabs su gyur ba ni srang yin zhing /
translated: Here, a measure is a container for measuring grain and so on.🔽A scale is a device for measuring gold and so on.

original: 'ju ba'i rdzas mar dang til mar la sogs pa 'jal bar byed pa'i thabs su gyur pa ni 'jal byed yin te /
analyzed: 'ju ba'i rdzas mar dang til mar la sogs pa 'jal bar byed pa'i thabs su gyur pa ni 'jal byed yin te /
translated: A balance is a device for measuring substances that are weighed, such as butter, oil, and so on.

original: brel sogs pa gzhan slu bar byed pa bre la sogs pa'i sgyu yin pa de'i phyir smos pa yin no //🔽des gsug dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la gsug ni lkog tu gyur pa'i chad pa yin no //
analyzed: brel sogs pa gzhan slu bar byed pa bre la sogs pa'i sgyu yin pa de'i phyir smos pa yin no // des gsug dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la gsug ni lkog tu gyur pa'i chad pa yin no //
translated: The phrase he turns away from deceit, etc. refers to deceit, fraud, and dishonesty.🔽 Deceit is a hidden fault.

original: slu ba ni tha snyad du gyur pa'i sgo nas bslus nas nor len pa yin no //🔽chad pa ni tshar bcad pa sngon du song ba can gyi chad pa len pa yin no //
analyzed: slu ba ni tha snyad du gyur pa'i sgo nas bslus nas nor len pa yin no // chad pa ni tshar bcad pa sngon du song ba can gyi chad pa len pa yin no //
translated: Fraud is taking possession of another's property by means of a trick. 🔽 Dishonesty is taking possession of another's property by means of force.

original: gsug la sogs pa'i nor len pa bdag gir byed pa las slar ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: gsug la sogs pa'i nor len pa bdag gir byed pa las slar ldog pa yin no //
translated: He turns away from taking possession of another's property by means of deceit, etc. 🔽 The phrase he turns away from killing, etc. refers to killing, bondage, beating, threatening, and the like.

original: des gsod pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gsod pa ni gzhan gyi srog 'phrog par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: des gsod pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gsod pa ni gzhan gyi srog 'phrog par byed pa yin no //
translated: Killing is the taking of the life of another being.

original: bcing ba ni gdos dang lcags la sogs pa'i gnod pa'o ;
analyzed: bcing ba ni gdos dang lcags la sogs pa'i gnod pa'o ;
translated: Bondage is the infliction of harm by means of ropes, chains, etc.

original: / gcad pa ni lag pa la sogs pa yan lag dang nying lag dag go //
analyzed: / gcad pa ni lag pa la sogs pa yan lag dang nying lag dag go //
translated: Beating is the striking of another with sticks, fists, etc. 🔽 Threatening is the expression of an intention to harm another by saying, If you do this or that, I will have you killed, imprisoned, beaten, or fined.

original: phug pa ni rkang pa la sogs pa'i rus pa dag go //
analyzed: phug pa ni rkang pa la sogs pa'i rus pa dag go //
translated: The phrase he turns away from the ten unwholesome courses of action indicates that he turns away from all the unwholesome courses of action of body and speech.

original: rdeg pa ni lcag la sogs pa dag gis gzhan gdung ba skyed par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: rdeg pa ni lcag la sogs pa dag gis gzhan gdung ba skyed par byed pa yin te /
translated: Beating is the infliction of pain on others with a whip, etc.

original: gsod pa la sogs pa dag la mchog tu gzhol zhing spro bar byed pa @163b gang yin pa de spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: gsod pa la sogs pa dag la mchog tu gzhol zhing spro bar byed pa @163b gang yin pa de spangs pa yin no //
translated: He has abandoned the delight in and devotion to killing, etc.

original: snang ba dang bcas pa'i khyim du nyal ba spangs nas zhes bya ba ni mtshan mo khyim la sogs pa nyi ma dang zla ba ma yin pa'i snang ba dag dang ldan par nyal ba gang yin pa de yongs su spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: snang ba dang bcas pa'i khyim du nyal ba spangs nas zhes bya ba ni mtshan mo khyim la sogs pa nyi ma dang zla ba ma yin pa'i snang ba dag dang ldan par nyal ba gang yin pa de yongs su spangs pa yin no //
translated: Having abandoned sleeping in a place with light, he has abandoned sleeping in a place such as a house at night that is endowed with light that is not the sun or moon.

original: de yongs su dor ba bstan pa ni rgyags pa skye ba zlog par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yongs su dor ba bstan pa ni rgyags pa skye ba zlog par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The teaching of the abandonment of that is for the purpose of averting the arising of intoxication.

original: des zhing dag gi gzhi zhes bya ba la sogs pa las 'bru la sogs pa'i rdzas kyi rigs 'di la rten par byed ces bya ba'i dbang du byas nas zhing kho na gzhi yin pas na zhing gi gzhi yin te /
analyzed: des zhing dag gi gzhi zhes bya ba la sogs pa las 'bru la sogs pa'i rdzas kyi rigs 'di la rten par byed ces bya ba'i dbang du byas nas zhing kho na gzhi yin pas na zhing gi gzhi yin te /
translated: In the passage beginning with “the basis of fields,” etc., he is the basis of the class of substances such as grain, etc.

original: 'dis ni zhing la sogs pa las ldog par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni zhing la sogs pa las ldog par bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows the avoidance of fields, etc.

original: khyim gyi gzhi yongs su spangs pas yul de la chags pa spangs par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: khyim gyi gzhi yongs su spangs pas yul de la chags pa spangs par bstan pa yin no //
translated: The avoidance of attachment to that place is shown by the complete abandonment of the basis of the household.

original: tshong dus ni tshong khang yin te /
analyzed: tshong dus ni tshong khang yin te /
translated: The marketplace is the place of the shops.

original: de nyid kyi gzhi yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi gzhi yin te /
translated: That is the basis of the household.

original: de yongs su dor bar bstan pas tshong ba'i tha snyad du byed pa las ldog par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de yongs su dor bar bstan pas tshong ba'i tha snyad du byed pa las ldog par bstan pa yin no //
translated: The avoidance of the occupation of trade is shown by the teaching of the complete abandonment of that.

original: blang po che la sogs pa'i yongs su 'dzin pa rnam par 'khrug pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa de'i phyir yongs su 'dzin pa de spangs par bstan pa yin no //🔽bran dang bran mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: blang po che la sogs pa'i yongs su 'dzin pa rnam par 'khrug pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa de'i phyir yongs su 'dzin pa de spangs par bstan pa yin no // bran dang bran mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The avoidance of that possession is shown because it is the cause of the disturbance of the possession of great wealth, etc.🔽The five kinds of servants are well known.

original: bran rnam pa lngar grags pa de bzhin du bran mo yang de yin no //🔽las byed pa ni skyes bu zho shas 'tsho ba yin no //
analyzed: bran rnam pa lngar grags pa de bzhin du bran mo yang de yin no // las byed pa ni skyes bu zho shas 'tsho ba yin no //
translated: The female servants are the same as those.🔽The workers are the men who live on wages.

original: skyes bu rang gi byed pa la brten nas 'tsho bar byed pa gang yin pa de dag ni g-yog dag yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu rang gi byed pa la brten nas 'tsho bar byed pa gang yin pa de dag ni g-yog dag yin no //
translated: Those who live by depending on their own work are the attendants.

original: bud med ces bya ba la sogs pa la 'dis ni rnam pa gang dang gang gis kyang bud med yongs su 'dzin pa thams cad kyis thams cad du bkag pa smos pa yin no //
analyzed: bud med ces bya ba la sogs pa la 'dis ni rnam pa gang dang gang gis kyang bud med yongs su 'dzin pa thams cad kyis thams cad du bkag pa smos pa yin no //
translated: The phrase a woman, etc., indicates the prohibition of all forms of taking up a woman in any way whatsoever.

original: skyes bu nye du 'chad zhing gso ba la sogs pa yongs su gzung ba yang bkag cing 'dis ni nye du'i khye'u dang bu mo yongs su 'dzin pa yang bzlog pa yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu nye du 'chad zhing gso ba la sogs pa yongs su gzung ba yang bkag cing 'dis ni nye du'i khye'u dang bu mo yongs su 'dzin pa yang bzlog pa yin no //
translated: The prohibition of taking up a son, daughter, relatives, and so on also applies to the taking up of a son, daughter, relatives, and so on.

original: gser ni sa le sbram yin la /
analyzed: gser ni sa le sbram yin la /
translated: Gold is pure gold.

original: dngul ni dngul nyid yin te /
analyzed: dngul ni dngul nyid yin te /
translated: Silver is silver.

original: 'dis ni yul de bdag gir byed cing len pa spangs pa bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: 'dis ni yul de bdag gir byed cing len pa spangs pa bstan pa yin la /
translated: This indicates the avoidance of taking possession of and appropriating a country.

original: 'bras dang / nas dang / gro la sogs pa btsos pa ma yin pa de byin len byed pa rab tu byung ba'i tshul ma yin pa de bas na mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras dang / nas dang / gro la sogs pa btsos pa ma yin pa de byin len byed pa rab tu byung ba'i tshul ma yin pa de bas na mi bya'o //
translated: Rice, barley, wheat, etc., that have not been cooked are not to be accepted, because it is not the way of a renunciate to accept them. Therefore, do not do it.

original: zag cig pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gcig kyang de yin la za ba yang de yin pas na za gcig ste /
analyzed: zag cig pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gcig kyang de yin la za ba yang de yin pas na za gcig ste /
translated: The phrase one who eats only once a day, etc., indicates that one who eats only once a day is an one-meal-per-day eater.

original: de gang la yod pa de ni za gcig pa ste /🔽gang 'or gcig za ba'o //
analyzed: de gang la yod pa de ni za gcig pa ste / gang 'or gcig za ba'o //
translated: He who has this is one who eats in one part of the day.
He eats in one part of the day.

original: mo zhes bya ba ni nub mo'i zas kyi bya ba las rnam par ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: mo zhes bya ba ni nub mo'i zas kyi bya ba las rnam par ldog pa yin no //
translated: At night means he turns away from the activity of eating at night.

original: 'ga' zhig tu nyi ma phyed kyi 'og tu za bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu nyi ma phyed kyi 'og tu za bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If he eats in the afternoon,

original: dus ma yin pa'i zas las slar ldog pa smos pa yin no //
analyzed: dus ma yin pa'i zas las slar ldog pa smos pa yin no //
translated: he turns away from eating at improper times.

original: dus su bsod snyoms la sogs pa'i don du rgyu ba'i phyir dus su spyod pa ste /
analyzed: dus su bsod snyoms la sogs pa'i don du rgyu ba'i phyir dus su spyod pa ste /
translated: He is one who eats in one part of the day because he goes for alms at the proper time.

original: snga dro'i dus su spyod yul la spyod par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: snga dro'i dus su spyod yul la spyod par byed pa yin no //
translated: He goes to the village for alms in the morning.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dus su spyod pa'i sbyor ba dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dus su spyod pa'i sbyor ba dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: For this very reason, he is one who is endowed with the practice of eating at the proper time.

original: gang gi phyir dus ma yin par rnam pa gang gis kyang spyod par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dus ma yin par rnam pa gang gis kyang spyod par mi byed pa'o //
translated: He does not go at improper times in any way.

original: yang na dus su spyod pa'i sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: yang na dus su spyod pa'i sbyor ba ste /
translated: Or, he is one who is endowed with the practice of eating at the proper time.

original: rigs pa dang tshul yin la /
analyzed: rigs pa dang tshul yin la /
translated: This is the proper way.

original: de dang ldan pa ni rjes su song ba yin te /
analyzed: de dang ldan pa ni rjes su song ba yin te /
translated: He who is endowed with this is one who follows it.

original: dus su sbyong du zin kyang tshul ma yin pas mi spyod de 'on kyang ji ltar so sor thar ba'i mdo las bcom ldan 'das kyis rjes su gnang ba de bzhin du spyod par byed do //
analyzed: dus su sbyong du zin kyang tshul ma yin pas mi spyod de 'on kyang ji ltar so sor thar ba'i mdo las bcom ldan 'das kyis rjes su gnang ba de bzhin du spyod par byed do //
translated: Even if he obtains them at the proper time, he does not use them improperly.

original: lus ni lus po yin no //
analyzed: lus ni lus po yin no //
translated: The body is the physical frame.🔽Clothing is so called because it protects the body from the harm of wind, etc.🔽He is satisfied with whatever he obtains, and is not intent on obtaining better or finer clothing.🔽He is satisfied with whatever he obtains, and is not intent on obtaining better or finer clothing.🔽He is satisfied with whatever he obtains, and is not intent on obtaining better or finer clothing.

original: bgo ba ni lhags pa la sogs pa rnam par 'tshe ba las sring bar byed pa yin pas na lus la bgo ba'i chos gos ma rnyed pa rnyed pa des mgu zhing /
analyzed: bgo ba ni lhags pa la sogs pa rnam par 'tshe ba las sring bar byed pa yin pas na lus la bgo ba'i chos gos ma rnyed pa rnyed pa des mgu zhing /
translated: He is satisfied with whatever he obtains, and is not intent on obtaining better or finer clothing.

original: lhag pa dang gya nom pa la sogs pa mngon par 'dod pa med pa'i phyir rab tu mgu ba yin no //
analyzed: lhag pa dang gya nom pa la sogs pa mngon par 'dod pa med pa'i phyir rab tu mgu ba yin no //
translated: He is satisfied with whatever he obtains, and is not intent on obtaining better or finer clothing.🔽He is satisfied with whatever he obtains, and is not intent on obtaining better or finer clothing.🔽He is satisfied with whatever he obtains, and is not intent on obtaining better or finer clothing.🔽He is satisfied with whatever he obtains, and is not intent on obtaining better or finer clothing.🔽He is satisfied with whatever he obtains, and is not intent on obtaining better or finer clothing.🔽He is satisfied with whatever he obtains, and is not intent on obtaining better or finer clothing.🔽He is satisfied with whatever he obtains, and is not intent on obtaining better or finer clothing.🔽He is satisfied with whatever he obtains, and is not intent on obtaining better or finer clothing.🔽He is satisfied with whatever he obtains, and is not intent on obtaining better or finer clothing.🔽He is satisfied with whatever he obtains, and is not intent on obtaining better or finer clothing.🔽He is satisfied with whatever he obtains, and is not intent on obtaining better or finer clothing.🔽He is satisfied with whatever he obtains, and is not intent on obtaining better or finer clothing.🔽He is satisfied with whatever he obtains, and is not intent on obtaining better or finer clothing.🔽He is satisfied with whatever he obtains, and is not intent on obtaining better or finer clothing.🔽He is satisfied with whatever he obtains, and is not intent on obtaining better or finer clothing.🔽He is satisfied with whatever he obtains, and is not intent on obtaining better or finer clothing.🔽He is satisfied with whatever he obtains, and is not intent on obtaining better or finer clothing.🔽He is satisfied with whatever he obtains, and is not intent on obtaining better or finer clothing.

original: lto 'grangs pa zhes bya ba ni lto yongs su 'grangs par byed pa'i bsod snyoms 'grangs par byed pa tsam gyis bsod snyoms la rgyu bar byed pa des mgu ba yin no //
analyzed: lto 'grangs pa zhes bya ba ni lto yongs su 'grangs par byed pa'i bsod snyoms 'grangs par byed pa tsam gyis bsod snyoms la rgyu bar byed pa des mgu ba yin no //
translated: He is satisfied with whatever he obtains, and is not intent on obtaining better or finer clothing.

original: lhung bzed dang bcas /
analyzed: lhung bzed dang bcas /
translated: He is satisfied with whatever he obtains,

original: chos gos dang bcas te zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa chung ba nyid kyis snod gzhan med pa'i phyir dang / lhung bzed dang chos gos kyis lus gnas pa sgrub pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos gos dang bcas te zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa chung ba nyid kyis snod gzhan med pa'i phyir dang / lhung bzed dang chos gos kyis lus gnas pa sgrub pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Together with his robes means that because of his few desires, he has no other container, and because he accomplishes the support of the body with the alms bowl and robes.

original: bya gshog pa can zhes bya ba ni bya gshog la skyes par gyur ba'o //
analyzed: bya gshog pa can zhes bya ba ni bya gshog la skyes par gyur ba'o //
translated: The phrase like a bird with wings means that the bird is born with wings.

original: gshog pa ma gtogs pa'i 'dab ma ni rnus bu'i sgras brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: gshog pa ma gtogs pa'i 'dab ma ni rnus bu'i sgras brjod pa yin no //
translated: The word feathers refers to the wings, excluding the feathers.

original: dge sbyong dang bram ze kha cig ces bya ba la sogs pa la phyi rol gyi rab tu byung ba las rigs gzhan yin pa la 'dir dge sbyong gi sgra dang / bram ze'i rigs las khyim gyi gnas yongs su bor ba la bram ze'i sgra brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: dge sbyong dang bram ze kha cig ces bya ba la sogs pa la phyi rol gyi rab tu byung ba las rigs gzhan yin pa la 'dir dge sbyong gi sgra dang / bram ze'i rigs las khyim gyi gnas yongs su bor ba la bram ze'i sgra brjod pa yin no //
translated: Some ascetics and brahmins means that they are of a different class than the external renunciants. Here, the word ascetic refers to those of the ascetic class, and the word brahmin refers to those who have renounced the householder life of the brahmin class.

original: kha cig ces bya ba ni 'ga' zhig yin gyi thams cad kho na ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: kha cig ces bya ba ni 'ga' zhig yin gyi thams cad kho na ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The word some means that it is not all of them, but only some.

original: yon tan la sems pa sngon du song ba can gyi sems dang ba ni dad pa yin te /
analyzed: yon tan la sems pa sngon du song ba can gyi sems dang ba ni dad pa yin te /
translated: Faith is a clear mind that precedes the virtues.

original: des bza' ba la sogs pa byin pa gang yin pa de ni dang bas byin pa @164b dag yin no //
analyzed: des bza' ba la sogs pa byin pa gang yin pa de ni dang bas byin pa @164b dag yin no //
translated: That which is given with faith is given with a clear mind.

original: sa bon gyi tshogs ni sa bon gyi tshogs yin la /
analyzed: sa bon gyi tshogs ni sa bon gyi tshogs yin la /

original: 'byung po'i gnas ni 'byung po dag gi gzhi yin te skye ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung po'i gnas ni 'byung po dag gi gzhi yin te skye ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: A place of beings is a basis of beings, that is, a place of birth, and so on.

analyzed: kun nas rtsom pa ni sa bon 'debs pa la sogs pa'i bya bas rnam par dkrugs par gyur pa'o //

original: kun nas rtsom pa la rjes su brtson pa ni de la gzhol ba dang / de la sbyor zhing 'brel par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas rtsom pa la rjes su brtson pa ni de la gzhol ba dang / de la sbyor zhing 'brel par gyur pa'o //
translated: The effort to perform action is the inclination toward it, the application to it, and the connection with it.

original: rtsa ba'i sa bon ni sgre'u gsher dang yung ba la sogs pa'o //🔽sdong bu'i sa bon ni se'u dang lcang ma la sogs pa'o //

original: rtse mo'i sa bon ni bu ram shing la sogs pa'o //🔽bkas pa'i sa bon ni 'bru ma sha la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rtse mo'i sa bon ni bu ram shing la sogs pa'o //🔽bkas pa'i sa bon ni 'bru ma sha la sogs pa'o //

original: sa bon gyi sa bon ni gro la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sa bon gyi sa bon ni gro la sogs pa'o //

original: rtse mo'i sgras ni tshigs bstan pa yin la /

analyzed: 'bras bu'i snod bkas pa las sa bon byung ba ni bkas pa'i sa bon yin no //
translated: The seed of a seed is a seed that has come from a seed that is the receptacle of a fruit.
