original: / gnas skabs mnyam par spyod do zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa'i dbang po dag yul 'dzin pa'i gnas skabs la ji ltar nyes pa dang ldan par mi 'gyur ba de ltar mnyam por dpyod cing 'jog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: / gnas skabs mnyam par spyod do zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa'i dbang po dag yul 'dzin pa'i gnas skabs la ji ltar nyes pa dang ldan par mi 'gyur ba de ltar mnyam por dpyod cing 'jog par byed pa'o //
translated: He definitely guards the mind from unwholesome thoughts.

original: ji ltar gnas skabs mnyam par dpyod par 'gyur zhe na /🔽de mig gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar gnas skabs mnyam par dpyod par 'gyur zhe na /🔽de mig gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
translated: He definitely guards the mind from

original: mtshan mar mi 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni gsad pa la sogs pa nyid du mtshan mar mi 'dzin gyi /
analyzed: mtshan mar mi 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni gsad pa la sogs pa nyid du mtshan mar mi 'dzin gyi /
translated: The phrase “without apprehending signs” means that one does not apprehend the signs of killing, etc.

original: 'on kyang ji ltar gzugs de'i rang bzhin kho na bzhin du 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: 'on kyang ji ltar gzugs de'i rang bzhin kho na bzhin du 'dzin par byed do //
translated: However, one does apprehend the form just as it is in its essential nature.

original: mtshan mar 'dzin pa sngon du song ba can gyi dngos po gzhan dang 'brel pa'i ming gi mtshan ma 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan mar 'dzin pa sngon du song ba can gyi dngos po gzhan dang 'brel pa'i ming gi mtshan ma 'dzin pa ste /
translated: The apprehension of the sign of a name that is related to another entity that is preceded by the apprehension of a sign.

original: dper na autpala la sngon po dang 'brel pa'i mig dang / ri bong can dang 'brel pa'i gdong dang / pad ma dang 'brel pa'i lag pa zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dper na autpala la sngon po dang 'brel pa'i mig dang / ri bong can dang 'brel pa'i gdong dang / pad ma dang 'brel pa'i lag pa zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'o //
translated: For example, “blue” in relation to a lotus, “face” in relation to the moon, and “hand” in relation to a lotus.

original: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi rgyu mtshan gyis so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi rgyu mtshan gyis so //
translated: The phrase “for this reason” means “because of this cause.”

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ni 'dod chags la sogs pa yin la /🔽@169b sems rjes su 'jug pa ni sems la brten nas rab tu 'jug pa'am /
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ni 'dod chags la sogs pa yin la / @169b sems rjes su 'jug pa ni sems la brten nas rab tu 'jug pa'am /
translated: Evil, nonvirtuous entities are desire, etc.

original: sems yongs su dor bar mi byed pa yin no //
analyzed: sems yongs su dor bar mi byed pa yin no //
translated: The phrase “that which is associated with mind” means that which occurs in dependence on mind or that which does not abandon the mind.

original: gang la sems 'jug par 'gyur ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang la sems 'jug par 'gyur ba yin zhe na /
translated: What is the mind that engages?

original: mig gi dbang pos zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: mig gi dbang pos zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: The root text states, “through the eye faculty, and so on.”

original: mig gi dbang po'i sgo nas sdom pa ma yin pa de sdom pa de dang ldan zhing 'byor pa gang yin pa de la'o //
analyzed: mig gi dbang po'i sgo nas sdom pa ma yin pa de sdom pa de dang ldan zhing 'byor pa gang yin pa de la'o //
translated: The non-restraint that is associated with and possessed by the eye faculty is present.

original: ci zhig yod par gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig yod par gyur zhe na /
translated: What is present?

original: smras pa / brnab sems dang gnod sems yod par gyur na'o //
analyzed: smras pa / brnab sems dang gnod sems yod par gyur na'o //
translated: It is said: “Covetousness and malice are present.”

original: yul gang la brnab sems dang gnod sems 'byung ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: yul gang la brnab sems dang gnod sems 'byung ba yin zhe na /
translated: What is the object of covetousness and malice?

original: 'jig rten te nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'i yul la'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten te nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'i yul la'o //
translated: The object is the world, that is, the five appropriated aggregates.

original: gzhan gyi yul la chags pa ni brnab sems yin la mngon par 'dod pa'i don ma 'byor pa sngon du song ba can ni yid mi bde ba yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi yul la chags pa ni brnab sems yin la mngon par 'dod pa'i don ma 'byor pa sngon du song ba can ni yid mi bde ba yin te /
translated: Covetousness is attachment to the possessions of others. Mental dissatisfaction is preceded by the non-acquisition of a desired object.

original: brnab sems dang yid mi bde ba ni brnab sems dang yid mi bde ba'o //
analyzed: brnab sems dang yid mi bde ba ni brnab sems dang yid mi bde ba'o //
translated: Covetousness and mental dissatisfaction are covetousness and mental dissatisfaction.

original: de yod par gyur na dam pa rnams kyis smad par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir sdig pa dag yin la /
analyzed: de yod par gyur na dam pa rnams kyis smad par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir sdig pa dag yin la /
translated: When they are present, they are evil because they are condemned by the virtuous.

original: 'dod pa ma yin pa'i 'gro ba 'dod par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir mi dge ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa ma yin pa'i 'gro ba 'dod par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir mi dge ba yin no //
translated: It is nonvirtuous because it causes one to desire a rebirth that one does not want.

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos de dag sdom pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos de dag sdom pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is virtue because it restrains those sinful, nonvirtuous dharmas.

original: mi skye bar bya ba'i phyir nan tan du byed cing sgrub par byed pa'am /
analyzed: mi skye bar bya ba'i phyir nan tan du byed cing sgrub par byed pa'am /
translated: One practices and accomplishes it in order to prevent their arising.

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i rgyu mtshan 'dzin pa la sogs pa dbang du byed pa'i tshul de sdom pa'i phyir nan tan du byed pa yin no //
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i rgyu mtshan 'dzin pa la sogs pa dbang du byed pa'i tshul de sdom pa'i phyir nan tan du byed pa yin no //
translated: Or, one practices it in order to restrain the method of bringing the causes of incorrect mental activity under control, such as the holding of signs, etc.

original: gnod pa med pa'i bde ba zhes bya ba ni rang gi sems shin tu yongs su mgu bar gyur pa'i bde ba nyams su myong bar gyur pa'o //🔽mngon par 'dod pa'i gnas su 'gro bar byed pa ni 'gro ba ste /🔽mngon du phyogs nas 'gros byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gnod pa med pa'i bde ba zhes bya ba ni rang gi sems shin tu yongs su mgu bar gyur pa'i bde ba nyams su myong bar gyur pa'o // mngon par 'dod pa'i gnas su 'gro bar byed pa ni 'gro ba ste / mngon du phyogs nas 'gros byed pa yin no //
translated: The phrase “without injury” means that one experiences a happiness that is a complete satisfaction of one’s own mind.🔽“Going” is the act of approaching a desired place.

original: 'ong ba ni phyir ldog pa'o //
analyzed: 'ong ba ni phyir ldog pa'o //
translated: “Coming” is the act of returning from that place.

original: shes bzhin du gnas par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni shes rab sngon du byed pa'i sgo nas 'gro ba dang 'ong ba'i rgyu mtshan la kha na ma tho ba la kun du spyod pa ma yin pa'o //🔽mngon du phyogs pas lta bar byed pa ni lta ba yin la /
analyzed: shes bzhin du gnas par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni shes rab sngon du byed pa'i sgo nas 'gro ba dang 'ong ba'i rgyu mtshan la kha na ma tho ba la kun du spyod pa ma yin pa'o // mngon du phyogs pas lta bar byed pa ni lta ba yin la /
translated: “One abides with full awareness” means that one does not engage in the causes of coming and going that are reprehensible due to the fault of being the basis of heedlessness.🔽“One looks ahead” means that one looks straight ahead.

original: zur gyis lta bar byed pa ni kun du lta ba yin no //
analyzed: zur gyis lta bar byed pa ni kun du lta ba yin no //
translated: “One looks all around” means that one looks to the side.

original: bskum pa ni dpung ba la sogs pa'i yan lag sdud par byed pa'o //
analyzed: bskum pa ni dpung ba la sogs pa'i yan lag sdud par byed pa'o //
translated: “One bends” means that one draws in the limbs such as the arms.

original: brkyang ba ni don rab tu grags pa yin no //
analyzed: brkyang ba ni don rab tu grags pa yin no //
translated: “One stretches” is well known in the world.

original: sbyar ma ni gos kyi mchog yin no //
analyzed: sbyar ma ni gos kyi mchog yin no //
translated: “One wears the lower robe evenly” means that one wears the lower robe evenly on the upper part of the body.

original: chos gos ni gos lhag ma dag yin no //
analyzed: chos gos ni gos lhag ma dag yin no //
translated: “One wears the Dharma robes” means that one wears the remaining robes.

original: 'gro ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni spyod lam bzhi ston pa yin no //
analyzed: 'gro ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni spyod lam bzhi ston pa yin no //
translated: “One goes” and so on indicate the four modes of deportment.

original: gnyid las gyur pa'i rmya ba ni gnyid kyis rmya ba'o//
analyzed: gnyid las gyur pa'i rmya ba ni gnyid kyis rmya ba'o//
translated: “One is not overcome by sleep” means that one does not fall asleep.

original: @170a * // lus rmya bas gzir ba ni rmya ba de cung zad gnyid log pas so sor bsal cing yongs su spangs pa ste /
analyzed: @170a * // lus rmya bas gzir ba ni rmya ba de cung zad gnyid log pas so sor bsal cing yongs su spangs pa ste /
translated: “One is not overcome by drowsiness” means that one is not afflicted by the heaviness of the body and one removes and abandons that drowsiness by falling asleep a little.

original: de la shes bzhin du gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de la shes bzhin du gnas pa yin no //
translated: He abides with full awareness.

original: shes bzhin ni shes rab yin no //
analyzed: shes bzhin ni shes rab yin no //
translated: Full awareness is wisdom.

original: phongs pa med pa'i bde ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: phongs pa med pa'i bde ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The pleasure of non-dejection, etc.

original: yul rnam pa sna tshogs la yid ltung bar byed pa ni phongs pa yin te /🔽phongs pa ma yin pa ni phongs pa med pa ste /
analyzed: yul rnam pa sna tshogs la yid ltung bar byed pa ni phongs pa yin te / phongs pa ma yin pa ni phongs pa med pa ste /
translated: Dejection is the sinking of the mind into various objects.

original: yul gcig la 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: yul gcig la 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: Non-dejection is the opposite of that, i.e., the mind is engaged in one object.

original: bde ba de nyid so sor myong bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba de nyid so sor myong bar gyur pa'o //
translated: That pleasure is experienced individually.

original: dben par zhes bya ba ni lus dang sems dben pa dang ldan pa'o //🔽'di la nyal bar byed pa'i phyir mal yin no //
analyzed: dben par zhes bya ba ni lus dang sems dben pa dang ldan pa'o // 'di la nyal bar byed pa'i phyir mal yin no //
translated: Solitary means endowed with physical and mental solitude.🔽It is a bed because one lies down on it.

original: 'di la 'dug par byed pa'i phyir stan yin no //
analyzed: 'di la 'dug par byed pa'i phyir stan yin no //
translated: It is a seat because one sits on it.

original: dgon pa ni grong las rgyang grags kyi mthar gyur pa'o //🔽skyil mo krung bcas pa ni skyil mo krung bcas par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: dgon pa ni grong las rgyang grags kyi mthar gyur pa'o // skyil mo krung bcas pa ni skyil mo krung bcas par gyur pa'o //
translated: A forest is a place that is a krośa away from a village.🔽He sits cross-legged means he is seated cross-legged.

original: lus drang por bsrang zhes bya ba ni lus bsrang ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: lus drang por bsrang zhes bya ba ni lus bsrang ba nyid yin te /
translated: He straightens his body means he straightens his body.

original: rtsib logs kyi phyogs nas brtsams nas lto brgyas par byas pa'o //
analyzed: rtsib logs kyi phyogs nas brtsams nas lto brgyas par byas pa'o //
translated: Beginning from the side, it fills the belly.

original: mngon du gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni mngon du phyogs par gyur pa ste dran pa mngon du gzhag pa yin te /
analyzed: mngon du gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni mngon du phyogs par gyur pa ste dran pa mngon du gzhag pa yin te /
translated: The term made to appear means made to face, made to be remembered.

original: rnal 'byor pas sna'i rtse mo la mig gis bltas te bsam gtan bya'o zhes 'jig rten na rab tu grags pa yod pas na sna'i rtse mo la mig gtad na dran pa yang sgom par byed pa'i don de nyid la gzhag par 'gyur ba de'i phyir 'dis ni
analyzed: rnal 'byor pas sna'i rtse mo la mig gis bltas te bsam gtan bya'o zhes 'jig rten na rab tu grags pa yod pas na sna'i rtse mo la mig gtad na dran pa yang sgom par byed pa'i don de nyid la gzhag par 'gyur ba de'i phyir 'dis ni
translated: Since it is well known in the world that the yogi should practice concentration by looking at the tip of the nose with the eyes, when the eyes are directed to the tip of the nose, mindfulness is also placed on that object of meditation. For this reason,

original: lus kyi gnas skabs kyi bye brag phyin ci ma log par rtsom pa'i rgyu mtshan ting nge 'dzin gyi yan lag ces bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus kyi gnas skabs kyi bye brag phyin ci ma log par rtsom pa'i rgyu mtshan ting nge 'dzin gyi yan lag ces bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: it is taught that the concentration factor is the reason for correctly undertaking the distinctions in the condition of the body.

original: brnab sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: brnab sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In covetousness, etc.,

original: brnab sems ni pha rol po'i yul 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: brnab sems ni pha rol po'i yul 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: covetousness has the characteristic of desiring another's property.

original: 'jig rten zhes bya ba ni phung po lnga'i rang bzhin can yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten zhes bya ba ni phung po lnga'i rang bzhin can yin no //
translated: The world is of the nature of the five aggregates.

original: spangs pa ni rengs par byed pa ste /
analyzed: spangs pa ni rengs par byed pa ste /
translated: Abandonment is the state of being paralyzed.

original: 'dir spangs pa'i sgras bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir spangs pa'i sgras bstan pa yin no //
translated: Here, the word “abandonment” is used.

original: brnab sems dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir mngon sum du gyur pa'i sgo nas brnab sems dang bral ba'i sems yin pa de'i phyir de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: brnab sems dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir mngon sum du gyur pa'i sgo nas brnab sems dang bral ba'i sems yin pa de'i phyir de skad ces bya'o //
translated: “Free from covetousness” means that the mind is free from covetousness because it is manifest.

original: rgyun gyi sems de la mngon du phyogs pa'i phyir mang du byas pa zhes bstan to //
analyzed: rgyun gyi sems de la mngon du phyogs pa'i phyir mang du byas pa zhes bstan to //
translated: It is said to be “cultivated much” because that mind-stream is directed towards it.

original: brnab sems kyi sems yongs su spyod par byed do zhes bya ba ni brnab sems spang pa'i phyir shin tu 'brel par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: brnab sems kyi sems yongs su spyod par byed do zhes bya ba ni brnab sems spang pa'i phyir shin tu 'brel par gyur pa'o //
translated: “One experiences a mind free from covetousness” means that one is very much connected to the abandonment of covetousness.🔽Malice is the characteristic of aversion towards sentient beings.

original: gnod sems ni sems @170b can la rnam par zhe sdang pa'i mtshan nyid can dang / rmugs pa ni lus dang sems las su mi rung ba dang / rmongs par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gnod sems ni sems @170b can la rnam par zhe sdang pa'i mtshan nyid can dang / rmugs pa ni lus dang sems las su mi rung ba dang / rmongs par gyur pa'o //
translated: Drowsiness is the unserviceability of body and mind.

original: gnyid ni sems mngon par bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: gnyid ni sems mngon par bsdus pa ste /
translated: Sleep is the complete withdrawal of mind.

original: 'di gnyis ni phan tshun rjes su mthun pa nyid kyi phyir sgrib pa gcig tu rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di gnyis ni phan tshun rjes su mthun pa nyid kyi phyir sgrib pa gcig tu rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: These two are established as one obstruction because they are mutually compatible.

original: rgod pa ni sems ma zhi ba yin la /
analyzed: rgod pa ni sems ma zhi ba yin la /
translated: Agitation is an unpeaceful state of mind.

original: 'gyod pa ni sems rnam par skyo bar gyur pa ste /
analyzed: 'gyod pa ni sems rnam par skyo bar gyur pa ste /
translated: Regret is a state of mental distress.

original: 'di gnyis kyang phan tshun rjes su mthun pa kho na nyid kyi phyir sgrib pa gcig tu rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di gnyis kyang phan tshun rjes su mthun pa kho na nyid kyi phyir sgrib pa gcig tu rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: These two are also established as one obstruction because they are mutually compatible.

original: yang na mi mthun pa'i phyogs gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / rten gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / bya ba gcig byed pa nyid kyi phyir sgrib pa gcig nyid yin no //
analyzed: yang na mi mthun pa'i phyogs gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / rten gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / bya ba gcig byed pa nyid kyi phyir sgrib pa gcig nyid yin no //
translated: Or, they are one obstruction because they are the same adverse factor, they have the same basis, and they perform the same function.

original: rmugs pa dang gnyid dag ni snang ba'i 'du shes mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos lnga'i rten te /
analyzed: rmugs pa dang gnyid dag ni snang ba'i 'du shes mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos lnga'i rten te /
translated: Dullness and sleepiness are the basis of five dharmas that are adverse to the perception of light:

original: le lo dang / dga' ba med pa dang / glal ba dang / zas la mi dad pa dang / sems zhum pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: le lo dang / dga' ba med pa dang / glal ba dang / zas la mi dad pa dang / sems zhum pa nyid yin la /
translated: laziness, lack of joy, yawning, lack of faith in food, and mental depression.

original: gnyi ga yang sems zhum pa nyid skyed par byed pa zhes bya ba gcig byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang sems zhum pa nyid skyed par byed pa zhes bya ba gcig byed pa yin no //
translated: Both cause the generation of a depressed mind.

original: rgod pa dang 'gyod pa dag kyang chos bzhi'i rten byed pa yin te /
analyzed: rgod pa dang 'gyod pa dag kyang chos bzhi'i rten byed pa yin te /
translated: Excitement and regret are the basis of four dharmas.

original: nye du'i rnam par rtog pa dang / ljongs la rnam par rtog pa dang mi 'chi ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang / sngon dgod pa dang / dga' ba dang / rtse ba dang / kun du spyod pa dang rjes su dran pa yin la /
analyzed: nye du'i rnam par rtog pa dang / ljongs la rnam par rtog pa dang mi 'chi ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang / sngon dgod pa dang / dga' ba dang / rtse ba dang / kun du spyod pa dang rjes su dran pa yin la /
translated: They are the discursive thoughts of relatives, the discursive thoughts of one’s homeland, the discursive thoughts of death, and the recollection of past play, joy, and enjoyment.

original: 'di gnyi ga yang sems ma zhi ba skyes pa la rab tu 'jug pa nyid yin pa'i phyir yang zhi gnas kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs bya ba gcig byed pa yin no //🔽re ba dang bral ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'di gnyi ga yang sems ma zhi ba skyes pa la rab tu 'jug pa nyid yin pa'i phyir yang zhi gnas kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs bya ba gcig byed pa yin no // re ba dang bral ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Both of these are the cause of the non-pacification of the mind. Therefore, they are the single activity of being the opponent of samatha.🔽Hope, etc.

original: ae ma'o bdag gi don 'di shes par bya'o zhes bya ba ni rnam pa 'di zhes bya ba'i dngos po dag la thog mar re ba skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ae ma'o bdag gi don 'di shes par bya'o zhes bya ba ni rnam pa 'di zhes bya ba'i dngos po dag la thog mar re ba skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: Hope is the initial desire for a thing that is thought to be beneficial, such as, “Oh, I will know this meaning.”

original: don ji lta ba bzhin du khong du ma chud pa las ci don 'di lta bu yin nam 'on te 'di lta bu ma yin zhes the tshom skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don ji lta ba bzhin du khong du ma chud pa las ci don 'di lta bu yin nam 'on te 'di lta bu ma yin zhes the tshom skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: From not understanding the meaning as it really is, doubt arises: “Is this the meaning or is it not the meaning? ”

original: re ba dang / the tshom dang bral zhing yongs su spangs pa gang yin pa de ni re ba dang bral ba dang ; the tshom dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: re ba dang / the tshom dang bral zhing yongs su spangs pa gang yin pa de ni re ba dang bral ba dang ; the tshom dang bral ba'o //
translated: The absence of hope and the absence of doubt are the absence of hope and the absence of doubt in regard to that.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dad pa la sogs pa dge ba'i chos dag la ci lta ci lta bu can ni nges pa'i don khong du chud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dad pa la sogs pa dge ba'i chos dag la ci lta ci lta bu can ni nges pa'i don khong du chud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For this very reason, faith and so on, the wholesome factors, are the cause of the purification of the mental disposition, because of the understanding of the meaning as it really is.

original: ci lta ci lta bu'i tshig ni the tshom kho na'i rnam grangs brjod pa yin la /
analyzed: ci lta ci lta bu'i tshig ni the tshom kho na'i rnam grangs brjod pa yin la /
translated: The phrase “as it really is” is a synonym for doubt.

original: ci lta ci ltar gang la yod pa de ni ci lta ci lta bu can yin te /🔽ci lta ci lta bu can med @171a * //
analyzed: ci lta ci ltar gang la yod pa de ni ci lta ci lta bu can yin te / ci lta ci lta bu can med @171a * //
translated: That which exists in a certain way is “as it really is” .

original: pa ni ci lta ci lta bu can ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: pa ni ci lta ci lta bu can ma yin pa'o //
translated: That which does not exist in a certain way is “not as it really is” .

original: sems yongs su sbyong ba ni 'dir yang the tshom shin tu spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems yongs su sbyong ba ni 'dir yang the tshom shin tu spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The purification of the mental disposition here is due to the complete abandonment of doubt.

original: 'phags pa'i lam dang de'i sbyor ba dge ba'i rtsa ba dag la sgrib par byed pa'i phyir sgrib pa yin te /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam dang de'i sbyor ba dge ba'i rtsa ba dag la sgrib par byed pa'i phyir sgrib pa yin te /
translated: They are obscurations because they obscure the ārya path and the roots of virtue that are preparatory to it.

original: sgrib pa de dag ni nges pa nyid du rnam par 'ching bar byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrib pa de dag ni nges pa nyid du rnam par 'ching bar byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: These obscurations are definitely binding,

original: bun zhes bya ba ni skyin po blangs pa'i tshul gyis dbyig la sogs pa len pa yin no //🔽las kyi mtha' zhes bya ba ni s'a lu la sogs pa las kyi mtha' 'am /
analyzed: bun zhes bya ba ni skyin po blangs pa'i tshul gyis dbyig la sogs pa len pa yin no // las kyi mtha' zhes bya ba ni s'a lu la sogs pa las kyi mtha' 'am /
translated: Borrowing means taking possession of gold, etc., in the manner of a loan.🔽The limit of action means being engaged in the limit of action such as rice cultivation,

original: tshong pa'i tha snyad du byed pa la rab tu sbyor bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: tshong pa'i tha snyad du byed pa la rab tu sbyor bar byed pa yin no //
translated: or being engaged in the conventions of commerce.

original: 'byor par gyur na zhes bya ba ni 'byor ba yongs su rdzogs par gyur na'o //
analyzed: 'byor par gyur na zhes bya ba ni 'byor ba yongs su rdzogs par gyur na'o //
translated: When one has become prosperous means when one has fully acquired prosperity.

original: rang gi nor tsam zhes bya ba la rang gi nor ni gter yin la /
analyzed: rang gi nor tsam zhes bya ba la rang gi nor ni gter yin la /
translated: One’s own wealth means one’s own treasure.

original: bud med ni chung ma'o //
analyzed: bud med ni chung ma'o //
translated: Women means wives.

original: tsam gyi sgra ni nyung ngu'i nye bar mtshon pa yin no //
analyzed: tsam gyi sgra ni nyung ngu'i nye bar mtshon pa yin no //
translated: The word “only” indicates a small amount.

original: yod pa ni thob par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: yod pa ni thob par gyur pa'o //
translated: Possession means having obtained.

original: bde ba ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po'o //
analyzed: bde ba ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po'o //
translated: Happiness means the five collections of consciousness.

original: yid dga' bar 'gyur ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o ;
analyzed: yid dga' bar 'gyur ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o ;
translated: The mind is the mental consciousness.

original: / nad kun nas skyes pa'i phyir nad bu can no //
analyzed: / nad kun nas skyes pa'i phyir nad bu can no //
translated: The one who is sick is the one who is born with the disease.

original: nad ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: nad ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal lo //
translated: The disease is suffering because it is the cause of suffering.

original: nad tshabs che ba zhes bya ba ni nad rgyas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: nad tshabs che ba zhes bya ba ni nad rgyas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The severe disease is the one that is widespread.

original: lus la khyab par byed ces bya ba ni non par byed pa ste /
analyzed: lus la khyab par byed ces bya ba ni non par byed pa ste /
translated: It pervades the body means it is all-pervasive.

original: shin tu lci ba skyed par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu lci ba skyed par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It produces heaviness.

original: gnod par byed ces bya ba ni nad skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gnod par byed ces bya ba ni nad skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: It is harmful because it produces disease.

original: nad med pa ni nad dang bral bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: nad med pa ni nad dang bral bar gyur pa'o //
translated: Health is the absence of disease.

original: nad med pa thob pa'i phyir stobs dang ldan par gyur pa'o //🔽bran zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: nad med pa thob pa'i phyir stobs dang ldan par gyur pa'o // bran zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The attainment of health is the possession of strength.

original: bran rnam pa lnga nyid ni mdo 'di kho na las bshad cing bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bran rnam pa lnga nyid ni mdo 'di kho na las bshad cing bstan pa yin no //
translated: The five kinds of servants are explained and taught in this very sūtra.

original: mngag gzhug pa zhes bya ba ni nor gyis gsos pa'i mngag gzhug byed pa la bya'o //
analyzed: mngag gzhug pa zhes bya ba ni nor gyis gsos pa'i mngag gzhug byed pa la bya'o //
translated: The servant who is paid wages is the one who is hired for a price.

original: bsgo ba zhes bya ba ni nang mi dang chos grogs la sogs pa la bya'o //
analyzed: bsgo ba zhes bya ba ni nang mi dang chos grogs la sogs pa la bya'o //
translated: The term ordered refers to one's family members, Dharma friends, etc.🔽The term not to be employed refers to those who are not free, such as the virtuous.🔽The term to be employed refers to those who are free, such as the virtuous.

original: bkol bar bya ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni ya rabs la sogs pa rang dbang can ma yin pa dag go //🔽rigs pa'i sgo nas 'dod pas 'jug pa ni dbang byed pa yin te /
analyzed: bkol bar bya ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni ya rabs la sogs pa rang dbang can ma yin pa dag go // rigs pa'i sgo nas 'dod pas 'jug pa ni dbang byed pa yin te /
translated: The term to be employed refers to those who are free, such as the virtuous.🔽The term to be employed refers to those who are free, such as the virtuous.🔽The term to be employed refers to those who are free, such as the virtuous.🔽The term to be employed refers to those who are free, such as the virtuous.🔽The term to be employed refers to those who are free, such as the virtuous.🔽The term to be employed refers to those who are free, such as the virtuous.🔽The term to be employed refers to those who are free, such as the virtuous.

original: dbang phyug gi mchog gis las de gzhan du 'gro ba'i nus pa med cing rtag tu sten par byed pa yang ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: dbang phyug gi mchog gis las de gzhan du 'gro ba'i nus pa med cing rtag tu sten par byed pa yang ma yin pa'o //
translated: The term to be employed refers to those who are free, such as the virtuous.

original: de bas na mngag gzhug pa la sogs pa nor gyis 'tsho ba bzhi po 'di dag ni phyi ma phyi ma zhing khyad par du 'phags pa yin par rig par bya'o //🔽dam du bcings pa ni shin tu bcings @171b par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na mngag gzhug pa la sogs pa nor gyis 'tsho ba bzhi po 'di dag ni phyi ma phyi ma zhing khyad par du 'phags pa yin par rig par bya'o // dam du bcings pa ni shin tu bcings @171b par gyur pa'o //
translated: The term to be employed refers to those who are free, such as the virtuous.🔽The term to be employed refers to those who are free, such as the virtuous.🔽The term to be employed refers to those who are free, such as the virtuous.🔽The term to be employed refers to those who are free, such as the virtuous.🔽The term to be employed refers to those who are free, such as the virtuous.🔽The term to be employed refers to those who are free, such as the virtuous.🔽The term to be employed refers to those who are free, such as the virtuous.🔽The term to be employed refers to those who are free, such as the virtuous.🔽The term to be employed refers to those who are free, such as the virtuous.🔽The term to be employed refers to those who are free, such as the virtuous.🔽The term to be employed refers to those who are free, such as the virtuous.🔽The term to be employed refers to those who are free, such as the virtuous.

original: bcings pa'i dus na rnam par 'tshe ba med pa'i phyir bkra shis pa'o //🔽de'i rgyu mtshan gyi dus phyis kyang rnam par 'tshe ba med pa'i phyir bde ba'o //
analyzed: bcings pa'i dus na rnam par 'tshe ba med pa'i phyir bkra shis pa'o //🔽de'i rgyu mtshan gyi dus phyis kyang rnam par 'tshe ba med pa'i phyir bde ba'o //
translated: The term to be employed refers to those who are free, such as the virtuous.🔽The term to be employed

original: nor yongs su btang ba med pa'i phyir god med pa'o //
analyzed: nor yongs su btang ba med pa'i phyir god med pa'o //
translated: It is without loss, because there is no loss of wealth.🔽It is without fear, because it is the state of fearlessness in the face of the fearful.

original: 'jigs pa las zhes bya ba de ni de 'jigs pa dang bcas pa'i gnas dag las bde bar gyur ces bya ba ni 'tshe ba med pa'i gnas yin no //🔽ji ltar bun du gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /🔽bun du gyur pa ni brnab sems kyi sgrib pa yin te /
analyzed: 'jigs pa las zhes bya ba de ni de 'jigs pa dang bcas pa'i gnas dag las bde bar gyur ces bya ba ni 'tshe ba med pa'i gnas yin no // ji ltar bun du gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / bun du gyur pa ni brnab sems kyi sgrib pa yin te /
translated: It is without anxiety, because it is the state of non-violence.

original: de yod na 'dod pa'i khams las ma 'das pa'i phyir ro //🔽nad ni gnod sems kyi sgrib pa yin te /
analyzed: de yod na 'dod pa'i khams las ma 'das pa'i phyir ro // nad ni gnod sems kyi sgrib pa yin te /
translated: It is without debt, because it is the state of freedom from the debt of the four debts.

original: gnod pa byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽bran du gyur pa ni rmugs pa dang gnyid kyi sgrib pa yin te /🔽sems rang dbang med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnod pa byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro // bran du gyur pa ni rmugs pa dang gnyid kyi sgrib pa yin te / sems rang dbang med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is without illness, because it is the state of freedom from the illness of the five poisons.🔽It is without slavery, because it is the state of freedom from the slavery of the six realms.

original: 'ching bar gyur pa la ni rgod pa dang 'gyod pa'i sgrib pa yin te /
analyzed: 'ching bar gyur pa la ni rgod pa dang 'gyod pa'i sgrib pa yin te /
translated: It is without bondage, because it is the state of freedom from the bondage of the seven abodes of consciousness.🔽It is without danger, because it is the state of freedom from the dangers of the eight worldly concerns.

original: 'dod pa'i khams las 'das pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bar du gcod par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams las 'das pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bar du gcod par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they obstruct the meditative concentration that is conducive to transcending the desire realm.

original: 'jigs pa ni the tshom gyi sgrib pa yin te /
analyzed: 'jigs pa ni the tshom gyi sgrib pa yin te /
translated: Fear is the obscuration of doubt,

original: ma nges pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyis 'khor ba pa'i 'jigs pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma nges pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyis 'khor ba pa'i 'jigs pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the cause of fear for those in cyclic existence due to its indeterminate nature.

original: yang na bu lon la sogs pa ni gnod sems nas the tshom gyi bar dag yin no //
analyzed: yang na bu lon la sogs pa ni gnod sems nas the tshom gyi bar dag yin no //
translated: Alternatively, debt, etc., are the mental afflictions from malice up to doubt.

original: nye bar nyon mongs par byed pa zhes bya ba ni dri ma can du byed pa'am /
analyzed: nye bar nyon mongs par byed pa zhes bya ba ni dri ma can du byed pa'am /
translated: The term “afflict” means to defile or

original: nye bar gdung bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: nye bar gdung bar byed pa yin no //
translated: to torment.

original: sems nye bar nyon mongs pa nyid kyi phyir shes rab nyam chung ba ste /
analyzed: sems nye bar nyon mongs pa nyid kyi phyir shes rab nyam chung ba ste /
translated: Because the mind is afflicted, wisdom is weak.

original: de byed pa'i phyir shes rab nyam chung bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de byed pa'i phyir shes rab nyam chung bar byed pa'o //
translated: Because it causes that, it weakens wisdom.

original: dge ba'i chos skye ba'i bgegs byed pa yin pa'i phyir gnod pa'i phyogs yin te /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos skye ba'i bgegs byed pa yin pa'i phyir gnod pa'i phyogs yin te /
translated: It is a state of harm because it obstructs the arising of virtuous qualities.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mya ngan las 'das pa dang mi mthun pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mya ngan las 'das pa dang mi mthun pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is incompatible with nirvana,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam du 'jug par byed pa'i gegs byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam du 'jug par byed pa'i gegs byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it obstructs the entry to the path of nirvana.

original: 'dod pa dag las dben pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bsam gtan dang po nye bar bsgrubs nas gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa dag las dben pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bsam gtan dang po nye bar bsgrubs nas gnas pa yin no //
translated: The first absorption is attained and abides in seclusion from sense objects, etc.

original: khyad par ji lta bu dang ldan pa'i bsam gtan dang po zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par ji lta bu dang ldan pa'i bsam gtan dang po zhe na /
translated: What is the distinctive feature of the first absorption?

original: 'dod pa dag las dben pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'dod pa dag las dben pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: It is said to be “in seclusion from sense objects,” etc.

original: 'dun pa'i 'dod chags la 'dir 'dod pa'i sgras bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dun pa'i 'dod chags la 'dir 'dod pa'i sgras bstan pa yin no //
translated: Desire is indicated here by the word “sense objects.”

original: yul rnam pa sna tshogs la rab tu 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir 'dod pa dag ces bya ba mang po'i tshig tu byas pa yin @172a * //
analyzed: yul rnam pa sna tshogs la rab tu 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir 'dod pa dag ces bya ba mang po'i tshig tu byas pa yin @172a * //
translated: The word “sense objects” is used in the plural because it refers to the various kinds of objects.

original: la ; 'dod pa'i sgras ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po dag bzung ba yin te /
analyzed: la ; 'dod pa'i sgras ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po dag bzung ba yin te /
translated: The word “sense objects” refers to the five sense objects.

original: de dag la dben pa ni spangs pa dang 'dod pa'i rnam pa dang bral bar gyur ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de dag la dben pa ni spangs pa dang 'dod pa'i rnam pa dang bral bar gyur ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Isolation from them is the aspect of abandonment, i.e., being free from desire.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i mi dge ba ma lus pa spangs pa nyid kyi phyir sdig pa mi dge ba dag las dben par gyur pa dang / rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang / mtshungs par ldan par smras pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i mi dge ba ma lus pa spangs pa nyid kyi phyir sdig pa mi dge ba dag las dben par gyur pa dang / rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang / mtshungs par ldan par smras pa yin no //
translated: It is said that it is isolated from evil, non-virtuous dharmas because it abandons all the non-virtuous dharmas of the desire realm, and it is associated with investigation and analysis.

original: dben pa las skyes pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dben pa las skyes pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is born from isolation.

original: lus dben pa dang sems dben pa las 'dir sems dben pa nyid gzung ste /
analyzed: lus dben pa dang sems dben pa las 'dir sems dben pa nyid gzung ste /
translated: Here, isolation of the body and isolation of the mind, the isolation of the mind is meant.

original: de las skyes pas na dben pa las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: de las skyes pas na dben pa las skyes pa'o //
translated: It is born from that, therefore it is born from isolation.

original: dga' ba dang bde ba ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs gsum gyi bde ba yin te /
analyzed: dga' ba dang bde ba ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs gsum gyi bde ba yin te /
translated: Joy and pleasure are the pleasure of the three groups of consciousnesses.

original: sna dang lce'i rnam par shes pa dag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sna dang lce'i rnam par shes pa dag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no nose or tongue consciousness.

original: yang na 'dis rnam par 'byed pa na dben pa ste /
analyzed: yang na 'dis rnam par 'byed pa na dben pa ste /
translated: Or, it is isolated by this, i.e., it is distinguished.

original: tha dad par byas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: tha dad par byas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is said that it is made different.

original: gang las rnam par 'byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang las rnam par 'byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: From what is it distinguished?

original: 'dod pa dag las te /
analyzed: 'dod pa dag las te /
translated: From the realm of desire.

original: bgrod par bya ba ma yin pa'i sa zag pa dang bcas pa'i lam dben pa de las skyes pa ni dben pa las skyes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bgrod par bya ba ma yin pa'i sa zag pa dang bcas pa'i lam dben pa de las skyes pa ni dben pa las skyes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The path of cultivation is called “arisen from separation” because it arises from separation from the realm of desire, which is a realm that is not to be transcended, and which is defiled.

original: nye bar bsgrubs nas zhes bya ba ni shes pas yongs su rdzogs par shes nas so //🔽mngon par brlan to zhes bya ba ni kun nas 'gengs par byed pa'am khyab par byed pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar bsgrubs nas zhes bya ba ni shes pas yongs su rdzogs par shes nas so // mngon par brlan to zhes bya ba ni kun nas 'gengs par byed pa'am khyab par byed pa'o //
translated: Having attained it, having fully understood it through knowledge.🔽It is moistened means it is filled or pervaded.

original: yongs su brlan to zhes bya ba ni shin tu 'gengs par byed pa 'am /🔽shin tu khyab par byed pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su brlan to zhes bya ba ni shin tu 'gengs par byed pa 'am / shin tu khyab par byed pa'o //
translated: It is fully moistened means it is completely filled or completely pervaded.

original: kun nas tshim par byed ces bya ba ni rab tu dga' bar byed pa'am nye bar sogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas tshim par byed ces bya ba ni rab tu dga' bar byed pa'am nye bar sogs par byed pa'o //
translated: It is satisfied means it is delighted or nourished.

original: kun nas khyab par byed do zhes bya ba ni kun nas shin tu khyab par byed do //
analyzed: kun nas khyab par byed do zhes bya ba ni kun nas shin tu khyab par byed do //
translated: It is completely pervaded means it is completely filled.

original: khyab par ma gyur pa zhes bya ba ni gsal bar ma gyur pa'o //
analyzed: khyab par ma gyur pa zhes bya ba ni gsal bar ma gyur pa'o //
translated: That which is not pervaded means that which is not clearly manifest.

original: khyab par bya ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni des khyab par mi nus pa'i lus kyi phyogs kyi gzhi gang yin pa de yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: khyab par bya ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni des khyab par mi nus pa'i lus kyi phyogs kyi gzhi gang yin pa de yod pa ma yin no //
translated: That which is not pervaded is the basis of a part of the body that cannot be pervaded by it.

original: slob ma ni 'dir bzo'i yon tan slob dpon dang mtshungs par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: slob ma ni 'dir bzo'i yon tan slob dpon dang mtshungs par gyur pa'o //
translated: A pupil is one who has become equal to the teacher in the quality of skill.

original: mkhas pa ni rang gi las la mkhas par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mkhas pa ni rang gi las la mkhas par gyur pa'o //
translated: A skilled person is one who has become skilled in his own work.

original: khar phor ni khar ba'i snod chen po yin la /
analyzed: khar phor ni khar ba'i snod chen po yin la /
translated: A bowl is a large vessel for water.

original: gzhong bu ni khar sder gyi rnam pa'o //
analyzed: gzhong bu ni khar sder gyi rnam pa'o //
translated: A plate is a kind of bowl.

original: nya phyis ni khrus kyi phye ma'i snod kyi rnam pa gzhan yin no //
analyzed: nya phyis ni khrus kyi phye ma'i snod kyi rnam pa gzhan yin no //
translated: A saucer is another kind of vessel for washing powder.

original: chus btab pa zhes bya ba ni brlan par byas pa ste /
analyzed: chus btab pa zhes bya ba ni brlan par byas pa ste /
translated: Sprinkled with water means moistened.

original: zlos pa'i tshig gnyis yin no //
analyzed: zlos pa'i tshig gnyis yin no //
translated: These are two repetitive words.

original: gsher bar byas pa ni bangs par byas pa'o //
analyzed: gsher bar byas pa ni bangs par byas pa'o //
translated: Wet means soaked.

original: snum @172b pa ni chus so //
analyzed: snum @172b pa ni chus so //
translated: Oiled means with water.

original: snum par gyur pa ni dbus kyi char rlan zhugs par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: snum par gyur pa ni dbus kyi char rlan zhugs par gyur pa'o //
translated: Oily means the middle part has become moist.

original: snum pas khyab pa ni snum gyis kun nas zin par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: snum pas khyab pa ni snum gyis kun nas zin par gyur pa'o //
translated: Covered with oil means seized by oil.

original: gsal ba ni rnam pa thams cad du khyab pa yin pa de'i phyir nang dang phyi dang bcas pa snum pas zhes bya ba smos pa yin no //🔽so sor mi 'gyes pa zhes bya ba ni 'brul bar mi 'gyur pa'i ngang tshul can yin no //
analyzed: gsal ba ni rnam pa thams cad du khyab pa yin pa de'i phyir nang dang phyi dang bcas pa snum pas zhes bya ba smos pa yin no // so sor mi 'gyes pa zhes bya ba ni 'brul bar mi 'gyur pa'i ngang tshul can yin no //
translated: Since clarity pervades everything, he says, “along with the inner and outer, it is moistened.”🔽“Not scattered” means it does not become dispersed.

original: 'thor bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni phra mo nyid du 'thor zhing gnas par mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'thor bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni phra mo nyid du 'thor zhing gnas par mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “Not dissipated” means it does not become dissipated and remain as something subtle.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba'i dpes bstan pa'i don la sbyor bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba'i dpes bstan pa'i don la sbyor bar byed pa yin te /
translated: “In the same way” connects this to the meaning of the simile.

original: ting nge 'dzin la rab tu 'jug pa'i sems de ni ting nge 'dzin las sems ma 'phros shing phyi rol du g-yeng ba med pa'i phyir 'thor bar mi 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la rab tu 'jug pa'i sems de ni ting nge 'dzin las sems ma 'phros shing phyi rol du g-yeng ba med pa'i phyir 'thor bar mi 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: The mind that is engaged in samādhi is not dissipated because it does not move from samādhi and is not distracted outwardly.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par dpyod pa nye bar zhi ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par dpyod pa nye bar zhi ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Because discursive thought and analysis are pacified” means because they are abandoned.

original: nad rab tu dang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nad rab tu dang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: “Because the illness is purified” means

original: nad rab tu dang ba'i chos de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: nad rab tu dang ba'i chos de gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the quality of faith in the Dharma of the sick?

original: gang gi phyir de la rnal 'byor pa 'di snyam du mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa las de 'byung ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de la rnal 'byor pa 'di snyam du mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa las de 'byung ba ma yin gyi /
translated: Because the yogi thinks in this way: “It does not arise from the stage of non-equipoise,

original: 'on kyang mnyam par gzhag pa las kyang yin no zhes sems par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on kyang mnyam par gzhag pa las kyang yin no zhes sems par 'gyur te /
translated: but also from equipoise.”

original: de lta bu'i rnam pa mngon par yid ches pa'i dad pa'i rang bzhin la nad rab tu dang ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnam pa mngon par yid ches pa'i dad pa'i rang bzhin la nad rab tu dang ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This kind of manifest confidence is called faith in the Dharma of the sick.

original: sems gcig tu dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba shin tu dmigs pa gcig la 'jug pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa dang rnam par dpyod pa dang bral ba'i phyir sems shin tu dmigs pa gcig pa 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: sems gcig tu dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba shin tu dmigs pa gcig la 'jug pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa dang rnam par dpyod pa dang bral ba'i phyir sems shin tu dmigs pa gcig pa 'jug pa yin no //
translated: Because the mind is focused on one object, because it engages in a very focused single object, it is free from discursive thought and investigation, and the mind engages in a very focused single object.

original: ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa zhes bya ba ni 'dir bsam gtan gnyis pa gtso bor gyur pa'i ting nge 'dzin de las skyes pa ste ;
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa zhes bya ba ni 'dir bsam gtan gnyis pa gtso bor gyur pa'i ting nge 'dzin de las skyes pa ste ;
translated: Arisen from concentration means arisen from that concentration which is primarily the second dhyana.

original: gang gi phyir bsam gtan gnyis pa gtso bor gyur pa la brten nas bsam gtan dang po las 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bsam gtan gnyis pa gtso bor gyur pa la brten nas bsam gtan dang po las 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur pa yin no //
translated: Because one becomes free from attachment to the first meditative concentration in dependence on the second meditative concentration as the predominant factor.

original: ri bo'i rtse mo zhes bya ba ni ri bo'i steng chu gnas su rung ba'i gnas ni ri bo'i rtse mo yin no //
analyzed: ri bo'i rtse mo zhes bya ba ni ri bo'i steng chu gnas su rung ba'i gnas ni ri bo'i rtse mo yin no //
translated: The peak of a mountain is a place on the top of a mountain where water can be found.

original: bkod ma zhes bya ba ni chu 'byung ba'i bu gu dang ldan pa'o ;
analyzed: bkod ma zhes bya ba ni chu 'byung ba'i bu gu dang ldan pa'o ;
translated: A canal is a channel for bringing in water.

original: / mtshe'u zhes bya ba ni lteng ka yin no //
analyzed: / mtshe'u zhes bya ba ni lteng ka yin no //
translated: A pond is a small lake.

original: chu'i rdzing bu zhes bya ba ni chu 'byung ba'i ser ga 'o //
analyzed: chu'i rdzing bu zhes bya ba ni chu 'byung ba'i ser ga 'o //
translated: A pool is a place where water can be found.

original: chu'i bu gu zhes bya ba ni dbus na chu 'byung ba'i ser ga yod pa'o //
analyzed: chu'i bu gu zhes bya ba ni dbus na chu 'byung ba'i ser ga yod pa'o //
translated: A spring is a place where water comes up from the middle.

original: chu'i phung po zhes bya ba ni chu chen po 'byung ba'i ser ga yin no //🔽des dga' ba spangs nas zhes bya ba ni dga' @173a * //
analyzed: chu'i phung po zhes bya ba ni chu chen po 'byung ba'i ser ga yin no // des dga' ba spangs nas zhes bya ba ni dga' @173a * //
translated: A river is a place where a great deal of water comes up.

original: ba'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ba'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Having abandoned joy means that one is free from the attachment of joy.

original: btang snyoms la gnas so zhes bya ba ni 'du byed kyi btang snyoms kyis sems dge ba la 'jug pa'i phyir btang snyoms zhes bstan to //
analyzed: btang snyoms la gnas so zhes bya ba ni 'du byed kyi btang snyoms kyis sems dge ba la 'jug pa'i phyir btang snyoms zhes bstan to //
translated: “He dwells in equanimity” means that he dwells in equanimity through the equanimity of formative influence, because he enters into the wholesome mind.

original: dran pa dang shes bzhin zhes bya ba ni dran pa dang shes rab gtso bor gyur pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa dang shes bzhin zhes bya ba ni dran pa dang shes rab gtso bor gyur pa'o //
translated: “Mindfulness and full awareness” means that mindfulness and wisdom are predominant.

original: bde ba lus kyis zhes bya ba ni lus dang yid kyi sgo nas bde ba khyad par du 'phags pa nyid yin pa de bas na de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: bde ba lus kyis zhes bya ba ni lus dang yid kyi sgo nas bde ba khyad par du 'phags pa nyid yin pa de bas na de skad ces bya ste /
translated: “He experiences with his body” means that he experiences with his body and mind, because the happiness is superior.

original: de bas na chags pa'i gnas skabs 'di la 'phags pas tha snyad du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na chags pa'i gnas skabs 'di la 'phags pas tha snyad du bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the noble ones teach this stage as “happiness”.

original: 'phags pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas dang / de'i nyan thos dag yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas dang / de'i nyan thos dag yin no //
translated: The “noble ones” are the Buddhas and their disciples.

original: thams cad kyi thams cad du nub par gyur pa ni rtsa ba nub pa yin no //
analyzed: thams cad kyi thams cad du nub par gyur pa ni rtsa ba nub pa yin no //
translated: “Completely disappeared” means that the root has disappeared.

original: des bde ba yang spangs zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: des bde ba yang spangs zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: “He abandons happiness” and so on.

original: bsam gtan gsum pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir bde ba spangs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir bde ba spangs pa bzhin no //
translated: He abandons happiness because he is free from attachment to the third meditation.

original: dri ma lus pa dang bral ba'i phyir sdug bsngal spangs pa yin te /
analyzed: dri ma lus pa dang bral ba'i phyir sdug bsngal spangs pa yin te /
translated: Suffering is abandoned because of being free from all defilements.

original: bsam gtan gsum pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'i dus kho na la bstan la /
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'i dus kho na la bstan la /
translated: It is taught at the time of being free from attachment to the third absorption alone,

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba kho na las ni sdug bsngal spangs par gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba kho na las ni sdug bsngal spangs par gyur pa yin no //
translated: but suffering is abandoned by being free from attachment to the desire realm alone.

original: yid bde ba dang yid mi bde ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yid bde ba dang yid mi bde ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: Mental pleasure and mental displeasure are abandoned.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bas yid bde ba spangs pa dang / 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags dang bral bas nyid mi bde ba spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bas yid bde ba spangs pa dang / 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags dang bral bas nyid mi bde ba spangs pa yin no //
translated: Mental pleasure is abandoned by being free from attachment to the second absorption, and mental displeasure is abandoned by being free from attachment to the desire realm.

original: btang snyoms yongs su dag pa dang / dran pa yongs su dag pa ni 'dir dri ma las grol ba nyid dang / legs par yongs su rdzogs pa nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: btang snyoms yongs su dag pa dang / dran pa yongs su dag pa ni 'dir dri ma las grol ba nyid dang / legs par yongs su rdzogs pa nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Complete purity of equanimity and complete purity of mindfulness should be understood here as freedom from defilements and complete perfection.

original: sa 'og ma'i nyon mongs pa dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir sems des yongs su dag pa yin la /
analyzed: sa 'og ma'i nyon mongs pa dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir sems des yongs su dag pa yin la /
translated: The mind is completely pure because it is free from the afflictions of lower levels.

original: rang gi sa pa'i dri ma med pa'i phyir yongs su dkar ba yin no //
analyzed: rang gi sa pa'i dri ma med pa'i phyir yongs su dkar ba yin no //
translated: It is completely white because it is stainless in its own stage.

original: mos pa byas nas zhes bya ba ni dmigs par byas pa'o //
analyzed: mos pa byas nas zhes bya ba ni dmigs par byas pa'o //
translated: Having made it an object means having made it an object of observation.

original: khyab par zhes bya ba ni thams cad la khyab par byas pa'o //
analyzed: khyab par zhes bya ba ni thams cad la khyab par byas pa'o //
translated: Having pervaded means having pervaded all.

original: nye bar bsgrubs nas zhes bya ba ni yongs su rdzogs par ram /
analyzed: nye bar bsgrubs nas zhes bya ba ni yongs su rdzogs par ram /
translated: Having accomplished means having completed it.

original: kun nas longs spyod pa'am /
analyzed: kun nas longs spyod pa'am /
translated: Having enjoyed it means having fully enjoyed it.

original: shes par byas nas so //
analyzed: shes par byas nas so //
translated: Having understood it means having understood it.

original: skyes bu brgyad kyis btags pa'i gos gang yin pa de ni brgyad kyis btags pa ste /
analyzed: skyes bu brgyad kyis btags pa'i gos gang yin pa de ni brgyad kyis btags pa ste /
translated: The cloth that is woven by eight people is woven by eight.

original: shin tu tshad che pa nyid kyi phyir skyes bu shin tu nyung dus btag par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: shin tu tshad che pa nyid kyi phyir skyes bu shin tu nyung dus btag par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not possible for a very small person to weave it because it is too large.

original: de bzhin du mtshan nyid @173b snga ma bzhin du skyes bu dgu'i bya bas bsgrubs pa ni dgus btags pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du mtshan nyid @173b snga ma bzhin du skyes bu dgu'i bya bas bsgrubs pa ni dgus btags pa yin no //
translated: Similarly, the cloth that is woven by nine people by the previous method is woven by nine.

original: mi mtho zhes bya ba ni de yan chad gzugs can gyi sa med pa'i phyir gnas gong ma la mngon par 'dod pa'i sems med pa yin no //
analyzed: mi mtho zhes bya ba ni de yan chad gzugs can gyi sa med pa'i phyir gnas gong ma la mngon par 'dod pa'i sems med pa yin no //
translated: It is not high means that there is no mind that is higher, that is, that is higher than it, because there is no higher stage beyond that.

original: gzugs kyis thams cad kyi steng na rnam par gnas pa nyid kyi phyir mi dma' ba yin no //
analyzed: gzugs kyis thams cad kyi steng na rnam par gnas pa nyid kyi phyir mi dma' ba yin no //
translated: It is not low because form is situated above all.

original: mi g-yo ba thob ces bya ba ni g-yo ba med pa'i gnas skabs thob par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba thob ces bya ba ni g-yo ba med pa'i gnas skabs thob par gyur pa'o //
translated: Having attained immobility means having attained the state of non-mobility.

original: khang pa brtsegs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: khang pa brtsegs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In the passage beginning with “a multi-storied building,”

original: shing dang gur thabs su bsgrubs pa'i khang pa chung ngu ni khang pa brtsegs pa yin la /
analyzed: shing dang gur thabs su bsgrubs pa'i khang pa chung ngu ni khang pa brtsegs pa yin la /
translated: a small building constructed of wood and woven materials is a multi-storied building.

original: khang pa brtsegs pa chen po ni ka ba yin te /
analyzed: khang pa brtsegs pa chen po ni ka ba yin te /
translated: A large multi-storied building is a pillar.

original: des nye bar mtshon pa'i khang pa la khang pa brtsegs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: des nye bar mtshon pa'i khang pa la khang pa brtsegs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: A building illustrated by that is called a multi-storied building.

original: 'bru mar gyi mar me ni gsal byed do //
analyzed: 'bru mar gyi mar me ni gsal byed do //
translated: An oil lamp is an illuminator.

original: ma bsgul pa zhes bya ba ni phyogs gcig bsgul pa'i sgo nas ma bsgul pa'o //
analyzed: ma bsgul pa zhes bya ba ni phyogs gcig bsgul pa'i sgo nas ma bsgul pa'o //
translated: Not shaken means not shaken by the shaking of one part.

original: ma bskyod pa zhes bya ba ni kun nas dkrugs pa'i sgo nas bskyod par ma gyur pa'o //
analyzed: ma bskyod pa zhes bya ba ni kun nas dkrugs pa'i sgo nas bskyod par ma gyur pa'o //
translated: Not moved means not moved by the agitation of all.

original: bdag gi lus 'di ni zhas bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: bdag gi lus 'di ni zhas bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In the passage beginning with “this body of mine,”

original: gzugs su rung zhing gnod pa byar rung ba'i phyir gzugs can yin la rags pa nyid kyi phyir rgya che ba yin zhing 'byung ba chen po bzhi las grub pa nyid kyi phyir 'byung ba rgyur byas pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs su rung zhing gnod pa byar rung ba'i phyir gzugs can yin la rags pa nyid kyi phyir rgya che ba yin zhing 'byung ba chen po bzhi las grub pa nyid kyi phyir 'byung ba rgyur byas pa'o //
translated: It is material because it is capable of form and capable of obstruction. It is extensive because it is gross. It is derived from the great elements because it is established from the four great elements.

original: 'di la brten zhing zhes bya ba ni rang gi sa pa'i rnam par shes pa de la brten pa'i sgo nas skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di la brten zhing zhes bya ba ni rang gi sa pa'i rnam par shes pa de la brten pa'i sgo nas skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is based on this means that it arises by way of being based on the consciousness of its own level.

original: 'di la gnas te zhes bya ba de ni sa gzhan la yang 'di la brten nas skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di la gnas te zhes bya ba de ni sa gzhan la yang 'di la brten nas skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is situated in this means that it arises in dependence on this, even in other levels.

original: bdag nyid thams cad kyi rjes su 'jug pa ni zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid thams cad kyi rjes su 'jug pa ni zhugs pa yin no //
translated: It is engaged in all its aspects means that it is engaged in all its aspects.

original: lus gzhan zhes bya ba ni khams gzhan yin no //
analyzed: lus gzhan zhes bya ba ni khams gzhan yin no //
translated: Another body means another realm.

original: gzugs dang ba dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir gzugs can no //
analyzed: gzugs dang ba dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir gzugs can no //
translated: It is material because it possesses the clarity of form.

original: yid tsam las skyes pa nyid kyi phyir dang / khu khrag la sogs pa phyi rol gyi rgyu la ltos pa med par skyes pa'i phyir yid las byung ba'o //
analyzed: yid tsam las skyes pa nyid kyi phyir dang / khu khrag la sogs pa phyi rol gyi rgyu la ltos pa med par skyes pa'i phyir yid las byung ba'o //
translated: It is mental because it arises from mind alone and because it arises without relying on external causes such as semen and blood.

original: zhar ba dang 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir ma tshang ba med pa'o //
analyzed: zhar ba dang 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir ma tshang ba med pa'o //
translated: It is complete because it is free from blindness and error.

original: dbang po thams cad chogs pa nyid kyi phyir dbang po ma nyams pa'o //🔽nyes pa med pa'i phyir dge ba'o //
analyzed: dbang po thams cad chogs pa nyid kyi phyir dbang po ma nyams pa'o // nyes pa med pa'i phyir dge ba'o //
translated: It is unimpaired because all the faculties are intact.🔽It is wholesome because it is free from faults.

original: byas pa nyid ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir rigs dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: byas pa nyid ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir rigs dang ldan pa'o //
translated: It is of good lineage because it is not fabricated.

original: gdod snang ba nyid kyi phyir gsal ba'o //🔽rnyog pa'i dri ma rags pa gzhan dang gzhan med pa'i phyir rnam par dang ba'o //
analyzed: gdod snang ba nyid kyi phyir gsal ba'o // rnyog pa'i dri ma rags pa gzhan dang gzhan med pa'i phyir rnam par dang ba'o //
translated: It is clear because it is luminous from the beginning.🔽It is pure because it is free from other coarse impurities.

original: dri ma phra mo yang med pa'i phyir dri ma med pa'o //
analyzed: dri ma phra mo yang med pa'i phyir dri ma med pa'o //
translated: It is stainless because it is free from subtle impurities.

original: nyag ma ni gres ma'i snying po'o //
analyzed: nyag ma ni gres ma'i snying po'o //
translated: The kernel is the essence of the grain.
By that

original: 'di ltar mnyam par gzhag pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: 'di ltar mnyam par gzhag pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Thus, one who is concentrated, etc.

original: ting nge 'dzin dang rjes su mthun pa nyid kyi phyir mnyam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang rjes su mthun pa nyid kyi phyir mnyam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: It is concentrated because it is in accord with samadhi.

original: yongs su dag pa zhes bya ba ni sa 'og ma'i nyes pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su dag pa zhes bya ba ni sa 'og ma'i nyes pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is pure because it is free from the faults of the lower stages.

original: yongs su dkar ba zhes bya ba ni rang gi sa pa'i dri ma yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su dkar ba zhes bya ba ni rang gi sa pa'i dri ma yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is called “completely pure” because it is also free from the stains of its own stage.

original: nyes pa med pa zhes bya ba ni nyes pa dang bral ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: nyes pa med pa zhes bya ba ni nyes pa dang bral ba'i phyir te /
translated: It is called “without fault” because it is free from faults.

original: nyon mongs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa'o //
translated: It is without afflictions.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sems de nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang bral ba yin no //🔽gsal bar spyod pa'i phyir drang por gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sems de nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang bral ba yin no // gsal bar spyod pa'i phyir drang por gyur pa'o //
translated: For that very reason, that mind is free from secondary afflictions.🔽It is “straight” because it is clear in its conduct.

original: shin tu sbyangs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir las su rung ba yin la /
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir las su rung ba yin la /
translated: It is “pliable” because it possesses suppleness.

original: las la phan pa ni las su rung ba ste /
analyzed: las la phan pa ni las su rung ba ste /
translated: Pliability is helpful for action.

original: dge ba'i chos thams cad skyed par rung ba yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos thams cad skyed par rung ba yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is suitable for generating all virtuous qualities.

original: mi g-yo ba thob ste zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa la sogs pas mi bskyod pa yin no //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba thob ste zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa la sogs pas mi bskyod pa yin no //
translated: It is “unwavering” because it is unshaken by conceptualization, etc.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi yul zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi yul zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The object of supernatural power, etc.

original: rdzu 'phrul ni ting nge 'dzin yin la /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul ni ting nge 'dzin yin la /
translated: Supernatural power is concentration.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi yul ni rdzu 'phrul gyi yul te /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi yul ni rdzu 'phrul gyi yul te /
translated: The object of supernatural power is the object of supernatural power.

original: sprul pa dang / nam mkha' la 'gro ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sprul pa dang / nam mkha' la 'gro ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: and the ability to emanate, to travel through space, and so forth.

original: de shes pa ni rdzu 'phrul gyi yul shes pa yin la /🔽de mngon sum du gyur pa ni mngon sum du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de shes pa ni rdzu 'phrul gyi yul shes pa yin la / de mngon sum du gyur pa ni mngon sum du gyur pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of this is the knowledge of the object of supernormal power.🔽The actualization of this is the actualization of the object of supernormal power.

original: mngon par shes par byed pas na mngon par shes pa zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas nas shes pa de nyid mngon par shes pa ste de la'o //
analyzed: mngon par shes par byed pas na mngon par shes pa zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas nas shes pa de nyid mngon par shes pa ste de la'o //
translated: The knowledge of this is the supernormal power of knowledge.

original: sems mngon par 'jug go zhes bya ba ni dben par byed pa skyed par byed pa'i phyir 'jog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sems mngon par 'jug go zhes bya ba ni dben par byed pa skyed par byed pa'i phyir 'jog par byed pa'o //
translated: The mind enters this is the establishment of the mind in the object, because it generates the cause of isolation.

original: so sor myong ba zhes bya ba ni shes pas khyab pa'am byed pa yin no //
analyzed: so sor myong ba zhes bya ba ni shes pas khyab pa'am byed pa yin no //
translated: The experience of this is the pervasion of the object by knowledge or the action of knowledge.

original: mngon par snang ba gsal ba'i tshul gyis gnas pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par snang ba gsal ba'i tshul gyis gnas pa'o //
translated: The manifestation of this is the appearance of the object in the manner of clarity.

original: mi snang ba ni nub par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mi snang ba ni nub par gyur pa'o //
translated: The disappearance of this is the disappearance of the object.

original: ye shes ni 'dir thag pa dang bcas pa bsgoms pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: ye shes ni 'dir thag pa dang bcas pa bsgoms pa las byung ba'o //
translated: Knowledge here is the knowledge that arises from meditation, together with its cause.

original: mthong ba ni 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba'o //
analyzed: mthong ba ni 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba'o //
translated: Seeing is the mundane right view.

original: rtsig pa las thal ba zhes bya ba ni rtsig pas chod pa yin la /
analyzed: rtsig pa las thal ba zhes bya ba ni rtsig pas chod pa yin la /
translated: “Passing through walls” means passing through what obstructs.

original: de bzhin du ris chod pa dang / rtsig pas chod pa'i gnas su chags pa med pa ste ;🔽thogs pa med par lus kyis 'gro ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du ris chod pa dang / rtsig pas chod pa'i gnas su chags pa med pa ste ; thogs pa med par lus kyis 'gro ba yin no //
translated: Similarly, he passes without impediment, without being obstructed, through a barrier or through a wall.

original: nub pa ni 'og tu 'gro bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: nub pa ni 'og tu 'gro bar byed pa'o //
translated: “He dives into the earth as if it were water” means he dives into the earth as if it were water.

original: 'byung ba ni yang phyir 'ong bar byed pa'o //🔽rgyun gyi steng na zhes bya ba ni nub pa med pa'i phyir ro //🔽kun nas reg pa zhes bya ba ni cung zad yin la /
analyzed: 'byung ba ni yang phyir 'ong bar byed pa'o // rgyun gyi steng na zhes bya ba ni nub pa med pa'i phyir ro // kun nas reg pa zhes bya ba ni cung zad yin la /
translated: “He emerges from it as if from water” means he emerges from the earth as if from water.🔽“He walks on water without sinking as if it were dry land” means he walks on water without sinking as if it were dry land.

original: rab tu zhes bya ba ni kun nas yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab tu zhes bya ba ni kun nas yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “He travels cross-legged through the air like a bird on the wing” means he travels cross-legged through the air like a bird on the wing.🔽“He even touches and strokes with his hand the sun and moon, so mighty and powerful, and he does not feel their heat or cold” means he touches and strokes with his hand the sun and moon, so mighty and powerful, and he does not feel their heat or cold.

original: @174b lus kyis dbang sgyur bar byed do zhes bya ba ni lus kyis tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du 'gro zhing bdag po byed pa yin te /
analyzed: @174b lus kyis dbang sgyur bar byed do zhes bya ba ni lus kyis tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du 'gro zhing bdag po byed pa yin te /
translated: “He wields bodily mastery even as far as the Brahma world” means he goes to the Brahma world with his body and acts as master there.

original: bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyis tshangs pa'i 'jig rten la sogs pa'i bar du 'gro bar byed pa de'i phyir de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyis tshangs pa'i 'jig rten la sogs pa'i bar du 'gro bar byed pa de'i phyir de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Because he goes with the supernormal power of the first absorption as far as the Brahma world, and so on.

original: gser mgar ni gser bzo byed pa'o //
analyzed: gser mgar ni gser bzo byed pa'o //
translated: A goldsmith is one who works with gold.

original: mgor rung ba'i rgyan ni glegs ma'o //
analyzed: mgor rung ba'i rgyan ni glegs ma'o //

analyzed: rna rgyan ni rna ba'i rgyan chung du yin la / rna cha ni rna ba'i rgyan chen po yin no //
translated: An earring is a small ornament for the ear.🔽An ear pendant is a large ornament for the ear.

original: mgrin pa'i phyogs la rung ba'i rgyan ni mgul rgyan yin no //🔽lag pa'i rgyan ni gdu bu rgyan can la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mgrin pa'i phyogs la rung ba'i rgyan ni mgul rgyan yin no // lag pa'i rgyan ni gdu bu rgyan can la sogs pa'o //

original: rkang rgyan ni g-yer ka can la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rkang rgyan ni g-yer ka can la sogs pa'o //
translated: An anklet is an ornament for the ankle.

original: sor gdub ni rab tu grags pa yin no //
analyzed: sor gdub ni rab tu grags pa yin no //
translated: A ring is well known.

original: gser gyi phreng ba ni gser las byas pa'i mgo bo'i rgyan yin no //
analyzed: gser gyi phreng ba ni gser las byas pa'i mgo bo'i rgyan yin no //
translated: A golden garland is a head ornament made of gold.

original: myur zhing myur bar zhes bya ba ni bya ba mang po med pa'i sgo nas skyen par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: myur zhing myur bar zhes bya ba ni bya ba mang po med pa'i sgo nas skyen par byed pa yin no //

original: lha'i rna ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: lha'i rna ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Divine ear, etc.

original: lha'i yul du byung bas na lha nyid yin te /
analyzed: lha'i yul du byung bas na lha nyid yin te /
translated: Divine means that which arises in the realm of the gods.

original: spyir lha nyid kyi ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang bsgoms pa las byung ba rnam par dag pa'i sgo nas yin no //
analyzed: spyir lha nyid kyi ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang bsgoms pa las byung ba rnam par dag pa'i sgo nas yin no //

analyzed: de la ye shes mngon sum du byed pa kho na mngon par shes pa yin no //🔽sems pa cag ces bya ba la /

original: gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni rang gi sems la ltos pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni rang gi sems la ltos pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because the knowledge of the minds of others does not depend on one's own mind.

original: sems can ni gang zag gi rnam grangs yin pa'am /
analyzed: sems can ni gang zag gi rnam grangs yin pa'am /
translated: A sentient being is a synonym for person.

original: yang na skad cig re re'i phung po lnga'i tshogs sems can yin no //
analyzed: yang na skad cig re re'i phung po lnga'i tshogs sems can yin no //
translated: Or else, a sentient being is the collection of the five aggregates in each instant.

original: ris mthun pa'i rgyun ma lus pa ni gang zag yin no //
analyzed: ris mthun pa'i rgyun ma lus pa ni gang zag yin no //
translated: The person is the complete series of homogeneous collections.

original: rnam par brtags pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i bya ba dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par brtags pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i bya ba dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The expression to imagine means to be engaged in the activity of imagining.

original: @175a * // rnam par dpyod pa zhes bya ba dpyod pa'i bya ba dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: @175a * // rnam par dpyod pa zhes bya ba dpyod pa'i bya ba dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The expression to investigate means to be engaged in the activity of investigating.

original: yid kyis te sems kyis yid de sems yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes shing yongs su gcod par byed do //
analyzed: yid kyis te sems kyis yid de sems yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes shing yongs su gcod par byed do //
translated: The mind knows the mind, that is, the mental consciousness knows the mental consciousness, as it is in reality. It is the mind that fully discerns the mind.

original: ji ltar rab tu shes she na /
analyzed: ji ltar rab tu shes she na /
translated: How does it know?

original: 'dod chags dang bcas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bcas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The root text states, It knows a mind that is accompanied by attachment as a mind that is accompanied by attachment.

original: 'dod chags dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni 'dod chags dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni 'dod chags dang bcas pa'o //
translated: A mind that is accompanied by attachment is a mind that is associated with attachment.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang ldan pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang ldan pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: Free from attachment means not associated with attachment.

original: de bzhin du zhe sdang dang bcas pa dang / zhe sdang dang bral ba dang / gti mug dang bcas pa dang / gti mug dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhe sdang dang bcas pa dang / zhe sdang dang bral ba dang / gti mug dang bcas pa dang / gti mug dang bral ba'o //
translated: Similarly, associated with hatred, free from hatred, associated with delusion, free from delusion.

original: g-yengs pa ni nyon mongs pa yin te /
analyzed: g-yengs pa ni nyon mongs pa yin te /
translated: The distracted mind is defiled,

original: rnam par g-yengs pa dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par g-yengs pa dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is associated with distraction.

original: mi g-yeng ba ni dge ba la dmigs pa la mngon par g-yeng ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi g-yeng ba ni dge ba la dmigs pa la mngon par g-yeng ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The undistracted mind is wholesome, because it is not associated with distraction.

original: lhag par le lo'i tshogs dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir sems nyon mongs pa can ni zhum pa yin no //
analyzed: lhag par le lo'i tshogs dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir sems nyon mongs pa can ni zhum pa yin no //
translated: The defiled mind is slack, because it is associated with the accumulation of laziness.

original: lhag par brtson 'grus kyi tshogs dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir sems dge ba la rab tu 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: lhag par brtson 'grus kyi tshogs dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir sems dge ba la rab tu 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: The wholesome mind is sustained, because it is associated with the accumulation of vigor.

original: 'phyar ba ni nyon mongs pa can te /
analyzed: 'phyar ba ni nyon mongs pa can te /
translated: The agitated mind is defiled,

original: rnam par byang ba las 'phyar ba dag la brten pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba las 'phyar ba dag la brten pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is associated with the agitation of purification.

original: mi 'phyar ba ni dge ba ste /
analyzed: mi 'phyar ba ni dge ba ste /
translated: Non-arrogance is virtue.

original: de las bzlog pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the opposite of that.

original: rgod pa ni nyon mongs pa can te /
analyzed: rgod pa ni nyon mongs pa can te /
translated: Agitation is defiled.

original: rgod pa'i tshogs dang lhag par mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgod pa'i tshogs dang lhag par mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is associated with the group of agitation and is excessive.

original: mi rgod pa ni de'i gnyen po nyid yin pa'i phyir dge ba yin no //
analyzed: mi rgod pa ni de'i gnyen po nyid yin pa'i phyir dge ba yin no //
translated: Non-agitation is virtue because it is the antidote to that.

original: nye bar zhi ba dang / nye bar ma zhi ba yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: nye bar zhi ba dang / nye bar ma zhi ba yang de bzhin no //
translated: The same applies to tranquility and non-tranquility.

original: mnyam par ma bzhag pa ni nyon mongs pa can te /
analyzed: mnyam par ma bzhag pa ni nyon mongs pa can te /
translated: Non-concentration is defiled.

original: lhag par g-yengs ba'i tshogs dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhag par g-yengs ba'i tshogs dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is associated with the group of excessive distraction.

original: mnyam par ba zhag pa ni de'i gnyen po'i phyogs nyid yin pa'i phyir dge ba'o //
analyzed: mnyam par ba zhag pa ni de'i gnyen po'i phyogs nyid yin pa'i phyir dge ba'o //
translated: Concentration is virtue because it is the side of the antidote to that.
