original: ma bsgoms pa ni nyon mongs pa can te /
analyzed: ma bsgoms pa ni nyon mongs pa can te /
translated: Non-cultivation is defiled.

original: dmigs pa la brten pa dang / sgom pa ma bsgoms pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa la brten pa dang / sgom pa ma bsgoms pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is not cultivation because it is not based on the object and because it is not cultivation.

original: bsgoms pa ni dge ba yin te /
analyzed: bsgoms pa ni dge ba yin te /
translated: Cultivation is virtue.

original: de gnyis bsgoms pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyis bsgoms pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is cultivation because it is both of those.

original: ma grol pa ni nyon mongs pa can te /
analyzed: ma grol pa ni nyon mongs pa can te /
translated: Non-liberation is defiled.

original: rang bzhin dang rgyud kyis rnam par grol ba dag las ma grol ba nyid kyi phyir ro //🔽rnam par grol ba ni dge ba ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin dang rgyud kyis rnam par grol ba dag las ma grol ba nyid kyi phyir ro // rnam par grol ba ni dge ba ste /
translated: because they are not liberated from the nature of being bound and from the continuum of being bound.

original: de gnyis las rnam par grol ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyis las rnam par grol ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Liberation is virtuous because it is liberated from those two.

original: rig pa gang zhes na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /🔽@175b sngon gyi skye ba'i gnas ni skye ba'i gnas sam /
analyzed: rig pa gang zhes na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / @175b sngon gyi skye ba'i gnas ni skye ba'i gnas sam /
translated: What is knowledge?

original: gnas skabs yin no //
analyzed: gnas skabs yin no //
translated: The abode of former birth is the place of birth or the state of birth.

original: 'jig pa'i dus ni 'jig pa'i bskal pa yin la /
analyzed: 'jig pa'i dus ni 'jig pa'i bskal pa yin la /
translated: The time of destruction is the eon of destruction.

original: gnas pa'i dus ni chags pa'i bskal ba yin te /
analyzed: gnas pa'i dus ni chags pa'i bskal ba yin te /
translated: The time of duration is the eon of creation.

original: 'jig pa'i bskal pa ni sems can dmyal ba mi srid pa'i phyir snod zad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i bskal pa ni sems can dmyal ba mi srid pa'i phyir snod zad pa yin no //
translated: The eon of destruction is the exhaustion of the environment because it is impossible for sentient beings to exist in the hells.

original: chags pa'i bskal pa ni thog mar rlung nas sems can dmyal ba'i bar srid pa zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: chags pa'i bskal pa ni thog mar rlung nas sems can dmyal ba'i bar srid pa zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The eon of creation is the existence of sentient beings from the beginning, when there is only wind, up to the hells.

original: 'di lta bu zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'di lta bu zhes bya ba la /
translated: What is like this?

original: 'di lta bu'i tshul du bdag gi ming brjod pa rigs ni rgyal rigs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i tshul du bdag gi ming brjod pa rigs ni rgyal rigs la sogs pa'o //
translated: The name of the self is the caste, such as kshatriya, and so on.

original: rus ni shud la la dang ba ra dva dza la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rus ni shud la la dang ba ra dva dza la sogs pa'o //
translated: The family is the Śākya family, the Kauṇḍinya family, etc.

original: zas ni kham gyi rnam pa'i zas la sogs pa'o //🔽'di lta bur tshe ni ring zhes bya ba la bdag zla ba'i mthar thug pa'am /
analyzed: zas ni kham gyi rnam pa'i zas la sogs pa'o // 'di lta bur tshe ni ring zhes bya ba la bdag zla ba'i mthar thug pa'am /
translated: Food is food in the form of morsels, etc.

original: lo'i mthar thug par tshe ring bar gyur ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lo'i mthar thug par tshe ring bar gyur ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “May I have such a long life” means “May I have a long life lasting until the end of the month, or until the end of the year, etc.”

original: ring du gnas te zhes bya ba ni byis pa dang gzhon nu la sogs pa'i gnas skabs ni ring du gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: ring du gnas te zhes bya ba ni byis pa dang gzhon nu la sogs pa'i gnas skabs ni ring du gnas pa yin no //
translated: “May I live long” means “May I live long in the states of childhood, youth, etc.”

original: tshe'i mthar thug pa zhes bya ba ni kun nas 'phangs pa'i tshe'i mthar thug pa dang ldan par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: tshe'i mthar thug pa zhes bya ba ni kun nas 'phangs pa'i tshe'i mthar thug pa dang ldan par gyur pa'o //
translated: “Until the end of my life” means “May I live until the end of the life that has been projected by my action.”

original: rnam pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni ming dang rigs dang rigs dang rus la sogs pa rjes su dran pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni ming dang rigs dang rigs dang rus la sogs pa rjes su dran pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: “With such a form” means “with such a memory of name, caste, family, etc.”

original: gnas dran pa ni yul yin no //
analyzed: gnas dran pa ni yul yin no //
translated: The place is the country.

original: yang na rnam pa'i sgras srid pa bar ma dor brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na rnam pa'i sgras srid pa bar ma dor brjod pa yin te /
translated: Or else, the word “form” refers to the intermediate existence,

original: de ni rnam pa tsam nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rnam pa tsam nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is only a form.

original: sngon gyi dus kyi gnas ni yul gyi sgras brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: sngon gyi dus kyi gnas ni yul gyi sgras brjod pa yin no //
translated: The phrase “the former states” refers to the former abodes.

original: de la rgyal rigs la sogs pa'i rigs kyis bstan pa ni srid pa bar do dang bcas pa dang / sngon gyi dus kyi gnas dang ba pa zhes bya ba bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la rgyal rigs la sogs pa'i rigs kyis bstan pa ni srid pa bar do dang bcas pa dang / sngon gyi dus kyi gnas dang ba pa zhes bya ba bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: The former abodes are taught by the terms “the class of the kṣatriyas” and so on.

original: 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba ni 'chi 'pho dang skye ba ste de yongs su shes pa'i ched kyi shes pa 'chi 'pho dang skye ba zhes pa yin la /
analyzed: 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba ni 'chi 'pho dang skye ba ste de yongs su shes pa'i ched kyi shes pa 'chi 'pho dang skye ba zhes pa yin la /
translated: The phrase “death and rebirth” refers to the knowledge of death and rebirth that is cultivated in order to understand death and rebirth.

original: de mngon sum du byed pa ni mngon du byed ba'o //
analyzed: de mngon sum du byed pa ni mngon du byed ba'o //
translated: The phrase “he manifests” means that he makes them evident.

original: 'chi bar gyur ba ni 'pho bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'chi bar gyur ba ni 'pho bar gyur pa'o //
translated: The phrase “he is about to die” means that he is about to pass away.

original: skye bar gyur pa ni srid pa bar do'i gnas skabs la rnam par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: skye bar gyur pa ni srid pa bar do'i gnas skabs la rnam par gnas pa'o //
translated: The phrase “he is about to be reborn” means that he is about to take up a new existence.

original: kha dog sdug pa ni bde 'gror 'gro bar ro //
analyzed: kha dog sdug pa ni bde 'gror 'gro bar ro //
translated: The phrase “a beautiful color” refers to a rebirth in a happy migratory state.

original: kha dog mi sdug pa ni ngan 'gror 'gro bar ro //
analyzed: kha dog mi sdug pa ni ngan 'gror 'gro bar ro //
translated: The phrase “an ugly color” refers to a rebirth in an unhappy migratory state.

original: dman pa zhes bya ba ni sdig pa byed par ro //
analyzed: dman pa zhes bya ba ni sdig pa byed par ro //
translated: The phrase “an inferior” refers to one who is engaged in evil conduct.

original: gya nom pa zhes bya ba ni bsod nams byed par ro //
analyzed: gya nom pa zhes bya ba ni bsod nams byed par ro //
translated: The phrase “a superior” refers to one who is engaged in virtuous conduct.

original: las ji lta ba bzhin du nye bar 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni las byas par gyur pa'i 'bras bu la spyod par ro /
analyzed: las ji lta ba bzhin du nye bar 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni las byas par gyur pa'i 'bras bu la spyod par ro /
translated: “One goes according to one’s action” means that one experiences the result of the action that one has done.

original: @176a * // skur pa ni tshigs su bcad pa ma yin pa mi 'dod pa'i tshig gis gshe ba yin no //
analyzed: @176a * // skur pa ni tshigs su bcad pa ma yin pa mi 'dod pa'i tshig gis gshe ba yin no //
translated: “Slander” is the speaking of unpleasant words that are not in verse.🔽“Wrong view” is the view that there is no giving, no sacrifice, no good or bad action, and no result of good or bad action; no this world, no other world; no mother, no father, no beings who are reborn spontaneously; no ascetics or brahmins who, faring rightly and well in this world and the other world, proclaim this world and the other world having realized them by their own superknowledge.

original: log pa'i lta ba las dang chos yang dag par len pa de'i rgyus zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: log pa'i lta ba las dang chos yang dag par len pa de'i rgyus zhes bya ba la /
translated: “Taking up what is right” means taking up action and taking up the teaching.

original: las yang dag par len pa las yang dag par len pa bzhi yod de /
analyzed: las yang dag par len pa las yang dag par len pa bzhi yod de /
translated: “Taking up action” means taking up the four kinds of action:

original: gnag pa dang gnag pa'i rnam par smin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //🔽chos yang dag par len pa la /
analyzed: gnag pa dang gnag pa'i rnam par smin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o // chos yang dag par len pa la /
translated: black action with black result, etc.

original: chos yang dag par len pa bzhi yod de /
analyzed: chos yang dag par len pa bzhi yod de /
translated: “Taking up the teaching” means taking up the four kinds of teaching:🔽the teaching that is pleasant now and ripens in the future in a painful way, etc.

original: da ltar bde ba la ma 'ongs pa na rnam par smin pa sdug bsngal ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //🔽log pa'i lta bas 'jug pa'i las la dam bca' ba dang / chos la dam bca' ba de'i rgyus so //
analyzed: da ltar bde ba la ma 'ongs pa na rnam par smin pa sdug bsngal ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //🔽log pa'i lta bas 'jug pa'i las la dam bca' ba dang / chos la dam bca' ba de'i rgyus so //
translated: “Wrong view” is the view that there is no giving, etc.

original: de'i rgyu zhes bya ba ni log pa'i lta ba de nyid rgyur gyur pa gang la yod pa de ni de'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de'i rgyu zhes bya ba ni log pa'i lta ba de nyid rgyur gyur pa gang la yod pa de ni de'i rgyu yin no //
translated: That which has that as its cause is that which has that wrong view as its cause.

original: de nyid rkyen du gyur pa gang la yod pa de ni de'i rkyen zhes bya ba'i bye brag yin te /
analyzed: de nyid rkyen du gyur pa gang la yod pa de ni de'i rkyen zhes bya ba'i bye brag yin te /
translated: That which has that as its condition is that which has that as its condition. This is the distinction.

original: de dag sgrub par byed pa'i bya ba khyad par du byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag sgrub par byed pa'i bya ba khyad par du byed pa yin no //
translated: They are distinguished by the activity of establishing them.

original: lus dang bral nas zhes bya ba ni zhig nas so //🔽'chi ba'i 'og tu ni srog rnam par nyams par gyur pa'i 'og tu'o //
analyzed: lus dang bral nas zhes bya ba ni zhig nas so // 'chi ba'i 'og tu ni srog rnam par nyams par gyur pa'i 'og tu'o //
translated: Having departed from the body means having perished.🔽After death means after the life faculty has perished.

original: ngan song ni yi dags kyi 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: ngan song ni yi dags kyi 'gro ba'o //
translated: The lower realms are the realm of hungry ghosts.

original: ngan 'gro ni dud 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: ngan 'gro ni dud 'gro ba'o //
translated: The bad destinies are the animal realm.

original: log par ltung ba ni dmyal ba'i 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: log par ltung ba ni dmyal ba'i 'gro ba ste /
translated: The bad migrations are the hell realm.

original: sems can dmyal ba re rer dmyal ba dag yin no //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba re rer dmyal ba dag yin no //
translated: The hells are the individual hells.

original: ngan song dang / ngan 'gro dang ; log par ltung ba dang / dmyal ba ni ngan song ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can zhes bya ba dag yin no //
analyzed: ngan song dang / ngan 'gro dang ; log par ltung ba dang / dmyal ba ni ngan song ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can zhes bya ba dag yin no //
translated: The lower realms, bad destinies, bad migrations, and hells are the sentient beings who are in the lower realms, bad destinies, bad migrations, and hells.

original: las ji lta ba bzhin du 'ga' zhig ni ngan song /🔽'ga' zhig ni ngan 'gro /🔽'ga' zhig ni log par ltung ba /
analyzed: las ji lta ba bzhin du 'ga' zhig ni ngan song / 'ga' zhig ni ngan 'gro / 'ga' zhig ni log par ltung ba /
translated: Some are born in the lower realms,🔽some in the miserable realms,🔽some in the realms of the wrongdoers,

original: 'ga' zhig ni sems can dmyal ba zhes bya ba de dag tu skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig ni sems can dmyal ba zhes bya ba de dag tu skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and some in the hells.

original: bde 'gro zhes bya ba la sogs pa mdzes par 'gro bas na bde 'gro ste /
analyzed: bde 'gro zhes bya ba la sogs pa mdzes par 'gro bas na bde 'gro ste /
translated: The pleasant realms are so called because one goes there pleasantly.

original: der skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: der skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One is born there.

original: mi'i 'jig rten yang bde 'gro smos pas bzung ba yin pa de'i phyir mtho ris kyi 'jig rten smos pa yin la /
analyzed: mi'i 'jig rten yang bde 'gro smos pas bzung ba yin pa de'i phyir mtho ris kyi 'jig rten smos pa yin la /
translated: The human world is also included in the pleasant realms, so the pleasant realms are mentioned.

original: mtho ris ni dud 'gro'i 'gro ba srid pa'i phyir lhar skye bar 'gyur ro zhes smos pa yin no //
analyzed: mtho ris ni dud 'gro'i 'gro ba srid pa'i phyir lhar skye bar 'gyur ro zhes smos pa yin no //
translated: Since the animal realm is possible in the pleasant realms, one is born as a god is mentioned.

original: zag pa zad pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zag pa zad pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The knowledge of the destruction of the defilements and so on.

original: zag pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa yin la de dag zad pa ni spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: zag pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa yin la de dag zad pa ni spangs pa yin no //
translated: The defilements are attachment and so on. Their destruction is their abandonment.

original: de la 'am de'i ldog par byed pa'i shes pa de mngon sum du byed pa ni mngon du byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'am de'i ldog par byed pa'i shes pa de mngon sum du byed pa ni mngon du byed pa'o //
translated: The knowledge that causes that or turns one away from that is direct knowledge.

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i @176b bden pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'i rang bzhin yin la /
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i @176b bden pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'i rang bzhin yin la /
translated: This is the noble truth of suffering is the nature of the result.

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba'o zhes bya ba ni rgyur gyur pa'i phung po lnga'i bdag nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba'o zhes bya ba ni rgyur gyur pa'i phung po lnga'i bdag nyid yin no //
translated: This is the origin of suffering is the nature of the five aggregates that are the cause.

original: 'gog pa ni zad pa yin la /
analyzed: 'gog pa ni zad pa yin la /
translated: Cessation is the extinction of suffering.

original: lam ni zad pa thob par 'gyur ba'i thabs su gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: lam ni zad pa thob par 'gyur ba'i thabs su gyur pa yin no //
translated: The path is the means for attaining the extinction of suffering.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Noble truth is the truth of the noble ones.

original: 'phags pa dag gis rang gi ngo bo'i sgo nas gzigs pa de'i phyir 'phags pa dag la de dag bden pa yin pas na 'phags pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa dag gis rang gi ngo bo'i sgo nas gzigs pa de'i phyir 'phags pa dag la de dag bden pa yin pas na 'phags pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: Since the noble ones see them by way of their own nature, they are the noble ones’ truths.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i shes pas de kho na nyid mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i shes pas de kho na nyid mthong ba yin no //
translated: One fully understands them as they are in reality is the seeing of reality by uncontaminated knowledge.

original: shes pa zhes bya ba ni bar chad med pa'i lam gyis so //
analyzed: shes pa zhes bya ba ni bar chad med pa'i lam gyis so //
translated: One understands them is by the uninterrupted path.

original: mthong ba zhes bya ba ni rnam par grol ba'i lam gyis so //
analyzed: mthong ba zhes bya ba ni rnam par grol ba'i lam gyis so //
translated: One sees them is by the path of liberation.

original: 'dod pa'i zad pa las sems rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i zag pa spangs pa'i phyir sems rnam par grol pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i zad pa las sems rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i zag pa spangs pa'i phyir sems rnam par grol pa yin te /
translated: The phrase his mind is liberated from the obscurations of the desire realm means that his mind is liberated from the desire realm because he has abandoned the contaminants of the desire realm.

original: ma rig pa ma gtogs pa 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa kun du 'ching ba dang bcas pa ni 'dod pa'i zag pa'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa ma gtogs pa 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa kun du 'ching ba dang bcas pa ni 'dod pa'i zag pa'o //
translated: The contaminants of the desire realm are all the afflictions of the desire realm that are binding, with the exception of ignorance.

original: ma rig pa dor ba'i gzugs dang gzugs med na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa kun du 'ching ba dang bcas pa ni srid pa'i zag pa'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa dor ba'i gzugs dang gzugs med na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa kun du 'ching ba dang bcas pa ni srid pa'i zag pa'o //
translated: The contaminants of existence are all the afflictions of the form and formless realms that are binding, with the exception of ignorance.

original: khams gsum pa'i ma rig pa ni ma rig pa'i zag pa'o //
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i ma rig pa ni ma rig pa'i zag pa'o //
translated: The contaminants of ignorance are the ignorance that is found in all three realms.

original: rnam par grol ba la zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i 'ching ba las rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba la zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i 'ching ba las rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: The phrase he is liberated in the destruction of the contaminants means that he is liberated from the bondage of the afflictions.

original: rnam par grol lo zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'o zhes bya ba ni zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa'o //🔽mthong ba ni mi slob pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol lo zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'o zhes bya ba ni zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa'o //🔽mthong ba ni mi slob pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba'o //
translated: The phrase he has realized for himself with direct knowledge means that he has realized the knowledge of destruction and the knowledge of nonarising.🔽The phrase he has entered into the inestimable ease of the bodhisattvas means that he has entered into the ease of the bodhisattvas.

original: tshong dus dang / tshong khang dang bral ba'i skye bo'i tshogs kyi gnas ni grong yin la /
analyzed: tshong dus dang / tshong khang dang bral ba'i skye bo'i tshogs kyi gnas ni grong yin la /
translated: A village is a place where people live who are not merchants or who do not have shops.

original: tshong dus dang tshong khang dang ldan pa ni grong 'dab yin no //
analyzed: tshong dus dang tshong khang dang ldan pa ni grong 'dab yin no //
translated: A town is a place where people live who are merchants or who have shops.

original: gting zab pa ni dka' ba'o //
analyzed: gting zab pa ni dka' ba'o //
translated: It is deep because it is difficult to cross.

original: shin tu dang sa pa nyid kyi phyir gsal ba'o //🔽rdul rags pa med pa'i phyir rnam par dang sa pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu dang sa pa nyid kyi phyir gsal ba'o // rdul rags pa med pa'i phyir rnam par dang sa pa'o //
translated: It is clear because it is very pure.🔽It is limpid because it is free from gross particles.

original: rdul phra mo yang med pa'i phyir rnyog pa med pa'o //🔽chu la rgyu ba'i srog chags kyi yan lag dang 'brel pa can ni phyis yin la /
analyzed: rdul phra mo yang med pa'i phyir rnyog pa med pa'o // chu la rgyu ba'i srog chags kyi yan lag dang 'brel pa can ni phyis yin la /
translated: It is undisturbed because it is free from subtle particles.🔽A river is a stream of water that flows.

original: de dag kho na'i rus pa'i dum bu ni sham bu ka yin no //🔽thabs ma yin pa bzhi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la thabs su gyur pa ma yin pa ni /
analyzed: de dag kho na'i rus pa'i dum bu ni sham bu ka yin no // thabs ma yin pa bzhi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la thabs su gyur pa ma yin pa ni /
translated: A sandbar is a piece of land in the middle of a river.🔽The four kinds of bad practices are the bad practices of desire, of hatred, of fear, and of ignorance.🔽The bad practices of desire are the practices of those who are attached to desire.

original: bla na med pa'i rig pa dang rkang par ldan pa de dag skyed par byed par thabs su gyur pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i @177a * //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i rig pa dang rkang par ldan pa de dag skyed par byed par thabs su gyur pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i @177a * //
translated: The bad practices of hatred are the practices of those who are attached to hatred.

original: tha tshig go //
analyzed: tha tshig go //
translated: The bad practices of fear are the practices of those who are attached to fear.🔽The bad practices of ignorance are the practices of those who are attached to ignorance.

original: kha cig ces bya ba ni 'ga' zhig go //
analyzed: kha cig ces bya ba ni 'ga' zhig go //
translated: “Some” means “a few.”

original: song ste zhes bya ba ni yang dag par song nas so //
analyzed: song ste zhes bya ba ni yang dag par song nas so //
translated: “Having gone” means “having gone correctly.”

original: yal ga dang lo ma'i gnas khang ni spyil bu'o //
analyzed: yal ga dang lo ma'i gnas khang ni spyil bu'o //
translated: A “hut” is a dwelling made of branches and leaves.

original: rtsa ba dang 'bras bu'i kha zas kyis 'tsho ba'i sgo nas rig pa dang rkang bar ldan pa 'dod du zin kyang rnyed par mi 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: rtsa ba dang 'bras bu'i kha zas kyis 'tsho ba'i sgo nas rig pa dang rkang bar ldan pa 'dod du zin kyang rnyed par mi 'gyur ro ;
translated: Even though one has knowledge and the bases of spiritual power, one will not find the food of roots and fruits, because one is living on alms.

original: / ji snyam du sems zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'dri ba la 'jug pa yin zhing snyam sems pa ni shes shing kun nas mthong ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: / ji snyam du sems zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'dri ba la 'jug pa yin zhing snyam sems pa ni shes shing kun nas mthong ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The word “think” is used in the sense of asking a question. “Thinking” means “knowing” and “seeing.”

original: der zhes bya ba ni rtsa ba dang 'bras bu'i zas za ba'i thabs la khyod slob dpon dang bcas shing slob dpon dang lhan cig par mthong ba ste /
analyzed: der zhes bya ba ni rtsa ba dang 'bras bu'i zas za ba'i thabs la khyod slob dpon dang bcas shing slob dpon dang lhan cig par mthong ba ste /
translated: “There” means “in the method of eating food of roots and fruits.” You see that he is with a teacher, that he is together with a teacher.

original: rtsa ba dang 'bras bu'i zas zhes bya ba'i thabs la rig pa dang rkang par ldan pa'i bdag nyid slob dpon dang lhan cig tu gnas par mthong snyam mo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽rtsa ba dang 'bras bu'i kha zas kyis 'tsho ba'i sgo nas rig pa dang zhabs su ldan par mngon par khong du chud pas rtsa ba dang 'bras bu'i zas btang zhing yongs su spangs nas lo ma'i zas 'di ni 'ga' zhig tu rig pa dang rkang par ldan
analyzed: rtsa ba dang 'bras bu'i zas zhes bya ba'i thabs la rig pa dang rkang par ldan pa'i bdag nyid slob dpon dang lhan cig tu gnas par mthong snyam mo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // rtsa ba dang 'bras bu'i kha zas kyis 'tsho ba'i sgo nas rig pa dang zhabs su ldan par mngon par khong du chud pas rtsa ba dang 'bras bu'i zas btang zhing yongs su spangs nas lo ma'i zas 'di ni 'ga' zhig tu rig pa dang rkang par ldan
translated: The meaning is that he saw the method of living on roots and fruits, which is the method of living with the self that is endowed with knowledge and feet, together with the master.

original: pa mngon sum du byed pa'i thabs su bsgrub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pa mngon sum du byed pa'i thabs su bsgrub par 'gyur ro //
translated: By means of living on food of roots and fruits, he understood that it is the method of actualizing the self that is endowed with knowledge and feet. Therefore, having given up and abandoned the food of roots and fruits, he thought that this leaf-food would be established as the method of actualizing the self that is endowed with knowledge and feet in some cases.

original: shing la sogs pa'i 'dab ma 'jam po la lo ma'i sgras bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: shing la sogs pa'i 'dab ma 'jam po la lo ma'i sgras bstan pa yin no //
translated: The word leaf refers to the soft leaves of trees and so on.

original: gang gi tshe lo ma'i zas kyis kyang rig pa dang rkang par ldan pa mngon sum du byed par mi nus pa de'i tshe nges pa med par gyur pas lo ma'i zas de yang yongs su spangs nas sngags kyi gzhung la gzhol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe lo ma'i zas kyis kyang rig pa dang rkang par ldan pa mngon sum du byed par mi nus pa de'i tshe nges pa med par gyur pas lo ma'i zas de yang yongs su spangs nas sngags kyi gzhung la gzhol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When he is unable to realize knowledge and feet even through the food of leaves, then, since there is no certainty, he should give up that food of leaves and turn to the scriptures of mantra.

original: gzhung ni tshig yin no //
analyzed: gzhung ni tshig yin no //
translated: The scriptures are the words.

original: 'brel pa ni snga phyi 'gal ba med par rnam par gzhag pa'i sgo nas rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: 'brel pa ni snga phyi 'gal ba med par rnam par gzhag pa'i sgo nas rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: The connection is established by the absence of contradiction between earlier and later.

original: 'ga' zhig tu rig pa dang rkang par ldan pa mngon sum du byed pa la 'di thabs su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bsam pa 'dis sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu rig pa dang rkang par ldan pa mngon sum du byed pa la 'di thabs su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bsam pa 'dis sbyor ba yin no //
translated: In some cases, this is applied with the intention that it will be a means for realizing knowledge and feet.

original: gang gi tshe thabs des kyang khong du chud par ma gyur pa de'i tshe grong gi nang ste skye bo chen po'i nang du lhags pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe thabs des kyang khong du chud par ma gyur pa de'i tshe grong gi nang ste skye bo chen po'i nang du lhags pa ste /
translated: When he does not understand even through that means, then he should enter the village, into the midst of many people.

original: 'ongs pa'am phyin par gyur nas so //
analyzed: 'ongs pa'am phyin par gyur nas so //
translated: Having come or gone,

original: sbyin pa byin zhing zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams byas pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa byin zhing zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams byas pa'o //
translated: Having given gifts refers to the merit that arises from giving.

original: bsod nams byas te zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims las byung ba'i bsod nams byas pa'o //
analyzed: bsod nams byas te zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims las byung ba'i bsod nams byas pa'o //
translated: Having made merit refers to the merit that arises from morality.

original: 'ongs shing 'ongs pa'i zhes bya ba ni zlos pa'i tshig gnyis yin te /
analyzed: 'ongs shing 'ongs pa'i zhes bya ba ni zlos pa'i tshig gnyis yin te /
translated: Having come and come refers to two repetitions.

original: 'ongs nas ring du lon pa dag las gang dag phyis 'ongs @177b pa de ni 'ongs shing 'ongs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'ongs nas ring du lon pa dag las gang dag phyis 'ongs @177b pa de ni 'ongs shing 'ongs pa yin no //
translated: Those who have come and come are those who have come and come again, having come a long time ago.

original: nus pa ni rdzas kyi nus pa yin la /
analyzed: nus pa ni rdzas kyi nus pa yin la /
translated: Capacity is the capacity of a substance.

original: stobs ni spro ba dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: stobs ni spro ba dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: Strength is the enthusiasm to act.

original: kha cig ni rdzas yod kyang sbyin pa'i gnas la bsnyen bkur gyi bya ba byed pa'i lus kyi spro ba de la yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: kha cig ni rdzas yod kyang sbyin pa'i gnas la bsnyen bkur gyi bya ba byed pa'i lus kyi spro ba de la yod pa ma yin la /
translated: Some have the substance but not the enthusiasm of the body to serve those worthy of gifts.

original: kha cig la ni byed par nus pa dang bcas pa gnyi ga yod pa de bas na /
analyzed: kha cig la ni byed par nus pa dang bcas pa gnyi ga yod pa de bas na /
translated: Some have both the substance and the capacity to act.

original: nus pa ji lta ba stobs ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: nus pa ji lta ba stobs ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is taught that one should give according to one’s capacity and according to one’s strength.

original: thabs ma yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rig pa dang rkang par ldan pa'i thabs ma yin pa bzhi po gang yin pa de dag la yang khyod slob dpon dang bcas par gnas shing 'jug pa ma yin no /
analyzed: thabs ma yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rig pa dang rkang par ldan pa'i thabs ma yin pa bzhi po gang yin pa de dag la yang khyod slob dpon dang bcas par gnas shing 'jug pa ma yin no /
translated: As for the four that are not the means, etc., you and your teacher do not abide in or engage in those four that are not the means endowed with knowledge and feet.

original: ci'i phyir yang khyod kyis bla na med pa'i rig pa dang rkang par ldan pa mang po dang ldan pa'i sh'akya la dman par smra ba'i sgo nas kun du spyod par byed do //
analyzed: ci'i phyir yang khyod kyis bla na med pa'i rig pa dang rkang par ldan pa mang po dang ldan pa'i sh'akya la dman par smra ba'i sgo nas kun du spyod par byed do //
translated: Why do you conduct yourself by speaking disparagingly of the Śākya, who are endowed with the many means that are unsurpassed and endowed with knowledge and feet?

original: bram ze'i drang srong zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: bram ze'i drang srong zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: As for the brāhmaṇa sages, etc.,

original: bram ze'i rigs las rab tu byung zhing dka' thub grub pa la bram ze'i drang srong zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bram ze'i rigs las rab tu byung zhing dka' thub grub pa la bram ze'i drang srong zhes bya'o //
translated: those who go forth from the brāhmaṇa caste and achieve asceticism are called brāhmaṇa sages.

original: rab tu 'jug par byed pa ni 'jug par byed pa'i ngang tshul can yin no //
analyzed: rab tu 'jug par byed pa ni 'jug par byed pa'i ngang tshul can yin no //
translated: They are inclined to engage in, i.e., they engage in,

original: bstod pa zhes bya ba ni bsngags pa'am bstod pa dang 'brel pa'i sngags kyi tshig dag yin no //
analyzed: bstod pa zhes bya ba ni bsngags pa'am bstod pa dang 'brel pa'i sngags kyi tshig dag yin no //
translated: praise, i.e., the words of mantra that are connected with praise or eulogy.

original: dbyangs zhes bya ba ni tshig gi dbye ba'i sgo nas klog pa'o //
analyzed: dbyangs zhes bya ba ni tshig gi dbye ba'i sgo nas klog pa'o //
translated: The term chanting refers to the recitation of the words by means of their phonemes.

original: yang dag par sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni 'brel par rnam par 'jog pa'i sgo nas rnam par 'jog pa yin no //🔽rjes su glur len pa zhes bya ba ni yi ge'i sgo nas de dang 'dra bar klog pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni 'brel par rnam par 'jog pa'i sgo nas rnam par 'jog pa yin no // rjes su glur len pa zhes bya ba ni yi ge'i sgo nas de dang 'dra bar klog pa'o //
translated: The term correct performance refers to the recitation of the words by means of their syllables.🔽The term singing refers to the recitation of the words in a manner that is similar to the melodies of songs.

original: rjes su rjod par byed pa ni don gyi sgo nas so //
analyzed: rjes su rjod par byed pa ni don gyi sgo nas so //
translated: The term recitation refers to the recitation of the words in a manner that is similar to the melodies of songs.

original: grong khyer na gnas pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: grong khyer na gnas pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The term city refers to the body.

original: khyad par ji lta bu dang ldan pa'i grong khyer zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par ji lta bu dang ldan pa'i grong khyer zhe na /
translated: What is the special quality of a city?

original: 'obs kyis bskor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'obs kyis bskor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The root text declares, a city that is surrounded by a moat.

original: legs par brkos pa'i 'obs su brkos pas kun nas bskor ba'i grong khyer gang dag yin pa de dag ni 'obs kyis bskor ba'o //
analyzed: legs par brkos pa'i 'obs su brkos pas kun nas bskor ba'i grong khyer gang dag yin pa de dag ni 'obs kyis bskor ba'o //
translated: A city that is surrounded by a moat is one that is surrounded by a trench that has been dug out well.

original: rtsang btsugs pa ni 'obs kyi 'og tu rnam par 'khrugs shing mang po btsugs shing pha rol gyi dpung bzlog par bya ba'i don du lcags kyi gze ma byas nas gang gi tshe pha rol po'i stobs grong khyer dang thag nye bar 'ong bar 'dod pa de'i tshe
analyzed: rtsang btsugs pa ni 'obs kyi 'og tu rnam par 'khrugs shing mang po btsugs shing pha rol gyi dpung bzlog par bya ba'i don du lcags kyi gze ma byas nas gang gi tshe pha rol po'i stobs grong khyer dang thag nye bar 'ong bar 'dod pa de'i tshe
translated: The stakes are iron spikes that are planted in the ground below the moat in order to block the enemy army.🔽When the enemy army approaches the city,

original: lcags kyi gze ma sa la gtor ba des pha rol gyi stobs bzlog par 'gyur ba dang / rtsang gze ma dang ldan pa dag pha rol po'i stobs 'jug pa'i gegs byed pa'i phyir grong khyer nyid 'gog par byed pa'am /🔽'obs @178a * //
analyzed: lcags kyi gze ma sa la gtor ba des pha rol gyi stobs bzlog par 'gyur ba dang / rtsang gze ma dang ldan pa dag pha rol po'i stobs 'jug pa'i gegs byed pa'i phyir grong khyer nyid 'gog par byed pa'am / 'obs @178a * //
translated: the stakes are thrown down and the enemy army is blocked.

original: kyis kun nas bsgags pa nyid kyi phyir 'gog par byed pa'i grong khyer yin no //
analyzed: kyis kun nas bsgags pa nyid kyi phyir 'gog par byed pa'i grong khyer yin no //
translated: The city is blocked by the stakes and the moat.

original: phrag par gzar zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bshad pa ni snga ma dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: phrag par gzar zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bshad pa ni snga ma dang 'dra'o //
translated: The explanation of the shoulders, etc., is similar to the previous explanation.

original: bram ze'i khye'u'i tshogs kyis mdun du bdar nas zhes bya ba ni sngon du 'gro bas mchod pa yin no //🔽spyi bo bcings pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: bram ze'i khye'u'i tshogs kyis mdun du bdar nas zhes bya ba ni sngon du 'gro bas mchod pa yin no // spyi bo bcings pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The phrase surrounded by a group of young brahmins indicates that they were his attendants.🔽The phrase with his head wrapped and so on indicates the way in which they were adorned.

original: spyi bo bcings pa ni gtsug tor gyi rnam pa la sogs pas skra'i bkod pa mdzes par byas pa'o //🔽lag pa ku ba'i spu can zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: spyi bo bcings pa ni gtsug tor gyi rnam pa la sogs pas skra'i bkod pa mdzes par byas pa'o // lag pa ku ba'i spu can zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase with his head wrapped means that his hair was arranged in a beautiful manner, including a topknot.

original: ji ltar ku ba gzhon nu lung las ma gtogs pa ba spu phra mo yod pa de bzhin du de dag gi lag pa dag kyang ngo //🔽lto dang 'dra bar kun nas zlum pa dang / mtho la mi lhod pa'i nu ma gang la yod pa de ni lto dang 'dra ba'i nu ma can no //
analyzed: ji ltar ku ba gzhon nu lung las ma gtogs pa ba spu phra mo yod pa de bzhin du de dag gi lag pa dag kyang ngo // lto dang 'dra bar kun nas zlum pa dang / mtho la mi lhod pa'i nu ma gang la yod pa de ni lto dang 'dra ba'i nu ma can no //
translated: The phrase with his hands like tender sugarcane means that his hands were like tender sugarcane stalks, with fine hair.🔽The phrase with breasts like full water balloons means that his breasts were full and firm.

original: bsku ba ni dri'i rdzas sam 'bru mar gyis lus byugs pa'o //🔽dpung pa'i rgyan ni dpung rgyan no //
analyzed: bsku ba ni dri'i rdzas sam 'bru mar gyis lus byugs pa'o // dpung pa'i rgyan ni dpung rgyan no //
translated: The phrase anointed with fragrant substances means that his body was anointed with fragrant substances or oil.🔽The phrase with armlets means that he had arm ornaments.

original: do shal ni mgul rgyan gyi bye brag go //
analyzed: do shal ni mgul rgyan gyi bye brag go //
translated: The phrase with necklaces means that he had various types of necklaces.

original: shin tu brgyan pa ni legs par klubs pa yin no //
analyzed: shin tu brgyan pa ni legs par klubs pa yin no //
translated: The phrase adorned means that he was well dressed.

original: rkang pa brkyang ste zhes bya ba ni rkang ba rkyong bar byed pas so //
analyzed: rkang pa brkyang ste zhes bya ba ni rkang ba rkyong bar byed pas so //
translated: Stretching out the feet means to stretch out the feet.

original: nyes pa dag ces bya ba ni drang srong rnying pa'i chos las bskyod pa de'i phyir mkhan po'i nyes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyes pa dag ces bya ba ni drang srong rnying pa'i chos las bskyod pa de'i phyir mkhan po'i nyes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Faults means that which causes the transgression of the ancient sages' Dharma, and therefore it is called the fault of the preceptor.

original: rtsig pas bsgribs pa'am zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rtsig pas bsgribs pa'am zhes bya ba la /
translated: Covered by a wall means that...

original: nga rgyal gyis mngon sum du sbyin par mi nus pa dag dang rjes su mthun pa'i sgrub pa mi byed pa de bas na rgyal po bdag gi mdangs kyis gnod par ma gyur cig snyam pa de'i phyir gos kyis bsgribs shing bar du gcad pa yin no //
analyzed: nga rgyal gyis mngon sum du sbyin par mi nus pa dag dang rjes su mthun pa'i sgrub pa mi byed pa de bas na rgyal po bdag gi mdangs kyis gnod par ma gyur cig snyam pa de'i phyir gos kyis bsgribs shing bar du gcad pa yin no //
translated: Because of pride, one is unable to give directly, and one does not practice in accordance with it. Therefore, thinking May the king not be harmed by my radiance, it is covered by cloth and obstructed.

original: shes pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: shes pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: Consciousness means consciousness.

original: snga phyi spyod pa la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: snga phyi spyod pa la mkhas pa'o //
translated: It is skill in the conduct of past and future.

original: longs spyod la btsos pa'i zas yongs su longs spyod pa'i snying po nyid yin pa de'i phyir btsos pa slong ba zhes bstan to //
analyzed: longs spyod la btsos pa'i zas yongs su longs spyod pa'i snying po nyid yin pa de'i phyir btsos pa slong ba zhes bstan to //
translated: The essence of fully enjoying food cooked with wealth is the essence of fully enjoying cooked food. Therefore, it is taught as begging for cooked food.

original: shin tu nga rgyal ba nyid kyis 'dir nyes pa yin no //
analyzed: shin tu nga rgyal ba nyid kyis 'dir nyes pa yin no //
translated: It is a fault here because of excessive pride.

original: dpyod par byos shig ces bya ba ni nges par dpyad par bya ba'o //
analyzed: dpyod par byos shig ces bya ba ni nges par dpyad par bya ba'o //
translated: You should investigate means you should analyze.

original: lkog tu bya ba ni rgyal pos stong pa gtsang ba gya nom pa'o //
analyzed: lkog tu bya ba ni rgyal pos stong pa gtsang ba gya nom pa'o //
translated: Secretly means in private, pure, and excellent.

original: smras pa ni yi ge'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: smras pa ni yi ge'i sgo nas so //
translated: Said means by means of letters.

original: smra ba ni don gyi bdag nyid kyi sgo nas so //🔽rgyal por gyur pa'am zhes bya ba ni rgyal por dbang bskur ba thob pa'o //
analyzed: smra ba ni don gyi bdag nyid kyi sgo nas so // rgyal por gyur pa'am zhes bya ba ni rgyal por dbang bskur ba thob pa'o //
translated: Spoken means by means of the meaning itself.🔽Having become a king means having obtained the consecration of a king.

original: rgyal po nyid du zhugs par 'gyur ba'am zhes bya ba ni dbang bskur du rung bar skyes pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal po nyid du zhugs par 'gyur ba'am zhes bya ba ni dbang bskur du rung bar skyes pa'o //
translated: Will enter into kingship means being born suitable for consecration.

original: drang srong nyid du zhugs par 'gyur ram zhes bya ba ni drang srong gi lam thob par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: drang srong nyid du zhugs par 'gyur ram zhes bya ba ni drang srong gi lam thob par gyur pa'o //
translated: Will enter into the state of a sage means having attained the path of a sage.

original: shin tu @178b zhes bya ba ni shin tu khyad par du legs par rtse gcig tu gtod pa'i sgo nas yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu @178b zhes bya ba ni shin tu khyad par du legs par rtse gcig tu gtod pa'i sgo nas yid la byed pa'o //
translated: Very means mental attention by means of complete, excellent, and single-pointed focus.

original: don dang zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'dod pa'i don thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dang zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'dod pa'i don thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Meaning means for the sake of attaining the desired goal.

original: phan pa dang zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pha rol gyi phun sum tshogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan pa dang zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pha rol gyi phun sum tshogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For the sake of benefit means for the sake of the excellence of the next world.

original: bde ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni thar pa'i bde ba thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni thar pa'i bde ba thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For the sake of happiness means for the sake of attaining the happiness of liberation.

original: 'dod cing zhes bya ba ni ae ma'o bdag gis mtshan nyid kyis rang gi ngo bo shes par bya'o zhes de ltar 'dod pa dang bcas par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod cing zhes bya ba ni ae ma'o bdag gis mtshan nyid kyis rang gi ngo bo shes par bya'o zhes de ltar 'dod pa dang bcas par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: With desire means with the desire, Oh, may I know the essence of reality through its characteristics.

original: the tshom du gyur pas zhes bya ba ni ci 'di la mtshan de gnyis yod dam med ces so //
analyzed: the tshom du gyur pas zhes bya ba ni ci 'di la mtshan de gnyis yod dam med ces so //
translated: With doubt means with the doubt, Do these two characteristics exist or not?

original: gsang ba'i phyogs kyi sba ba ni gsang ba'i sba ba yin la /
analyzed: gsang ba'i phyogs kyi sba ba ni gsang ba'i sba ba yin la /
translated: The concealment of the hidden side is the concealment of the hidden.

original: sbubs su nub pa ni zhugs pa'am g-yogs pas sbubs su nub pa ste /🔽sbubs su nub pa yang de yin la /
analyzed: sbubs su nub pa ni zhugs pa'am g-yogs pas sbubs su nub pa ste / sbubs su nub pa yang de yin la /
translated: The hidden is the concealed or the covered.

original: gsang ba'i sba ba yang yin pas na gsang ba'i sba ba sbubs su nub pa'o //
analyzed: gsang ba'i sba ba yang yin pas na gsang ba'i sba ba sbubs su nub pa'o //
translated: The hidden is that which is concealed and hidden.

original: yangs pa nyid kyi phyir dang srab pa nyid kyi phyir ljags ring la srab pa'o //
analyzed: yangs pa nyid kyi phyir dang srab pa nyid kyi phyir ljags ring la srab pa'o //
translated: The long tongue is long because it is extensive and thin because it is slender.

original: 'dis skyes bu chen por mtshon par byed pa yin pas na mtshan te /
analyzed: 'dis skyes bu chen por mtshon par byed pa yin pas na mtshan te /
translated: This is the mark of a great man.

original: zhabs legs par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: zhabs legs par gnas pa yin no //
translated: His feet are well-planted.

original: mi'i rgyud du 'khrungs pa nyid kyi phyir mi mchog ces bya ba yin te /
analyzed: mi'i rgyud du 'khrungs pa nyid kyi phyir mi mchog ces bya ba yin te /
translated: He is the best of men because he is born in the human race.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni 'khor ba'i nang du 'dus pa'i sems can ma lus pa'i mchog tu gyur pa yin no //🔽bud med lta bu zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni 'khor ba'i nang du 'dus pa'i sems can ma lus pa'i mchog tu gyur pa yin no // bud med lta bu zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: The Lord is the best of all beings included in the cycle of existence.🔽With regard to the line, “His tongue is like a woman’s,”

original: lce bud med dang 'dra ba zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: lce bud med dang 'dra ba zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: his tongue is like a woman’s.

original: brkyang mdzad pa zhes bya ba la zhal nas phyung bar mdzad nas so //
analyzed: brkyang mdzad pa zhes bya ba la zhal nas phyung bar mdzad nas so //
translated: He stretches it out from his face.

original: bdag gi the tshom bsal ba dor bar ro //
analyzed: bdag gi the tshom bsal ba dor bar ro //
translated: He removes the doubt of the self.

original: snyan par grags pa zhes bya ba ni grags pas 'khor ba ma lus par gyur ba'o //
analyzed: snyan par grags pa zhes bya ba ni grags pas 'khor ba ma lus par gyur ba'o //
translated: He is famous because of his fame in all the world.

original: dka' bas rnyed par nus pa'i phyir rnyed par shin tu dka' ba'o //
analyzed: dka' bas rnyed par nus pa'i phyir rnyed par shin tu dka' ba'o //
translated: He is very difficult to find because he can be found with difficulty.

original: rgyu mtshan zhes bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul gyi mthu las byung ba'i rtags yin no //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan zhes bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul gyi mthu las byung ba'i rtags yin no //
translated: The reason is the sign that arises from the power of his magic.

original: de la gsal ba ni ma g-yogs par te /
analyzed: de la gsal ba ni ma g-yogs par te /
translated: Here, “clear” means uncovered.

original: gsang ba'i sba ba sbubs su nub par mthong bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gsang ba'i sba ba sbubs su nub par mthong bar gyur pa'o //
translated: One sees the secret organ disappear into a sheath.

original: rjes su yi rangs te zhes bya ba ni tshig gis so //
analyzed: rjes su yi rangs te zhes bya ba ni tshig gis so //
translated: “Rejoicing” is with words.

original: mngon par bstod pa zhes bya ba ni sems kyis so //
analyzed: mngon par bstod pa zhes bya ba ni sems kyis so //
translated: “Praising” is with the mind.

original: khyim gyi mchog ces bya ba ni khang pa'i mchog go //
analyzed: khyim gyi mchog ces bya ba ni khang pa'i mchog go //
translated: “The best house” is the best room.

original: mngon par 'dod pa'i bya ba byed pa'i sgo nas 'dus shing rten so sor 'jog pa'i sgo nas 'khod pa yin no //🔽mang du zhes bya ba ni bram ze'i khye'u aambasta 'ong ba la sdod pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa'i bya ba byed pa'i sgo nas 'dus shing rten so sor 'jog pa'i sgo nas 'khod pa yin no // mang du zhes bya ba ni bram ze'i khye'u aambasta 'ong ba la sdod pa'o //
translated: They assembled and sat down in the sense of taking up their respective positions, in the sense of performing the desired action.

original: phyag @179a * //
analyzed: phyag @179a * //
translated: “Many” means that they waited for the young brahmin Ambattha to come.

original: 'tshal te zhes bya ba ni tshig gi sgo nas phyag byas nas so //
analyzed: 'tshal te zhes bya ba ni tshig gi sgo nas phyag byas nas so //
translated: “Bowed down” is with words.

original: ji ltar brjod pa ni ji ltar 'jug pa dang / ji ltar rab tu 'jug par byed pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar brjod pa ni ji ltar 'jug pa dang / ji ltar rab tu 'jug par byed pa'o //
translated: “As it is said” is how it is engaged and how it is made to engage.

original: khros shing zhes bya ba ni thog mar khros pa'i phyir khros pa'o //
analyzed: khros shing zhes bya ba ni thog mar khros pa'i phyir khros pa'o //
translated: “Angry” is angry because of being angry at first.

original: 'khrugs pa ni lus 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrugs pa ni lus 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “Disturbed” is because of a change in the body.

original: gtum pa ni ngag gis 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtum pa ni ngag gis 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Fierce is because of the change in speech.

original: yi ma rangs pa zhes bya ba ni rgyun gyis sems rangs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: yi ma rangs pa zhes bya ba ni rgyun gyis sems rangs pa med pa'o //
translated: Displeased is because of the lack of mental satisfaction in the continuum.

original: ae ma'o pho nya byed pa zhes bya ba ni khyod kyis pho nya'i las chen po byas pa yin te ngas gzhan kho na smras pa khyod kyis gzhan kho na byas pa yin no //
analyzed: ae ma'o pho nya byed pa zhes bya ba ni khyod kyis pho nya'i las chen po byas pa yin te ngas gzhan kho na smras pa khyod kyis gzhan kho na byas pa yin no //
translated: Ah! You are a messenger means You have done the great work of a messenger. I said one thing, but you did another.

original: mi 'dod du zin kyang mngon par 'dod pa'i gnas su mngag gzhug la 'gro bar byed pa gang yin pa mngag gzhug pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'dod du zin kyang mngon par 'dod pa'i gnas su mngag gzhug la 'gro bar byed pa gang yin pa mngag gzhug pa'o //
translated: Even though not desired, one goes to the place of manifest desire, which is being sent.

original: nga yang ngan song du ltung ngo zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir khyod de 'dra ba'i drang srong chen po la bsnyen bkur la sbyor bar mi byed pas ngag yang sems can dmyal bar ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nga yang ngan song du ltung ngo zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir khyod de 'dra ba'i drang srong chen po la bsnyen bkur la sbyor bar mi byed pas ngag yang sems can dmyal bar ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: I will also fall into the lower realms means Because you do not engage in serving such a great sage, I will also fall into the hells.

original: de dang der zhes bya ba ni smad pa'i zlos pa'i tshig gnyis yin no //
analyzed: de dang der zhes bya ba ni smad pa'i zlos pa'i tshig gnyis yin no //
translated: There and there are two words of contempt.

original: bdag kyang tshod bzung bar gyur to zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bdag kyang tshod bzung bar gyur to zhes bya ba la /
translated: I have also been tested, he said.

original: kho bo skabs thams cad du nyes pa dang ldan par byed pa'o //
analyzed: kho bo skabs thams cad du nyes pa dang ldan par byed pa'o //
translated: I am always guilty.

original: gus pa mngon du song ba'i lus dang / ngag gi 'jug pa ni bsnyen bkur yin no //
analyzed: gus pa mngon du song ba'i lus dang / ngag gi 'jug pa ni bsnyen bkur yin no //
translated: Respectful engagement of body and speech is service.

original: bca' bar bya ba ni rtsa ba la sogs pa lnga yin la /
analyzed: bca' bar bya ba ni rtsa ba la sogs pa lnga yin la /
translated: The five, beginning with roots, are to be prepared.

original: bza' bar bya ba ni khur ba la sogs pa lnga yin no //
analyzed: bza' bar bya ba ni khur ba la sogs pa lnga yin no //
translated: The five, beginning with flour, are to be eaten.

original: yi rangs pa zhes bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa'i tshig gis spro bar mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: yi rangs pa zhes bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa'i tshig gis spro bar mdzad pa'o //
translated: The word “rejoicing” means to delight in the words just explained.

original: mchod sbyin nang na sbyin sreg mchog / ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: mchod sbyin nang na sbyin sreg mchog / ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The best of sacrifices is the fire sacrifice.

original: me la sbyin sreg sbyin pa ni me'i sbyin sreg yin la /
analyzed: me la sbyin sreg sbyin pa ni me'i sbyin sreg yin la /
translated: The sacrifice in which the fire is the recipient is the fire sacrifice.

original: mchod sbyin gang dag la me'i sbyin sreg gi kha yod pa de dag ni sbyin sreg kha yin te /
analyzed: mchod sbyin gang dag la me'i sbyin sreg gi kha yod pa de dag ni sbyin sreg kha yin te /
translated: Those sacrifices in which the fire sacrifice is included are fire sacrifice mouths.

original: me ni lha'i kha yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig des lha'i ched du cung zad me la sbyin sreg byas pa de thams cad lha'i khar 'jug pa yin no zhes 'jig rten na rab tu grags pa yin no //
analyzed: me ni lha'i kha yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig des lha'i ched du cung zad me la sbyin sreg byas pa de thams cad lha'i khar 'jug pa yin no zhes 'jig rten na rab tu grags pa yin no //
translated: The word “mouth” means “for the sake of.” The world is well known to say that whatever is offered in the fire for the sake of the gods enters the mouth of the gods.

original: yang na mchog ni gtso bor gyur pa yin la /
analyzed: yang na mchog ni gtso bor gyur pa yin la /
translated: Or else, the best is the most important.

original: mchod sbyin ni gtong mchod yin te /
analyzed: mchod sbyin ni gtong mchod yin te /
translated: Sacrifice is the giving of a gift.

original: gang bsod nams kyi don du lha'i ched du sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: gang bsod nams kyi don du lha'i ched du sbyin par bya'o //
translated: It is the giving of a gift for the sake of the gods for the sake of merit.

original: rig byed thams cad kyi nang na skyod bcas kyi rig byed gtso bor gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: rig byed thams cad kyi nang na skyod bcas kyi rig byed gtso bor gyur pa yin no //
translated: Among all the Vedas, the Ṛg Veda is the best.

original: gang de dag gi nang na rgyal po de 'di mchog ste /
analyzed: gang de dag gi nang na rgyal po de 'di mchog ste /
translated: Among them, the king is the best.

original: bsod nams dang bdag po'i sgo nas gtso bor gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: bsod nams dang bdag po'i sgo nas gtso bor gyur pa yin no //
translated: He is the best by reason of his merit and his power.

original: rgyu skar thams cad kyi nang na zla ba ni gdung @179b zhing gsal bar byed pa'i phyir gsal byed de /
analyzed: rgyu skar thams cad kyi nang na zla ba ni gdung @179b zhing gsal bar byed pa'i phyir gsal byed de /
translated: Among all the stars, the moon is the best, because it illuminates and refreshes.

original: de dag thams cad kyi nang na nyi ma kho na dkyil 'khor dang gsal ba'i sgo nas mchog ste /
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyi nang na nyi ma kho na dkyil 'khor dang gsal ba'i sgo nas mchog ste /
translated: Among them, the sun is the best, by reason of its orb and its brilliance.

original: gtso bor gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: gtso bor gyur pa yin no //
translated: It is the most important.

original: steng du 'og min gyi mthar thug pa nas thad kar 'jig rten gyi khams kyi mthar thug pa dang / 'og tu rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi bar du'o ;
analyzed: steng du 'og min gyi mthar thug pa nas thad kar 'jig rten gyi khams kyi mthar thug pa dang / 'og tu rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi bar du'o ;
translated: Above, up to Akaniṣṭha; below, up to the wind mandala.

original: / ji snyed 'gro bar 'gro ba dag / ces bya ba la /
analyzed: / ji snyed 'gro bar 'gro ba dag / ces bya ba la /
translated: As many as there are in the world of gods and men,🔽in the realms of Yama,🔽in the abodes of the gods and gandharvas,🔽in the world of the asuras,🔽in the abodes of the kumbhandas and raksasas,🔽in the realms of the nagas and garudas,🔽in the abodes of the pisacas and kumbhakaras,🔽in the realms of the pretas and pishacas,🔽in the abodes of the kumbhakaras and piśācas,🔽in the realms of the pretas and piśācas,🔽in the abodes of the kumbhāṇḍas and rākṣasas,🔽in the realms of the nāgas and garuḍas,🔽in the abodes of the piśācas and kumbhāṇḍas,🔽in the realms of the pretas and piśācas,🔽in the abodes of the kumbhāṇḍas and piśācas,

original: ji snyed 'gro ba'i rnam pa'am /
analyzed: ji snyed 'gro ba'i rnam pa'am /
translated: in the realms of the pretas and piśācas,🔽in the abodes of the kumbhāṇḍas and piśācas,

original: srog chags rgyu ba'i bar du 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: srog chags rgyu ba'i bar du 'jug pa'o //
translated: in the realms of the pretas and piśācas,🔽in the abodes of the kumbhāṇḍas and piśācas,🔽in the realms of the pretas and piśācas,🔽in the abodes of the kumbhāṇḍas and piśācas,🔽in the realms of the pretas and piśācas,🔽in the abodes of the kumbhāṇḍas and piśācas,

original: 'jig rten lha dang bcas pa'i zhes bya ba ni lha dang bcas pa'i 'khor ma lus pa dag gis yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni mchog dang gtso bor gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten lha dang bcas pa'i zhes bya ba ni lha dang bcas pa'i 'khor ma lus pa dag gis yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni mchog dang gtso bor gyur pa yin te /
translated: in the realms of the pretas and piśācas,🔽in the abodes of the kumbhāṇḍas and piśācas,🔽in the realms of the pretas and piśācas,🔽in the abodes of the kumbhāṇḍas and piśācas,

original: dper na sbyin sreg la sogs pa mchod sbyin la sogs pa'i nang du gtso bor gyur pa yin pa de bzhin du /🔽bcom ldan 'das ni 'gro ba thams cad kyi gtso bor gyur pa de'i phyir mchod pa ste /
analyzed: dper na sbyin sreg la sogs pa mchod sbyin la sogs pa'i nang du gtso bor gyur pa yin pa de bzhin du / bcom ldan 'das ni 'gro ba thams cad kyi gtso bor gyur pa de'i phyir mchod pa ste /
translated: in the realms of the pretas and piśācas,🔽in the abodes of the kumbhāṇḍas and piśācas,🔽in the realms of the pretas and piśācas,🔽in the abodes of the kumbhāṇḍas and piśācas,🔽in the realms of the pretas and piśācas,

original: gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyi mchod pa ni tshad med pa dang / 'bras bu med pa ma yin pa dang / 'dod pa'i 'bras bu can yin bas na rtag tu mchod par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyi mchod pa ni tshad med pa dang / 'bras bu med pa ma yin pa dang / 'dod pa'i 'bras bu can yin bas na rtag tu mchod par bya ba yin no //
translated: in the abodes of the kumbhāṇḍas and piśācas

original: til drus ma dang 'bras kyi bag phye bsres pa las srab mor byas shing mar gyi nang du bskol ba'i zas kyi bye brag ni khur ba yin no //
analyzed: til drus ma dang 'bras kyi bag phye bsres pa las srab mor byas shing mar gyi nang du bskol ba'i zas kyi bye brag ni khur ba yin no //
translated: A particular kind of food that is made thin by mixing sesame flour with rice flour and boiling it in ghee is a pancake.

original: sems mnyes par bgyid dam zhes bya ba ni tshul mthun pa'i sgrub pas sems dang rjes su mthun par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: sems mnyes par bgyid dam zhes bya ba ni tshul mthun pa'i sgrub pas sems dang rjes su mthun par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Please the mind means to be in accord with the mind through proper practice.

original: chos 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni chos la gus pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: chos 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni chos la gus pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: One who desires the Dharma means one who has respect for the Dharma.

original: byis pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: byis pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: As for childish... and so on,

original: lung thos pa la sogs pa dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir byis pa'o //
analyzed: lung thos pa la sogs pa dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir byis pa'o //
translated: one is childish because of being devoid of hearing the scriptures and so on.

original: skabs ni gnas skabs yin te /
analyzed: skabs ni gnas skabs yin te /
translated: A situation is a state.

original: skabs shes pa'i phyir skabs 'tshal ba yin la /
analyzed: skabs shes pa'i phyir skabs 'tshal ba yin la /
translated: One who knows the situation is one who knows the situation.

original: skabs 'tshal ba ma yin pa ni skabs ma 'tshal ba'o //
analyzed: skabs 'tshal ba ma yin pa ni skabs ma 'tshal ba'o //
translated: One who does not know the situation is one who does not know the situation.

original: de ltar ni ngas 'di ltar song la bcom ldan 'das kyi mi chen po'i mtshan dag yang dag par bstan pa'i skabs gzhan kho nar gyur pa smras pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni ngas 'di ltar song la bcom ldan 'das kyi mi chen po'i mtshan dag yang dag par bstan pa'i skabs gzhan kho nar gyur pa smras pa yin gyi /
translated: Thus, I said, Go and explain to the Blessed One only another situation where the marks of a great being are taught.

original: 'di ltar ngas bsnyen bkur mi byed pa ni ma yin pa de bas na /
analyzed: 'di ltar ngas bsnyen bkur mi byed pa ni ma yin pa de bas na /
translated: It is not that I do not respect him.

original: des bsnyen bkur ma byas pa de'i phyir de ni skabs mi shes pa yin no //
analyzed: des bsnyen bkur ma byas pa de'i phyir de ni skabs mi shes pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, he does not know the proper time for respect.

original: srab skyogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: srab skyogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: With regard to the passage beginning “the reins,”

original: rta bzlog pa'i thabs su gyur pa ni srab skyogs yin la /
analyzed: rta bzlog pa'i thabs su gyur pa ni srab skyogs yin la /
translated: the reins are the means of controlling the horse.

original: de gtong ba ni 'phral du yongs su spong ba'o //
analyzed: de gtong ba ni 'phral du yongs su spong ba'o //
translated: To let go of them is to completely abandon them for the moment.

original: bsgreng ba ni gyen du bsgreng bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: bsgreng ba ni gyen du bsgreng bar byed pa'o //
translated: To raise them is to hold them high.

original: gnod pa nyung ngam zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gnod pa nyung ngam zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: With regard to the passage beginning “Are you free from troubles?,”

original: @180a * // gnod pa ni phyi rol gyi rnam par 'tshe bas gzir ba'o //
analyzed: @180a * // gnod pa ni phyi rol gyi rnam par 'tshe bas gzir ba'o //
translated: troubles are being oppressed by external violence.

original: kha na ma tho ba ni lus las byung ba'i nad kyis gzir ba'o //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba ni lus las byung ba'i nad kyis gzir ba'o //
translated: Sins are being oppressed by diseases that arise from the body.

original: mi bde ba ni yid skyo bar gyur pa'i nad do //
analyzed: mi bde ba ni yid skyo bar gyur pa'i nad do //
translated: Discomforts are diseases that arise from mental distress.

original: bskyod pa yang ba ni bya ba la lus yang ba nyid do //
analyzed: bskyod pa yang ba ni bya ba la lus yang ba nyid do //
translated: Lightness of body is the lightness of the body for action.

original: 'tsho ba ni bsod snyoms kyi sgo nas gnas par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'tsho ba ni bsod snyoms kyi sgo nas gnas par gyur pa'o //
translated: Life is the continuation of life through alms.

original: stobs ni 'tsho ba'i 'bras bu nus pa nyid do //
analyzed: stobs ni 'tsho ba'i 'bras bu nus pa nyid do //
translated: Strength is the ability to produce the results of life.

original: bde ba ni lus kyi'o //
analyzed: bde ba ni lus kyi'o //
translated: Happiness is bodily.

original: reg par gnas pa ni mngon par dga' ba dang bcas pas gnas pa'o //
analyzed: reg par gnas pa ni mngon par dga' ba dang bcas pas gnas pa'o //
translated: To live in contact is to live with delight.

original: phud pa ni yongs su dor ba'o //
analyzed: phud pa ni yongs su dor ba'o //
translated: To be cast off is to be abandoned.

original: gos bgos pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gos bgos pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: As for the expression “wearing the same clothes,” etc.,

original: rjes su reg pa ni reg par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su reg pa ni reg par byed pa'o //
translated: to touch is to make contact.

original: do ker ni skra gtsug phud du bcings pa'o //
analyzed: do ker ni skra gtsug phud du bcings pa'o //
translated: A topknot is a lock of hair left uncut on the crown of the head.

original: grags pa las rnyed pa zhes bya ba ni thob bar gyur ba ste /
analyzed: grags pa las rnyed pa zhes bya ba ni thob bar gyur ba ste /
translated: What is acquired through fame is what is obtained through fame.

original: de dag ni rigs thams cad kyi mchog tu gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni rigs thams cad kyi mchog tu gyur pa yin no //
translated: These are the best of all the castes.

original: mnyam pa des longs spyod dag gi bgo bsha' bya'o zhes bya ba de lta bu ni grags pa las rnyed pa dag yin no //
analyzed: mnyam pa des longs spyod dag gi bgo bsha' bya'o zhes bya ba de lta bu ni grags pa las rnyed pa dag yin no //
translated: One should share one’s enjoyments with those who are equal to oneself in caste, etc.

original: grags pa kho nas yongs su longs spyod par byed do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: grags pa kho nas yongs su longs spyod par byed do zhes bya ba la /
translated: One should enjoy one’s enjoyments through fame alone.

original: rigs gzhan la phyag byas pa de'i tshe bdag la snyan par mi 'gyur ro snyam pa des gzhan g-yo'i sgo nas phyag byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rigs gzhan la phyag byas pa de'i tshe bdag la snyan par mi 'gyur ro snyam pa des gzhan g-yo'i sgo nas phyag byed pa yin no //
translated: When one bows to another caste, one thinks, “This will not be pleasing to me.” One bows to others through deceit.

original: shin tu nga rgyal can zhes bya ba ni lhag pa'i nga rgyal dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu nga rgyal can zhes bya ba ni lhag pa'i nga rgyal dang ldan pa'o //
translated: “Extremely proud” means having excessive pride.

original: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The discourse on generosity, etc.

original: sbyin pa dang ldan pa'i gtam ni sbyin pa'i gtam mo //
analyzed: sbyin pa dang ldan pa'i gtam ni sbyin pa'i gtam mo //
translated: The discourse on generosity is the discourse on generosity that is endowed with generosity.

original: tshul khrims kyi phan yon gsal bar byed pa'i gtam ni tshul khrims kyi gtam mo /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi phan yon gsal bar byed pa'i gtam ni tshul khrims kyi gtam mo /
translated: The discourse on the benefits of morality is the discourse that elucidates the benefits of morality.

original: mtho ris kyi bsngags pa brjod pa'i gtam ni mtho ris dang rjes su mthun pa'i gtam mo //
analyzed: mtho ris kyi bsngags pa brjod pa'i gtam ni mtho ris dang rjes su mthun pa'i gtam mo //
translated: The discourse that praises heaven is the discourse that praises heaven and is consistent with heaven.

original: 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga'i ro myong ba gsal bar byed pa'i gtam ni ro myong ba'i gtam yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga'i ro myong ba gsal bar byed pa'i gtam ni ro myong ba'i gtam yin te /
translated: The discourse on the experience of the five sense objects is the discourse that elucidates the experience of the five sense objects.

original: ji skad du gal te bdag 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la brten pa'i bde ba skye zhing skyes pa'i 'dod pa dag gi ro myong bar brjod pa 'dod pa de dag gi ro myang ba ni shin tu chung la 'on kyang de dag gi nyes dmigs ni che
analyzed: ji skad du gal te bdag 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la brten pa'i bde ba skye zhing skyes pa'i 'dod pa dag gi ro myong bar brjod pa 'dod pa de dag gi ro myang ba ni shin tu chung la 'on kyang de dag gi nyes dmigs ni che
translated: As it is said, “If the pleasure that arises from relying on the five sense objects arises, then the experience of those desired sense objects is said to be experienced. The experience of those desired sense objects is very small, but the disadvantages of those sense objects are great.

original: bar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bar bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is taught.

original: 'dod pa'i nyes dmigs gsal bar byed pa'i gtam ni 'dod pa'i nyes dmigs kyi gtam yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i nyes dmigs gsal bar byed pa'i gtam ni 'dod pa'i nyes dmigs kyi gtam yin te /
translated: The discourse that clarifies the faults of desire is the discourse on the faults of desire.

original: ji skad du 'dod pa'i rgyu dang / 'dod pa'i gzhi dang / 'dod pa'i rten gyis ma bu dang lhan cig rtsod par byed pas na /
analyzed: ji skad du 'dod pa'i rgyu dang / 'dod pa'i gzhi dang / 'dod pa'i rten gyis ma bu dang lhan cig rtsod par byed pas na /
translated: As it is said, “Because of desire, for the sake of desire, and on the basis of desire, mother and son fight with each other.

original: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi sgo nas nyes par spyod pa chen po spyod pas sems can dmyal ba dag tu skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi sgo nas nyes par spyod pa chen po spyod pas sems can dmyal ba dag tu skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Through the practice of great evil deeds by body, speech, and mind, one is born in the hells.”

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs ni @180b 'dod chags la sogs pa yin la /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs ni @180b 'dod chags la sogs pa yin la /
translated: The side of affliction is desire and so on.

original: 'dir kun nas nyon mongs par byed ces bya ba'i dbang du byas nas kun nas nyon mongs pa ni 'khor ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dir kun nas nyon mongs par byed ces bya ba'i dbang du byas nas kun nas nyon mongs pa ni 'khor ba yin no //
translated: Here, in the sense of “afflicting,” affliction is samsara.

original: rnam par byang bas na rnam par byang ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par byang bas na rnam par byang ba ste /
translated: Purification is purification.

original: thar pa yin pa'am /
analyzed: thar pa yin pa'am /
translated: It is liberation.

original: 'dis rnam par byang bar byed pas ni rnam par byang ba ste//
analyzed: 'dis rnam par byang bar byed pas ni rnam par byang ba ste//
translated: Or, because it causes purification, it is purification.

original: 'phags pa'i lam yin zhing de'i phyogs ni dad pa la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yin zhing de'i phyogs ni dad pa la sogs pa yin no //
translated: The noble path is the side of faith, etc.

original: nges par 'byung ba'i dngos po ni nges par 'byung ba nyid de /🔽khyim gyi gnas yongs su spangs pa'am /
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba'i dngos po ni nges par 'byung ba nyid de / khyim gyi gnas yongs su spangs pa'am /
translated: The state of renunciation is renunciation itself.🔽It is the state of renunciation because one renounces the household life,

original: 'dis nges par 'byung ba ste zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas nas 'phags pa'i lam nges par 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: 'dis nges par 'byung ba ste zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas nas 'phags pa'i lam nges par 'byung ba yin te /
translated: or because one renounces evil through this path.

original: de'i dngos po ni nges par 'byung ba nyid do ;
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni nges par 'byung ba nyid do ;
translated: The state of renunciation is the state of renunciation itself.

original: / rab tu dben pa ni lus dang sems kyi sgo nas dben pa'i gnas skabs yin te /
analyzed: / rab tu dben pa ni lus dang sems kyi sgo nas dben pa'i gnas skabs yin te /
translated: Isolation is the state of being isolated in body and mind.

original: de dag gi bsngags pa ni yon tan gyi gtam yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi bsngags pa ni yon tan gyi gtam yin no //
translated: The praise of these is the talk about their virtues.

original: yid bde ba khyad par du 'phags pa dang ldan pa'i phyir dga' ba'i sems so //
analyzed: yid bde ba khyad par du 'phags pa dang ldan pa'i phyir dga' ba'i sems so //
translated: The mind is delighted because it is endowed with special satisfaction.

original: 'phags pa'i lam skye ba dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir dge ba'i sems so //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam skye ba dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir dge ba'i sems so //
translated: The mind is virtuous because it is in conformity with the arising of the noble path.

original: rab tu dga' ba dang ldan pa'i phyir mgu ba'i sems so //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba dang ldan pa'i phyir mgu ba'i sems so //
translated: The mind is pleased because it is endowed with supreme joy.

original: lam skye ba'i 'chi ba ma yin pa'i phyir sgrib pa med pa'i sems so //
analyzed: lam skye ba'i 'chi ba ma yin pa'i phyir sgrib pa med pa'i sems so //
translated: It is a mind without obscurations, because it is not the death that is the arising of the path.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i yon tan skye ba'i skal ba dang ldan pa'i phyir skal ba yod pa'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i yon tan skye ba'i skal ba dang ldan pa'i phyir skal ba yod pa'o //
translated: It is endowed with good fortune, because it is endowed with the fortune of the arising of future good qualities.

original: mthu zhes bya ba ni nus pa'o //
analyzed: mthu zhes bya ba ni nus pa'o //
translated: Power means ability.

original: kun nas bstod pa ni skyes bu'i don bla na med pa yin te /
analyzed: kun nas bstod pa ni skyes bu'i don bla na med pa yin te /
translated: It is a complete praise, because it is the unsurpassed human goal.

original: yang dag par bstod pa'i phyir mthu yod pas na kun nas bstod pa can nam /
analyzed: yang dag par bstod pa'i phyir mthu yod pas na kun nas bstod pa can nam /
translated: It is a complete praise, because it is a praise of the truth.

original: 'di la kun nas bstod pa'i dgos pa'i chos bstan pa yod pa de ni 'dir kun nas bsngags pa can gyi chos bshad pa ste /
analyzed: 'di la kun nas bstod pa'i dgos pa'i chos bstan pa yod pa de ni 'dir kun nas bsngags pa can gyi chos bshad pa ste /
translated: Here, the teaching of the Dharma that has the purpose of complete praise is the teaching of the Dharma that is completely praised.

original: 'phags pa'i lam skye ba dang rjes su mthun pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam skye ba dang rjes su mthun pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the arising of the noble path, and is concordant with it.

original: dag pa zhes bya ba ni dkar po'o //
analyzed: dag pa zhes bya ba ni dkar po'o //
translated: Pure means white.

original: nag po dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni dri ma med pa'o //
analyzed: nag po dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni dri ma med pa'o //
translated: Free from darkness means stainless.

original: btsor rung ba zhes bya ba ni btsor rung bar gyur ba'o //
analyzed: btsor rung ba zhes bya ba ni btsor rung bar gyur ba'o //
translated: Fit for burning means fit to be burned.

original: legs par tshon 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni shin tu tshon chags par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: legs par tshon 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni shin tu tshon chags par gyur pa'o //
translated: “Well-apprehending the colors” means being very attached to them.

original: shin tu khong du chud pa zhes bya ba ni zag pa me pa'i shes pas yongs su gcad pa'am mthong bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu khong du chud pa zhes bya ba ni zag pa me pa'i shes pas yongs su gcad pa'am mthong bar gyur pa'o //
translated: “Well-penetrated” means being cut off by the knowledge of the destruction of the defilements, or being seen by it.

original: chos mthong ba ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: chos mthong ba ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o //
translated: “Seeing the Dharma” is the truth of suffering.

original: rnyed pa ni 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa ni 'gog pa'o //
translated: “Gaining” is cessation.

original: rig pa ni kun 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rig pa ni kun 'byung ngo //
translated: “Knowledge” is the truth of the origin.

original: khong du chud pa ni lam mo //
analyzed: khong du chud pa ni lam mo //
translated: “Penetration” is the truth of the path.

original: 'dod pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba thog ma med pa nas goms pa'i chos dag khong du chud pa'i 'dod pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba thog ma med pa nas goms pa'i chos dag khong du chud pa'i 'dod pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: “Freedom from desire” is freedom from the desire to penetrate the dharmas that have been familiar since beginningless cyclic existence.

original: de bzhin du @181a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du @181a * //
translated: Similarly,

original: bden pa bzhi'i yul la the tshom dang bral bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: bden pa bzhi'i yul la the tshom dang bral bar gyur pa'o //
translated: one becomes free from doubt with regard to the objects of the four truths.

original: gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan tshad mar gyur pa ma yin pa'i chos dag rang nyid kyis rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan tshad mar gyur pa ma yin pa'i chos dag rang nyid kyis rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Not dependent on others” means that one realizes the dharmas by oneself without taking another as one’s measure.

original: gzhan gyis mi bkri ba ni chos gzhan de yang khong du chud pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyis mi bkri ba ni chos gzhan de yang khong du chud pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: He is not led by others because he has understood that Dharma himself.

original: ston pa'i bstan pa ste bshad pa'i chos dang / gzhan rnam par gnas pa'i chos dag la mi 'jigs pa ste /
analyzed: ston pa'i bstan pa ste bshad pa'i chos dang / gzhan rnam par gnas pa'i chos dag la mi 'jigs pa ste /
translated: He is fearless with regard to the Teacher's teaching, i.e., the Dharma that is taught, and with regard to the Dharma that is established for others.

original: 'jigs pa med pa nyid thob pa'o //
analyzed: 'jigs pa med pa nyid thob pa'o //
translated: He has attained fearlessness.

original: shin tu 'das pa zhes bya ba ni chos la rab tu zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: shin tu 'das pa zhes bya ba ni chos la rab tu zhugs pa yin no //
translated: He has gone beyond means he has entered the Dharma.

original: 'das pa'i tshig gnyis pa ni phyir 'jig par mi 'gyur ba thob par bgyi'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'das pa'i tshig gnyis pa ni phyir 'jig par mi 'gyur ba thob par bgyi'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The second mention of gone beyond indicates that he has attained the state of non-regression.

original: yang na dga' ba'i yul la len gnyis brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na dga' ba'i yul la len gnyis brjod pa yin no //
translated: Or else, it refers to the two kinds of objects of delight.

original: skyabs su mchi ste zhes bya ba ni yangs su skyob par mdzad pa'i sgo nas rten sgrub par byed pa'o //🔽ji srid 'tsho'i bar du zhes bya ba ni ji srid 'tsho'i mthar thug pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: skyabs su mchi ste zhes bya ba ni yangs su skyob par mdzad pa'i sgo nas rten sgrub par byed pa'o // ji srid 'tsho'i bar du zhes bya ba ni ji srid 'tsho'i mthar thug pa'i bar du'o //
translated: He takes refuge in the Three Jewels, i.e., he establishes them as his support by way of their being his ultimate protection.🔽For as long as he lives means until the end of his life.

original: srog dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni ji srid bdag srog dang ldan pa de srid du 'gro ba yin no //
analyzed: srog dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni ji srid bdag srog dang ldan pa de srid du 'gro ba yin no //
translated: As long as he has life means as long as he has life.
