translated: The limb of enlightenment called mindfulness, etc.

original: mi shes pa lhag ma med pa dang bral ba'i phyir dang / bya ba byas pa khong du chud pa'i phyir dang / yang bya ba med pa khong du chud pa'i phyir zad la mi skye ba'i ye shes ni byang chub yin la dran pa la sogs pa de dag @187a * //
analyzed: mi shes pa lhag ma med pa dang bral ba'i phyir dang / bya ba byas pa khong du chud pa'i phyir dang / yang bya ba med pa khong du chud pa'i phyir zad la mi skye ba'i ye shes ni byang chub yin la dran pa la sogs pa de dag @187a * //
translated: Because of the absence of any remaining ignorance, because of the understanding of what is to be done, and because of the understanding of what is not to be done, the knowledge of destruction and non-production is enlightenment. And because of their conformity with that, mindfulness, etc.

original: ni de dang mthun pa'i phyir byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o //
analyzed: ni de dang mthun pa'i phyir byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o //
translated: are called the limbs of enlightenment.

original: dran pa ni don mngon par brjod pa ste /
analyzed: dran pa ni don mngon par brjod pa ste /
translated: Mindfulness is the expression of the meaning.

original: byas pa dang / bya ba dang / byed par 'gyur ba'i chos brjod par mi 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: byas pa dang / bya ba dang / byed par 'gyur ba'i chos brjod par mi 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the expression of the Dharma that is to be done, that is being done, and that has been done.

original: dran pa kho na yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag yin no //
analyzed: dran pa kho na yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag yin no //
translated: Mindfulness alone is the requisite of enlightenment.

original: khyad par ji lta bu dang ldan pa zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par ji lta bu dang ldan pa zhe na /
translated: What kind of distinction does it possess?

original: dben pa la brten pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: dben pa la brten pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: He says, “it is based upon seclusion, etc.”

original: dben pa ni 'dir lus dben pa dang / sems dben pa yin la /
analyzed: dben pa ni 'dir lus dben pa dang / sems dben pa yin la /
translated: Seclusion here is the seclusion of the body and the seclusion of the mind.

original: dben pa la brten cing rab tu 'jug pa'i phyir dben pa la brten pa'o //
analyzed: dben pa la brten cing rab tu 'jug pa'i phyir dben pa la brten pa'o //
translated: It is based upon seclusion because it is engaged in the support of seclusion.

original: 'dod pa'i khams la sogs pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba brten cing rab tu 'jug pa'i phyir 'dod chags dang bral ba la brten pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams la sogs pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba brten cing rab tu 'jug pa'i phyir 'dod chags dang bral ba la brten pa'o //
translated: It is based upon nonattachment because it is engaged in the support of nonattachment to the realm of desire, etc.

original: nyon mongs pa spangs pa la gnas pas rab tu 'jug pa'i phyir 'gog pa la brten pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spangs pa la gnas pas rab tu 'jug pa'i phyir 'gog pa la brten pa'o //
translated: It is based upon cessation because it is engaged in the support of the abandonment of moral defilement.🔽It is based upon non-production because it is engaged in the support of the non-production of the other-dependent nature.

original: yon tan gong nas gong du 'phel pa la gnas pas rab tu 'jug pa'i phyir 'du 'dzin dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: yon tan gong nas gong du 'phel pa la gnas pas rab tu 'jug pa'i phyir 'du 'dzin dang bral ba ste /
translated: It is based upon the absence of conceptual differentiation because it is engaged in the support of the perfected nature.

original: yon tan chung ngu'i rnam pa snga ma snga ma dor zhing snga na med pa'i yon tan 'bring dang chen po skyed pa ni 'du 'dzi dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas nas so //
analyzed: yon tan chung ngu'i rnam pa snga ma snga ma dor zhing snga na med pa'i yon tan 'bring dang chen po skyed pa ni 'du 'dzi dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas nas so //
translated: The former aspects of lesser virtues are abandoned and middling and great virtues are generated that were not previously present.

original: yang na dben pa la brten pa zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba'i las la brten pa yin no //🔽'dod chags dang bral ba la brten pa ni bar chad med pa'i lam la brten pa yin te des nyon mongs pa thob pa gcod pa'i phyir ro //🔽'gog pa la brten pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par grol ba'i lam la brten pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na dben pa la brten pa zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba'i las la brten pa yin no // 'dod chags dang bral ba la brten pa ni bar chad med pa'i lam la brten pa yin te des nyon mongs pa thob pa gcod pa'i phyir ro // 'gog pa la brten pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par grol ba'i lam la brten pa yin te /
translated: Or, “based on solitude” refers to the path of preparation.🔽“Based on freedom from attachment” refers to the uninterrupted path because it severs the obtainment of affliction.

original: de'i bral ba thob pa skyed par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //🔽'du 'dzi dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni khyad par gyi lam la brten pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i bral ba thob pa skyed par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro // 'du 'dzi dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni khyad par gyi lam la brten pa yin te /
translated: “Based on cessation” refers to the path of liberation because it generates the obtainment of freedom.

original: khyad par khong du chud pa'i sgo nas yon tan khyad par can du yongs su gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par khong du chud pa'i sgo nas yon tan khyad par can du yongs su gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Based on freedom from society” refers to the special path because it transforms into a special virtue through comprehending the special.

original: chos rnam par 'byed pa ni chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po nyid du khong du chud pa dag chos rnam par 'byed pa yin no //
analyzed: chos rnam par 'byed pa ni chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po nyid du khong du chud pa dag chos rnam par 'byed pa yin no //
translated: The discernment of dharmas is the discernment of dharmas that are small, middling, and great.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos skyed cing 'gog pa la mngon par spro ba ni brtson 'grus yin no //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos skyed cing 'gog pa la mngon par spro ba ni brtson 'grus yin no //
translated: Vigor is the delight in producing wholesome dharmas and in preventing unwholesome dharmas.

original: dga' ba ni yid bde ba'o //
analyzed: dga' ba ni yid bde ba'o //
translated: Joy is mental pleasure.

original: shin tu sbyangs pa ni sems las su rung ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa ni sems las su rung ba nyid yin no //
translated: Serenity is the serviceability of mind.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni sems rtse gcig pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni sems rtse gcig pa nyid yin no //
translated: Concentration is one-pointedness of mind.

original: btang snyoms ni dge ba'i chos la 'jug pa la btang snyoms su byed pa yin no //🔽yang dag par sdug par 'gyur ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dga' ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'dod chags ni yang dag par sdug pa yin la /
analyzed: btang snyoms ni dge ba'i chos la 'jug pa la btang snyoms su byed pa yin no // yang dag par sdug par 'gyur ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dga' ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'dod chags ni yang dag par sdug pa yin la /
translated: Equanimity is the evenness of mind that is applied to wholesome dharmas.🔽The phrase “that which is associated with delight” refers to the attachment that is associated with joy.

original: yang dag par dga' ba dang rjes @187b su mthun pa ni yang dag par sdug par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: yang dag par dga' ba dang rjes @187b su mthun pa ni yang dag par sdug par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: The phrase “that which is associated with delight and satisfaction” refers to the delight and satisfaction that are associated with that attachment.

original: byams pa dag gi gnas pa ni byams pa'i gnas pa'o //
analyzed: byams pa dag gi gnas pa ni byams pa'i gnas pa'o //
translated: The abode of love is the abode of love.

original: de gang zhe na /
analyzed: de gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: smras pa / lus kyi las te lus can gyi 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: smras pa / lus kyi las te lus can gyi 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is said: It is bodily action, which means the engagement of embodied beings.

original: dper na grogs po rab kyi lus kyi las dang 'jug pa de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba'i don 'dir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dper na grogs po rab kyi lus kyi las dang 'jug pa de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba'i don 'dir 'gyur ro //
translated: For example, it is like the bodily action and engagement of a good friend. This is the meaning here.

original: ston pa dang nye bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni tshul dang mthun par bsnyen bkur byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ston pa dang nye bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni tshul dang mthun par bsnyen bkur byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Teaching and attending means attending respectfully in a way that accords with propriety.

original: khyad par shes par byed pas na mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par shes par byed pas na mkhas pa'o //
translated: One is skilled because one causes others to understand the distinctions.

original: shes pa'i sgo nas rtag tu dge ba la kun du spyod pa'i ngang tshul can du gyur pa zhes bya ba'i mkhas pa ma yin gyi tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa yin te /
analyzed: shes pa'i sgo nas rtag tu dge ba la kun du spyod pa'i ngang tshul can du gyur pa zhes bya ba'i mkhas pa ma yin gyi tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa yin te /
translated: One is not skilled in the sense of always engaging in virtue through knowledge, but one is a fellow practitioner of pure conduct.

original: de dag gi yang nye bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi yang nye bar byed pa'o //
translated: One is also attending to them.

original: chos 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa byams pa'i lus kyi las la 'dir chos kyi sgras bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: chos 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa byams pa'i lus kyi las la 'dir chos kyi sgras bstan pa yin no //
translated: In this context, the term Dharma refers to the bodily action of love, as in the phrase this Dharma... and so on.

original: 'dis mgu bar byed pas na mgu bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis mgu bar byed pas na mgu bar byed pa'o //
translated: It is a pleasing action because it pleases.

original: yul gang la byams pa'i lus kyi las 'jug par 'gyur ba de la gdon mi za bar bla ma'i blo nyid kyang 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas nas bla mar byed pas na bla mar byed pa yin no //🔽yid mgu bas na yid mi mgu ste /
analyzed: yul gang la byams pa'i lus kyi las 'jug par 'gyur ba de la gdon mi za bar bla ma'i blo nyid kyang 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas nas bla mar byed pas na bla mar byed pa yin no // yid mgu bas na yid mi mgu ste /
translated: It is a respectful action because it is a respectful action toward the object toward which the action of the body out of love proceeds, since the mind of respect necessarily proceeds toward that object.🔽It is a pleasing action because it pleases the mind.

original: yid mgu bar byed pas na yid mgu bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: yid mgu bar byed pas na yid mgu bar byed pa'o //
translated: It is a gratifying action because it gratifies the mind.

original: mgu ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mgu ba la sogs pa ni rgyu mtshan yin no //
analyzed: mgu ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mgu ba la sogs pa ni rgyu mtshan yin no //
translated: The phrase “because of the cause of pleasing, etc.” means that pleasing, etc. are the causes.🔽The action of the body out of love proceeds toward the object toward which the action of the body out of love proceeds.

original: yul gang la byams pa'i lus kyi las byed pa de la yang byed pa po'i bla ma'i blo skyed par byed de /
analyzed: yul gang la byams pa'i lus kyi las byed pa de la yang byed pa po'i bla ma'i blo skyed par byed de /
translated: The mind of respect toward the agent is generated toward that object.

original: de la 'dir bla mar dgongs so //
analyzed: de la 'dir bla mar dgongs so //
translated: Here, respect is intended.

original: bsgom pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase “because of cultivation” means

original: byams pa'i lus kyi las kyi yul gang yin pa de'i yon tan bsgom pa ste /
analyzed: byams pa'i lus kyi las kyi yul gang yin pa de'i yon tan bsgom pa ste /
translated: the cultivation of the virtues of the object toward which the action of the body out of love proceeds.

original: yang dang yang mngon sum du byed pa'am bsgom pa yin par dgongs so //
analyzed: yang dang yang mngon sum du byed pa'am bsgom pa yin par dgongs so //
translated: It is the repeated practice of what has been directly realized.

original: bsdu ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'dre bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsdu ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'dre bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to gather means in order to mix.

original: mthun pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sems gcig tu gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sems gcig tu gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to be harmonious means in order to be of one mind.

original: sems kyis gnod pa byed pa'i dngos po 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir mi 'thob par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems kyis gnod pa byed pa'i dngos po 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir mi 'thob par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to not obtain means in order to not grasp the object of mental harm.

original: rtsub mo smra ba dang / phyir smra ba med pa'i phyir mi rtsod par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtsub mo smra ba dang / phyir smra ba med pa'i phyir mi rtsod par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to not dispute means in order to not speak harshly or respond harshly.

original: gcig tu 'gyur ba ni ro gcig tu 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gcig tu 'gyur ba ni ro gcig tu 'gyur ba'o //
translated: To be of one taste means to be of one flavor.

original: byams pa'i ngag gi las dang / byams pa'i yid kyi las zhes bya ba ni byams pa'i lus dang ngag gi las dang ldan pa ni gsal ba nyid kyi phyir mgu bar byed pa la sogs pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: byams pa'i ngag gi las dang / byams pa'i yid kyi las zhes bya ba ni byams pa'i lus dang ngag gi las dang ldan pa ni gsal ba nyid kyi phyir mgu bar byed pa la sogs pa nyid yin la /
translated: The action of loving speech and the action of loving mind are the actions of loving body and speech, because they are clear and manifest.

original: yid kyi las ni gsal ba nyid kyi phyir ji ltar rigs she na /
analyzed: yid kyi las ni gsal ba nyid kyi phyir ji ltar rigs she na /
translated: But how is the action of mind clear and manifest?
Here,

original: bla ma dang byams pa'i gnas thams cad ni mgu ba dang bla mar 'gyur ba yin zhing yongs su mi shes pa'i rang bzhin yang ma yin pa de'i phyir 'di la nyes pa yod pa ma yin no zhes ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: bla ma dang byams pa'i gnas thams cad ni mgu ba dang bla mar 'gyur ba yin zhing yongs su mi shes pa'i rang bzhin yang ma yin pa de'i phyir 'di la nyes pa yod pa ma yin no zhes ston par mdzad do //
translated: and all the gurus and those worthy of love are pleased and become gurus. And it is not of the nature of complete non-understanding. Therefore, there is no fault in this.

original: chos dang ldan pas thob pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la chos las ma bye bas na chos dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: chos dang ldan pas thob pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la chos las ma bye bas na chos dang ldan pa ste /
translated: Obtained through Dharma and so on. It is through Dharma because it is not separated from Dharma.

original: rnam pa thams cad du rung ba zhes bya ba'i par du'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du rung ba zhes bya ba'i par du'o //
translated: Up to being suitable in every way.

original: rigs pas thob pa'i chos kyi rnyed pa yin gyi chos tshul 'chos pa dang kha gsag la sogs pa log pa'i 'tsho ba'i sgo nas rnyed par gyur pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rigs pas thob pa'i chos kyi rnyed pa yin gyi chos tshul 'chos pa dang kha gsag la sogs pa log pa'i 'tsho ba'i sgo nas rnyed par gyur pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is the acquisition of Dharma obtained through reasoning, not obtained through wrong livelihood such as hypocrisy and flattery.

original: tha na lhung bzed du 'ongs pa zhes bya ba ni lhung bzed du byin gyis brlabs shing thob par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: tha na lhung bzed du 'ongs pa zhes bya ba ni lhung bzed du byin gyis brlabs shing thob par gyur pa'o //
translated: Even if it comes into the begging bowl means it is obtained by being blessed into the begging bowl.

original: lhung bzed du chud pa zhes bya ba ni lhung bzed du zas zhugs par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: lhung bzed du chud pa zhes bya ba ni lhung bzed du zas zhugs par gyur pa'o //
translated: If it enters the begging bowl means if food enters the begging bowl.

original: gzhan la 'god par byed pa'i phyir thun mong du spyod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan la 'god par byed pa'i phyir thun mong du spyod par byed pa'o //
translated: He practices in common because he is not stingy with his knowledge.

original: gsal por za ba'i phyir bsnogs te mi spyod pa ste /
analyzed: gsal por za ba'i phyir bsnogs te mi spyod pa ste /
translated: He does not eat surreptitiously because he eats in public.

original: pha rol po la 'god par byed pas 'jigs pa'i phyir phag tu za bar mi byed pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: pha rol po la 'god par byed pas 'jigs pa'i phyir phag tu za bar mi byed pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: He does not eat in secret because he is afraid of being reproached by others.

original: gang tshul khrims zhes bya ba la sogs pa la nyes byas tsam gyi 'tshal ba'i tshul khrims kyis kyang ma gnong ba nyid kyi phyir ma nyams pa yin no //
analyzed: gang tshul khrims zhes bya ba la sogs pa la nyes byas tsam gyi 'tshal ba'i tshul khrims kyis kyang ma gnong ba nyid kyi phyir ma nyams pa yin no //
translated: He is not broken because he does not violate even the minor rules of training.

original: 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyi rgyu can gyi 'dod pa'i rnam par rtog pa la sogs pas ma gnod pa nyid kyi phyir ma ral ba yin no //
analyzed: 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyi rgyu can gyi 'dod pa'i rnam par rtog pa la sogs pas ma gnod pa nyid kyi phyir ma ral ba yin no //
translated: He is not torn because he is not harmed by the causes of immorality, such as thoughts of desire.

original: bdag gi tshul khrims 'dis 'dod pa na spyod pa 'dod pa'i 'bras bur gyur cig ces de lta bu sngo bar mi byed pa'i phyir ma sbags pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag gi tshul khrims 'dis 'dod pa na spyod pa 'dod pa'i 'bras bur gyur cig ces de lta bu sngo bar mi byed pa'i phyir ma sbags pa yin no //
translated: He is not stained because he does not dedicate his morality to rebirth in the desire realm, thinking, “By this morality of mine, may I be reborn in the desire realm and enjoy desirable, desirable things.”

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i 'bras bu nyid du sngo bar mi byed pa'i phyir ma 'dres pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i 'bras bu nyid du sngo bar mi byed pa'i phyir ma 'dres pa yin no //
translated: It is unadulterated because it does not turn into the result of the form and formless realms.

original: gang gi phyir tshul khrims kyis 'khor ba'i 'bras bu don du gnyer na tshul khrims de shin tu rnam par dag par mi 'gyur ba de'i phyir ma spags pa dang ma 'dres pa zhes bstan to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir tshul khrims kyis 'khor ba'i 'bras bu don du gnyer na tshul khrims de shin tu rnam par dag par mi 'gyur ba de'i phyir ma spags pa dang ma 'dres pa zhes bstan to //
translated: Since morality is sought for the result of cyclic existence, if one does not have pure morality, it is called “not excellent” and “not unadulterated.”

original: rang dbang can zhes bya ba ni gzhan la rag mi lus shing rang dbang du gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: rang dbang can zhes bya ba ni gzhan la rag mi lus shing rang dbang du gyur pa yin no //
translated: “Independent” means not dependent on others, but being independent.

original: gang tshul khrims kyi rang bzhin kho nas srung bar byed kyi gzhan gyi ngor ma yin pa de ni phan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang tshul khrims kyi rang bzhin kho nas srung bar byed kyi gzhan gyi ngor ma yin pa de ni phan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: “Beneficial” means that one protects through the nature of morality itself, and not for the sake of others.

original: ma 'dres pa zhes bya ba ni khyim pa'i skye bo dang 'dre bas zil gyis gnon par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma 'dres pa zhes bya ba ni khyim pa'i skye bo dang 'dre bas zil gyis gnon par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: “Unadulterated” means that one is not overcome by mixing with householders.

original: legs par blangs pa zhes bya ba ni 'dzin pa'i dus su chen po'i sems kyis blangs pa yin no //
analyzed: legs par blangs pa zhes bya ba ni 'dzin pa'i dus su chen po'i sems kyis blangs pa yin no //
translated: “Well-taken” means that it is taken with a great mind at the time of taking it.

original: legs par brtsams pa @188b zhes bya ba ni nyi ma re zhing 'phel bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: legs par brtsams pa @188b zhes bya ba ni nyi ma re zhing 'phel bar byed pa yin no //
translated: “Well-composed” means that it increases day by day.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mkhas pas bsngags pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mkhas pas bsngags pa yin no //
translated: For that very reason, it is praised by the wise.

original: gang gi phyir mya ngan las 'das par bsdos pa nyid kyi phyir ma smad pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mya ngan las 'das par bsdos pa nyid kyi phyir ma smad pa'o //
translated: It is not censured because it is directed toward nirvana.

original: gang lta ba 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gang lta ba 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: As for the passage beginning “This view,”

original: lta ba ni 'dir zag pa med pa'i shes rab yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lta ba ni 'dir zag pa med pa'i shes rab yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: it should be understood that “view” here refers to uncontaminated wisdom.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de 'phags pa nges par 'byung ba ni nges par 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de 'phags pa nges par 'byung ba ni nges par 'byung ba ste /
translated: For that very reason, it is the noble ones’ deliverance, i.e., it is deliverance.

original: yang mi ldog pa thob par byed pa'am /
analyzed: yang mi ldog pa thob par byed pa'am /
translated: It causes one to attain irreversibility,

original: nges par 'gro ba yin la nges par 'byung ba'i phyir nus pa yod pas na nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: nges par 'gro ba yin la nges par 'byung ba'i phyir nus pa yod pas na nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: or it is the going forth. Because it is able to cause deliverance, it is that which causes deliverance.

original: nges par 'byung ba dang rjes su mthun pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba dang rjes su mthun pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: It is conducive to deliverance, up to “it is conducive to the attainment of nirvana.”

original: nges par khong du chud pa ni nges par rtogs pa yin la /
analyzed: nges par khong du chud pa ni nges par rtogs pa yin la /
translated: It is definite understanding, i.e., definite realization.

original: nges par rtogs pa'i phyir de yod pas na nges par rtogs par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: nges par rtogs pa'i phyir de yod pas na nges par rtogs par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Because of the realization of that, there is the realization of the truth of the path, since it exists.

original: gang gis she na /
analyzed: gang gis she na /
translated: By what?

original: lta bas nges par 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: lta bas nges par 'byung ba ste /
translated: By the view, which is the means of deliverance.

original: 'khor ba'i 'ching ba'i gnas nas nges par 'gro bar byed pa yin no /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i 'ching ba'i gnas nas nges par 'gro bar byed pa yin no /
translated: It is the means of deliverance from the abode of the bondage of cyclic existence.

original: de gang zhe na /
analyzed: de gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: de byed pa zhes bya ba smos te ;
analyzed: de byed pa zhes bya ba smos te ;
translated: It is said: “that which produces it.”

original: zag pa med pa'i lta ba de byed cing skyed par byed pa gang yin pa de ni de byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i lta ba de byed cing skyed par byed pa gang yin pa de ni de byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That which produces and generates that uncontaminated view is called “that which produces it.”

original: ci'i phyir nges par 'byung bar byed ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir nges par 'byung bar byed ce na /
translated: Why does it produce deliverance?

original: yang dag par sdug bsngal ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: yang dag par sdug bsngal ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: It is said: “because of the complete destruction of suffering,” and so on.

original: sdug bsngal zad pa yang phyir mi ldog par phyin ci ma log pa ni yang dag par sdug bsngal zad pa ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal zad pa yang phyir mi ldog par phyin ci ma log pa ni yang dag par sdug bsngal zad pa ste /
translated: The complete destruction of suffering, which is irreversible and unmistaken, is the complete destruction of suffering.

original: de ni dge slong dag spangs shing gang zag pa med pa'i ye shes kyis spangs pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: de ni dge slong dag spangs shing gang zag pa med pa'i ye shes kyis spangs pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: That is said to be “abandoned by the monk, up to abandoned by the uncontaminated wisdom of abandonment.”

original: 'dis ni phung po lhag phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dis ni phung po lhag phyir ro //
translated: This is because the aggregates remain.

original: gang gi sdug bsngal zad par bya ba yin na /
analyzed: gang gi sdug bsngal zad par bya ba yin na /
translated: If it is the suffering of that which is to be terminated,🔽then it is said that it is for the purpose of terminating suffering.

original: smras pa bsngal mthar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba 'dis ni phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa bstan pa'am /
analyzed: smras pa bsngal mthar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba 'dis ni phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa bstan pa'am /
translated: This teaches the nirvana without remainder of the aggregates,

original: de byed pa nges par 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de byed pa nges par 'byung ba yin no //
translated: or it is the definite emergence that produces that.🔽That very wisdom is definite emergence, because it is the definite emergence of reality.🔽It is definite emergence because it is the definite emergence of reality.

original: shes rab de nyid nges pas byung ba de nyid nges par 'byung ba yin te /🔽nyon mongs pa'i dri ma rab tu 'byin par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab de nyid nges pas byung ba de nyid nges par 'byung ba yin te / nyon mongs pa'i dri ma rab tu 'byin par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is definite emergence because it is the definite emergence of reality.

original: ci'i phyir nges par 'byin par byed pa'i phyir ro //🔽ci'i phyir nges par 'byin par byed ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir nges par 'byin par byed pa'i phyir ro // ci'i phyir nges par 'byin par byed ce na /
translated: It is definite emergence because it is the definite emergence of reality.🔽It is definite emergence because it is the definite emergence of reality.

original: yang dag par sdug bsngal zad par bya ba'i phyir dang / sdug bsngal mthar bya ba'i phyir ro //🔽gang gi sdug bsngal zad par bya ba yin zhe na /🔽smras pa de byed pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag par sdug bsngal zad par bya ba'i phyir dang / sdug bsngal mthar bya ba'i phyir ro // gang gi sdug bsngal zad par bya ba yin zhe na / smras pa de byed pa ste /
