original: de mngon sum du byed pa'i zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽dong ba zhes bya ba ni song shig pa'am /
analyzed: de mngon sum du byed pa'i zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽dong ba zhes bya ba ni song shig pa'am /
translated: It is definite emergence because it is the definite emergence of reality.🔽It is definite emergence because it is the definite emergence

original: kho bos ji srid pa ta la'i grong du phyin gyi bar du phyi bzhin 'brang ba'i dge sbyong gi tshul du'o //
analyzed: kho bos ji srid pa ta la'i grong du phyin gyi bar du phyi bzhin 'brang ba'i dge sbyong gi tshul du'o //
translated: I will follow you as a mendicant until you reach the town of Patalī.

original: 'od ma'i srog shing can zhes bya ba ni grong yin no //
analyzed: 'od ma'i srog shing can zhes bya ba ni grong yin no //
translated: The town is called “Sārandal.”

original: @189a * // rgyal pos byas pa'i gnas ni rgyal po'i gnas te der ro //
analyzed: @189a * // rgyal pos byas pa'i gnas ni rgyal po'i gnas te der ro //
translated: The king’s residence is the king’s palace.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi zhes bya ba la thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas mi shes pa'i phyir dang / mthong ba'i lam gyis ma mthong ba'i phyir dang / slob pa'i lam gyis khong du ma chud pa'i phyir dang / mi slob pa'i lam gyis so sor mi rig pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi zhes bya ba la thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas mi shes pa'i phyir dang / mthong ba'i lam gyis ma mthong ba'i phyir dang / slob pa'i lam gyis khong du ma chud pa'i phyir dang / mi slob pa'i lam gyis so sor mi rig pa'i phyir ram /
translated: The four noble truths are called “noble” because they are not understood by the knowledge that arises from hearing, they are not seen by the path of seeing, they are not penetrated by the path of cultivation, and they are not individually discerned by the path of no-more-learning.

original: sbyor ba'i lam la sogs pas mi shes pa la sogs pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i lam la sogs pas mi shes pa la sogs pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Or else, they are not understood, etc., by the path of preparation, etc.

original: dus ring po zhes bya ba ni thog ma med pa'i dus yin no //
analyzed: dus ring po zhes bya ba ni thog ma med pa'i dus yin no //
translated: “For a long time” means from beginningless time.

original: rgyug cing zhes bya ba ni lha dang mi'i 'gro ba rang gi 'dod pas 'gro ba'i sgo nas 'phangs pa'am skyed pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyug cing zhes bya ba ni lha dang mi'i 'gro ba rang gi 'dod pas 'gro ba'i sgo nas 'phangs pa'am skyed pa yin no //
translated: “It runs” means that it is projected or produced by the human and divine destinies, which are desirable.

original: sems can dmyal ba'i 'gro ba la sogs par mi 'dod bzhin du 'gro bas na kun du 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba'i 'gro ba la sogs par mi 'dod bzhin du 'gro bas na kun du 'gro ba'o //
translated: “It goes everywhere” means that it goes to the destinies of hell beings, etc., which are undesirable.

original: rjes su rtogs shing zhes bya ba ni slob pa'i lam gyis so //
analyzed: rjes su rtogs shing zhes bya ba ni slob pa'i lam gyis so //
translated: “It is realized” means by the path of learning.

original: so sor rtogs pas zhes bya ba ni mi slob pa'i lam gyis so //
analyzed: so sor rtogs pas zhes bya ba ni mi slob pa'i lam gyis so //
translated: “It is fully understood” means by the path of no learning.

original: srid par 'khrid pa ni yang srid kyi sred pa'am 'dod chags la sogs pa thams cad nyid do //
analyzed: srid par 'khrid pa ni yang srid kyi sred pa'am 'dod chags la sogs pa thams cad nyid do //
translated: “It leads to existence” means that it is the craving for renewed existence or all the attachments, etc.

original: skye ba'i 'khor ba zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i rgyun spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: skye ba'i 'khor ba zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i rgyun spangs pa yin no //
translated: “It is the cycle of birth” means that it is the stream of birth.

original: yang srid pa med de zhes bya ba 'dis ni yang srid kyi 'khor ba med par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: yang srid pa med de zhes bya ba 'dis ni yang srid kyi 'khor ba med par bstan pa yin no //
translated: “It has no renewed existence” shows that there is no cycle of renewed existence.

original: shing pa la'i mchod rten na zhes bya ba ni shing pa ta las nye bar mtshon pa'i bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa'am /
analyzed: shing pa la'i mchod rten na zhes bya ba ni shing pa ta las nye bar mtshon pa'i bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa'am /
translated: “In the shrine of the Pataliputrani” means in the shrine of the Blessed One Sakyamuni, which is marked by the Pataliputrani tree.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od srungs kyi dbu skra dang sen mo'i mchod rten yin no //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od srungs kyi dbu skra dang sen mo'i mchod rten yin no //
translated: The stupa of the perfectly awakened Buddha Kasyapa’s hair and nails.

original: 'dus pa las 'dus pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: 'dus pa las 'dus pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: “An assembly of assemblies” and so on.

original: rigs tha dad pa'i tshogs ni 'dir 'dus pa yin la /
analyzed: rigs tha dad pa'i tshogs ni 'dir 'dus pa yin la /
translated: An assembly is a collection of different kinds.

original: rigs gcig tu gyur pa dag gi 'dus pa ni tshogs yin no //
analyzed: rigs gcig tu gyur pa dag gi 'dus pa ni tshogs yin no //
translated: An assembly of those who have become one kind is a group.

original: song ste zhes bya ba ni yang dag par 'ongs par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: song ste zhes bya ba ni yang dag par 'ongs par gyur pa'o //
translated: “Having gone” means having come together.

original: drung du phyin pa ni sems gcig tu 'dres par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: drung du phyin pa ni sems gcig tu 'dres par gyur pa'o //
translated: “Having arrived” means having become one-pointed in mind.

original: khyim bdag gi sgras ni bram ze ma gtogs pa 'gro ba gtso bor gyur pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: khyim bdag gi sgras ni bram ze ma gtogs pa 'gro ba gtso bor gyur pa gzung ngo //
translated: The word “householder” includes the most important of the other kinds of people, except for Brahmins.

original: nyes dmigs ni nyes pa yin no //
analyzed: nyes dmigs ni nyes pa yin no //
translated: “Trouble” means fault.

original: 'jig rten 'di dang 'jig rten pha rol gyi phan pa la brtson pas mi gzhol ba nyid ni bag med pa yin la /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di dang 'jig rten pha rol gyi phan pa la brtson pas mi gzhol ba nyid ni bag med pa yin la /
translated: Carelessness is the lack of devotion to the welfare of this world and the next.

original: bag med pa dang ldan pa'i phyir sems can yang bag med pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bag med pa dang ldan pa'i phyir sems can yang bag med pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: And it should be understood that beings are careless because they are endowed with carelessness.

original: bag med pa kho na gnas dang rten dang gzhi yin pas bag med par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: bag med pa kho na gnas dang rten dang gzhi yin pas bag med par gnas pa'o //
translated: He is heedless, because heedlessness is the basis, the support, and the cause of his great loss of wealth.

original: de nyid rgyu yin de'i rgyus longs spyod chen po nyams pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid rgyu yin de'i rgyus longs spyod chen po nyams pa ste /
translated: Heedlessness is the cause of his great loss of wealth.

original: longs spyod 'jigs par 'gyur ba thob @189b par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: longs spyod 'jigs par 'gyur ba thob @189b par 'gyur ro //
translated: He will obtain the fear of wealth.

original: bag med pa'i rgyus zhes bya ba de tsam gyis chog mod /
analyzed: bag med pa'i rgyus zhes bya ba de tsam gyis chog mod /
translated: Why is it sufficient to say that heedlessness is the cause of his great loss of wealth?

original: ci'i phyir gnas kyi sgra byas she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gnas kyi sgra byas she na /
translated: Why is the word “basis” used?

original: 'dir gnas kyi sgra smos pas rtag tu bag med pa la 'jug pa ston par byed de /
analyzed: 'dir gnas kyi sgra smos pas rtag tu bag med pa la 'jug pa ston par byed de /
translated: The word “basis” is used to show that he is constantly heedless.

original: rtag tu bag med pa la 'jug na ni longs spyod nyams pa 'grub par 'gyur la /
analyzed: rtag tu bag med pa la 'jug na ni longs spyod nyams pa 'grub par 'gyur la /
translated: If he is constantly heedless, he will certainly lose his wealth.

original: bar du bag med ba yongs su spangs na ni longs spyod nyams par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir thag nye ba'i rten bstan par bya ba'i phyir gnas smos pa yin no zhes ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: bar du bag med ba yongs su spangs na ni longs spyod nyams par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir thag nye ba'i rten bstan par bya ba'i phyir gnas smos pa yin no zhes ston par mdzad do //
translated: The word “basis” is used to show that he is constantly heedless, because if he were not constantly heedless, he would not lose his wealth.

original: 'khor zhes bya ba ni 'dir rigs gcig pa dang tshogs kyi sgo nas nye bar zhi ba yin no //
analyzed: 'khor zhes bya ba ni 'dir rigs gcig pa dang tshogs kyi sgo nas nye bar zhi ba yin no //
translated: The word “retinue” is used here in the sense of a group of people of the same class.

original: rgyal rigs dang bram ze ma gtogs pa 'gro ba gtso bo 'dus pa ni khyim bdag gi 'khor yin no //
analyzed: rgyal rigs dang bram ze ma gtogs pa 'gro ba gtso bo 'dus pa ni khyim bdag gi 'khor yin no //
translated: The assembly of householders is the assembly of the principal beings, except for the royal class and the priestly class.

original: dka' thub dang mkhas pa dag 'dus pa ni dge sbyong gi 'khor yin no //
analyzed: dka' thub dang mkhas pa dag 'dus pa ni dge sbyong gi 'khor yin no //
translated: The assembly of ascetics is the assembly of the principal ascetics and the principal scholars.

original: thur du lta ba ni 'khums pa'o //🔽mgo smod pa ni 'dir zhum pa yin te /
analyzed: thur du lta ba ni 'khums pa'o // mgo smod pa ni 'dir zhum pa yin te /
translated: The word bent means bent down. 🔽The word bowed means bent down. 🔽The word head is used here in the sense of best.

original: mchog gi sgras mgo bo brjod pa yin te /🔽yan lag gi gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽mchog tu 'phags par gyur pa gang la yod pa de ni ma zhum pa yin la /
analyzed: mchog gi sgras mgo bo brjod pa yin te / yan lag gi gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro // mchog tu 'phags par gyur pa gang la yod pa de ni ma zhum pa yin la /
translated: The head is the best of all the limbs.🔽 The word unbent means not bent down.

original: ma zhum pa med pa ni zhum pa yin no //🔽yang na zhum pa ni gzi med par gyur pa ste /🔽tshig gi 'jug pa la spobs pa med par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: ma zhum pa med pa ni zhum pa yin no // yang na zhum pa ni gzi med par gyur pa ste / tshig gi 'jug pa la spobs pa med par gyur pa'o //
translated: The word unbent means not bent down. 🔽The word unbent means not bent down. 🔽The word unbent means not bent down. 🔽The word unbent means not bent down. 🔽The word unbent means not bent down. 🔽The word unbent means not bent down. 🔽The word unbent means not bent down. 🔽The word unbent means not bent down. 🔽The word unbent means not bent down. 🔽The word unbent means not bent down. 🔽The word unbent means not bent down. 🔽The word unbent means not bent down. 🔽The word unbent means not bent down. 🔽The word unbent means not bent down. 🔽The word unbent means not bent down. 🔽The word unbent means not bent down. 🔽The word unbent means not bent down. 🔽The word unbent means not bent down. 🔽The word unbent means not bent down. 🔽The word unbent means not bent down. 🔽The word unbent means not bent down. 🔽The word unbent means not bent down. 🔽The word unbent means not bent down. 🔽The word unbent means not bent down.

original: phyogs dang phyogs mtshams zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gis bshad pa bram ze'i bu aam bsta'i mdo bshad pa dpyad pa yin no //
analyzed: phyogs dang phyogs mtshams zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gis bshad pa bram ze'i bu aam bsta'i mdo bshad pa dpyad pa yin no //
translated: The word unbent means not bent down. 🔽The word unbent means not bent down. 🔽The word unbent

original: nag po'i rnam grangs nyid yin pas na 'dir yon tan ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni khyad par yin no //
analyzed: nag po'i rnam grangs nyid yin pas na 'dir yon tan ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni khyad par yin no //
translated: Since it is a synonym for bad, it is a fault here.

original: dan pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / sdig pa'i skye bos bsten pa nyid khyi phyir sdig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dan pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / sdig pa'i skye bos bsten pa nyid khyi phyir sdig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called bad because it is the basis of the bad, and because it is the support of sinful beings.

original: 'gyod pa ni phyis gdung bar gyur pa yin la /
analyzed: 'gyod pa ni phyis gdung bar gyur pa yin la /
translated: Regret is remorse.

original: 'gyod pa gang la yod pa de ni 'gyod par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: 'gyod pa gang la yod pa de ni 'gyod par gyur pa ste /
translated: That which has regret is one who has regret.

original: kho bos gang bag med pa'i dbang gis dge ba ma spyad pa de bzang po ma byas so zhes bya ba la sogs pas phyis gdung ba dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kho bos gang bag med pa'i dbang gis dge ba ma spyad pa de bzang po ma byas so zhes bya ba la sogs pas phyis gdung ba dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: One who has regret thinks, “I did not do what is good because I was heedless,” and so on.

original: nyes dmigs bzhi po de dag ni mthong ba'i chos yin la /
analyzed: nyes dmigs bzhi po de dag ni mthong ba'i chos yin la /
translated: These four disadvantages are in this life.

original: sems can dmyal bar skye bar 'gyur ba ni tshe phyi ma yin no //
analyzed: sems can dmyal bar skye bar 'gyur ba ni tshe phyi ma yin no //
translated: Being born in hell is in the next life.

original: nag po'i rnam grangs las bzlog pa ni dkar po'i rnam grangs yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nag po'i rnam grangs las bzlog pa ni dkar po'i rnam grangs yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The synonyms for good should be understood as the opposite of the synonyms for bad.

original: gnas ni gnas kyi bye brag yin no //
analyzed: gnas ni gnas kyi bye brag yin no //
translated: A basis is a particular basis.

original: blon po chen po zhes bya ba ni bdag po'i sgo nas chen po'i tshad tsam gang la yod pa de ni blon po chen po yin te /
analyzed: blon po chen po zhes bya ba ni bdag po'i sgo nas chen po'i tshad tsam gang la yod pa de ni blon po chen po yin te /
translated: The great minister is the one who has the measure of greatness by way of his master.

original: yul ma ga dh'a'i blon po chen po ni yul ma ga dh'a'i blon po chen po'o //
analyzed: yul ma ga dh'a'i blon po chen po ni yul ma ga dh'a'i blon po chen po'o //
translated: The great minister of Magadha is the great minister of the country of Magadha.

original: @190a * // gnod pa bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bzlog par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @190a * // gnod pa bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bzlog par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to harm means in order to turn him away.

original: gzhan par 'dod pa ni bsgrub par 'dod cing byed 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan par 'dod pa ni bsgrub par 'dod cing byed 'dod pa'o //
translated: One who desires otherwise is one who desires to accomplish and do something different.

original: bsod nams bya ba ni bsod nams dang / bdag po'i sgo nas de che bar brjod la /
analyzed: bsod nams bya ba ni bsod nams dang / bdag po'i sgo nas de che bar brjod la /
translated: Meritorious action is meritorious by way of its master.

original: mthu che ba gzhan dag las shin tu mthu che ba de ni mthu che zhing bsod nams che ba yin no //
analyzed: mthu che ba gzhan dag las shin tu mthu che ba de ni mthu che zhing bsod nams che ba yin no //
translated: The one who is very powerful among those who are powerful is the one who is very powerful and has great merit.

original: gnas kyi dngos po 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni rten 'dzin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gnas kyi dngos po 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni rten 'dzin par byed pa'o //
translated: The one who holds the position is the one who holds the support.

original: sum cu rtsa gsum ris kyi lha dag kyang der 'khor gzhag par bya ba'i phyir gnas kyi dngos po 'dzin par byed pa de'i phyir sum cu rtsa gsum gyi lha dang lhan cig tu 'gro ba bzhin no snyam du de dag dang lhan cig brda byas pa yin
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum ris kyi lha dag kyang der 'khor gzhag par bya ba'i phyir gnas kyi dngos po 'dzin par byed pa de'i phyir sum cu rtsa gsum gyi lha dang lhan cig tu 'gro ba bzhin no snyam du de dag dang lhan cig brda byas pa yin
translated: The gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-three also take on the form of that place in order to assemble their retinue there. Therefore, they are like those who go together with the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-three.

original: no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is what is taught.

original: gzhan du na ji ltar de dag 'dir gnas kyi dngos po 'di na par 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan du na ji ltar de dag 'dir gnas kyi dngos po 'di na par 'gyur /
translated: Otherwise, how could they take on the form of that place here?

original: mi'i 'khor bsrung bar bya ba'i don du lha rnams kyi dngos po 'dzin pa yin no zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mi'i 'khor bsrung bar bya ba'i don du lha rnams kyi dngos po 'dzin pa yin no zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the gods take on the form of humans in order to protect the retinue of humans.

original: ji srid kun dga' bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ji srid 'dzam bu'i gling ma lus pa 'phags pa'i tha snyad dang / 'phags pa'i tshong gi lam yod pa de dag ni 'phags pa'i gnas la sogs pa de dag thams cad kyi yul pa ta li phu tra mchog tu 'gyur ro zhes bya ba don 'dir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji srid kun dga' bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ji srid 'dzam bu'i gling ma lus pa 'phags pa'i tha snyad dang / 'phags pa'i tshong gi lam yod pa de dag ni 'phags pa'i gnas la sogs pa de dag thams cad kyi yul pa ta li phu tra mchog tu 'gyur ro zhes bya ba don 'dir 'gyur ro //
translated: As long as there is the expression “Ānanda” and so on, as long as there is the expression “Āryan” and the path of the Āryan merchants in all Jambudvīpa, then that country, Tālīśa, will be the best of all the Āryan countries and so on. This is the meaning.

original: 'gro ba 'phag sa'i spyod pas gnas pa'i phyir 'phags pa'i gnas yin la /
analyzed: 'gro ba 'phag sa'i spyod pas gnas pa'i phyir 'phags pa'i gnas yin la /
translated: It is an Āryan country because it is the abode of Āryans.

original: tshul ma yin pa dang bral ba nyid kyi chos dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir 'phags pa'i tha snyad yin no //
analyzed: tshul ma yin pa dang bral ba nyid kyi chos dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir 'phags pa'i tha snyad yin no //
translated: It is the expression “Āryan” because it is endowed with the Dharma free from what is improper.

original: tshong ba'i lam ni tshong ba'i lam ste /
analyzed: tshong ba'i lam ni tshong ba'i lam ste /
translated: The path of merchants is the path of merchants.

original: tshong ba rab tu rgyu ba'i lam yin la /
analyzed: tshong ba rab tu rgyu ba'i lam yin la /
translated: It is the path of the movement of merchants.

original: chos dang ldan pa'i sho gam dang / gru btsas len pa'i phyir dang / dor thabs kyi mdzad pa med pa'i phyir 'phags pa'i tshong ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: chos dang ldan pa'i sho gam dang / gru btsas len pa'i phyir dang / dor thabs kyi mdzad pa med pa'i phyir 'phags pa'i tshong ba'i lam mo //
translated: It is the Āryan path of merchants because it takes the Dharma toll and ferry fare and because it is free from the activity of robbery.

original: thabs gang yin pa des khur bur bcings pa ni thum por brjod de /
analyzed: thabs gang yin pa des khur bur bcings pa ni thum por brjod de /
translated: The “bundle” is the binding together of the means and the object of the means.

original: gang du thum por 'byed cing bshig par byed pa de ni thum por byed pa ste /
analyzed: gang du thum por 'byed cing bshig par byed pa de ni thum por byed pa ste /
translated: The “unbinding” is the unbinding of the bundle.

original: thum po 'byed pa la rnam par 'tshe ba med pa de nyid kyi phyir yul pa ta li pu tra la mchog nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: thum po 'byed pa la rnam par 'tshe ba med pa de nyid kyi phyir yul pa ta li pu tra la mchog nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: The “unbinding of the bundle” is the supreme object of the path of cultivation.

original: 'dir bar chad gsum yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /🔽'jigs rten pa'i rkyen par chad yin pa'am /🔽'jig pa kho na bar chad yin no //
analyzed: 'dir bar chad gsum yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / 'jigs rten pa'i rkyen par chad yin pa'am / 'jig pa kho na bar chad yin no //
translated: The “three obstacles” are the obstacles of the world, the obstacles of the passions, and the obstacles of the knowable.

original: me zhes bya ba ni me'i thad las @190b so ;🔽/ chu zhes bya ba ni chu las kyang ngo //
analyzed: me zhes bya ba ni me'i thad las @190b so ; / chu zhes bya ba ni chu las kyang ngo //
translated: The “obstacle of the world” is the obstacle of the world, such as the obstacle of the fire at the end of the eon.🔽The “obstacle of the passions” is the obstacle of the passions, such as the five passions.🔽The “obstacle of the knowable” is the obstacle to the knowable, such as the obstacle to the knowledge of all modes.🔽The “obstacle of the world” is the obstacle of the world, such as the obstacle of the fire at the end of the eon.🔽The “obstacle of the passions” is the obstacle of the passions, such as the five passions.

original: gcig la gcig 'byed pa ni nang phan tshun 'byed pa las kyang ngo //
analyzed: gcig la gcig 'byed pa ni nang phan tshun 'byed pa las kyang ngo //
translated: The “obstacle of the knowable” is the obstacle to the knowable, such as the obstacle to the knowledge of all modes.

original: ci'i phyir yang bcom ldan 'das 'jig pa'i rkyen gcig kho na ston par mi mdzad de /
analyzed: ci'i phyir yang bcom ldan 'das 'jig pa'i rkyen gcig kho na ston par mi mdzad de /
translated: Why does the Lord not teach only one obstacle?

original: bcom ldan 'das ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because the Lord is omniscient.

original: 'dir bla ma dag 'jig pa'i rgyu gzhan yongs su srung ba la phyogs pa dag gi gzhan gyi 'jig pa dag bcom ldan 'das kyis mkhyen pa de'i phyir gsum po de dag la dag yod par gyur pa de dag 'jig par yang mi nus so snyam pa'i nges
analyzed: 'dir bla ma dag 'jig pa'i rgyu gzhan yongs su srung ba la phyogs pa dag gi gzhan gyi 'jig pa dag bcom ldan 'das kyis mkhyen pa de'i phyir gsum po de dag la dag yod par gyur pa de dag 'jig par yang mi nus so snyam pa'i nges
translated: Here, some gurus explain that the Bhagavān knows the destruction of others by those who are intent on protecting others from the causes of destruction. Therefore, he teaches with the certainty that those three things that exist for them cannot be destroyed.

original: pa des ston par mdzad kyi mi mkhyen pa'i phyir ni ma yin no zhes ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: pa des ston par mdzad kyi mi mkhyen pa'i phyir ni ma yin no zhes ston par mdzad do //
translated: He teaches this, not because he does not know.

original: bsnyen bkur zhes bya ba ni gus pa'i tshul gyis lus dang ngag gi 'jug pas nye bar spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: bsnyen bkur zhes bya ba ni gus pa'i tshul gyis lus dang ngag gi 'jug pas nye bar spyod pa yin no //
translated: “Worship” is the enjoyment of the body and speech through the method of respect.

original: gser las bsgyur pa ni gser las byas pa'o //
analyzed: gser las bsgyur pa ni gser las byas pa'o //
translated: “Made of gold” means made of gold.

original: bya ni snod kyi bye brag yin no //
analyzed: bya ni snod kyi bye brag yin no //
translated: “Bird” is a particular type of vessel.

original: gsol ba 'debs par gyur pa ni don du gnyer bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gsol ba 'debs par gyur pa ni don du gnyer bar gyur pa'o //
translated: “Begging” means being in need.

original: bsod nams kyi rgyun zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: bsod nams kyi rgyun zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: “Stream of merit” and so on.

original: rgyun ni rab tu 'bab pa la bya'o //
analyzed: rgyun ni rab tu 'bab pa la bya'o //
translated: “Stream” means flowing.

original: bsod nams ni spyin pa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: bsod nams ni spyin pa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: “Merit” is the nature of generosity.

original: sems gang gi spyon pa dang / dngos po gang yang rung ba sbyin pa dang / de dang 'brel ba'i lus dang ngag gi bya ba de dag thams cad spyin pa'i nang du 'dus pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: sems gang gi spyon pa dang / dngos po gang yang rung ba sbyin pa dang / de dang 'brel ba'i lus dang ngag gi bya ba de dag thams cad spyin pa'i nang du 'dus pa kho na yin no //
translated: All of these are included in the perfection of giving.

original: dge ba smos pas /
analyzed: dge ba smos pas /
translated: By mentioning virtue,

original: sbyin pa ma gtogs pa nus pa sngon du ldang ba la sogs pa dang / ngag gi las snyan pa'i tshig la sogs pa dang / dad pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i yid kyi las gang yin pa de dag thams cad bzung ngo //
analyzed: sbyin pa ma gtogs pa nus pa sngon du ldang ba la sogs pa dang / ngag gi las snyan pa'i tshig la sogs pa dang / dad pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i yid kyi las gang yin pa de dag thams cad bzung ngo //
translated: all of the other perfections are included, except for giving, such as the perfection of morality, etc.

original: bsod nams de nyid ma 'ongs pa'i bde ba skyed par byed pa'i rten nyid yin pa'i phyir bde ba'i gzhi zhes bstan to //
analyzed: bsod nams de nyid ma 'ongs pa'i bde ba skyed par byed pa'i rten nyid yin pa'i phyir bde ba'i gzhi zhes bstan to //
translated: The perfection of giving is called the basis of happiness because it is the support for the production of future happiness.

original: don dang zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'dod pa thob par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dang zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'dod pa thob par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The word for benefit is abhiprāya, which means to obtain what is desired.

original: phan pa dang zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'dod pa'i sems kyi bde ba gnas pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: phan pa dang zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'dod pa'i sems kyi bde ba gnas pa'i phyir ram /
translated: The word for help is upakāra, which means to abide in the happiness of mind that is desired.

original: rab tu brtsams pa'i las yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab tu brtsams pa'i las yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: in order to complete the work that has been begun.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i chos kyi bde ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i chos kyi bde ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “Therefore” means “for the sake of the happiness of this life.”

original: yon shod cig ces bya ba ni spyin pa'i 'bras bu yongs su bdo ba'o //
analyzed: yon shod cig ces bya ba ni spyin pa'i 'bras bu yongs su bdo ba'o //
translated: “Give me a gift” means “give me the fruit of giving.”

original: dad pa can zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: dad pa can zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: “The faithful” and so on.

original: srog gcod pa ma gtogs pa 'ga' zhig lha la mchod pa byed pa de ni dad pa can yin par rig par bya'o //🔽skyes bu gang zag ces bya ba @191a * //
analyzed: srog gcod pa ma gtogs pa 'ga' zhig lha la mchod pa byed pa de ni dad pa can yin par rig par bya'o // skyes bu gang zag ces bya ba @191a * //
translated: One who is faithful should be known as someone who makes offerings to the gods, except for the sacrifice of killing.

original: ni khyim pa yin gyi rab tu byung ba'i skyes bu ma yin no //🔽ston pa'i bka' bzhin byed par 'gyur //
analyzed: ni khyim pa yin gyi rab tu byung ba'i skyes bu ma yin no // ston pa'i bka' bzhin byed par 'gyur //
translated: “A person” means a layperson, not a renunciant.

original: zhes bya ba ni bka' ltar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bka' ltar byed pa yin te /
translated: “He will act in accordance with the Teacher’s word” means he will act in accordance with the Buddha’s word.

original: gang gi phyir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis lha rnams la mchod pa byed pa'i khyim pa la bsngags shing bstod pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis lha rnams la mchod pa byed pa'i khyim pa la bsngags shing bstod pa yin no //
translated: Because the Blessed Buddha praised and extolled the layperson who makes offerings to the gods.

original: bstan bcos yongs su shes pa la mkhas pa ni yid gzhungs pa yin la /
analyzed: bstan bcos yongs su shes pa la mkhas pa ni yid gzhungs pa yin la /
translated: “Skill in understanding the treatises” means having a sharp mind.

original: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad la mkhas pa ni mkhas pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad la mkhas pa ni mkhas pa yin no //
translated: One who is skilled in worldly conventions is skilled.

original: rtog ces bya ba ni byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rtog ces bya ba ni byed pa yin no //
translated: The term to conceive means to create.

original: tshul khrims gang la yod pa de dag ni tshul khrims dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims gang la yod pa de dag ni tshul khrims dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Those who have morality are the ones who possess morality.

original: yon gyi bshad pa zhes bya ba ni zas las byung ba'i bsod nams kyi 'bras bu lha rnams la yongs su bsngo bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: yon gyi bshad pa zhes bya ba ni zas las byung ba'i bsod nams kyi 'bras bu lha rnams la yongs su bsngo bar bya ba yin no //
translated: The term to explain the gift means to dedicate the fruit of the merit that arises from the gift to the gods.

original: ri mor byas dang zhes bya ba ni gnas mthon po thob par 'gyur ba'i bsnyen bkur gyis de'i tshe yang sbyin pa po'i phyir ri mor byed pa dang / mchod par gyur pas kyang mchod par byed do //
analyzed: ri mor byas dang zhes bya ba ni gnas mthon po thob par 'gyur ba'i bsnyen bkur gyis de'i tshe yang sbyin pa po'i phyir ri mor byed pa dang / mchod par gyur pas kyang mchod par byed do //
translated: The term to honor means that when one attains a high status, one honors the donor by means of the service that is the cause of attaining that high status, and one worships the donor by means of worship.

original: de ltar sbyin pa po la sdug bsngal las yongs su bskyab par mdzad pa'i sgo nas thugs brtse bar mdzad do //
analyzed: de ltar sbyin pa po la sdug bsngal las yongs su bskyab par mdzad pa'i sgo nas thugs brtse bar mdzad do //
translated: Thus, the Blessed One is compassionate toward the donor by means of protecting him from suffering.

original: rtag tu grod par nyal ba'i phyir mi las skyes te /
analyzed: rtag tu grod par nyal ba'i phyir mi las skyes te /
translated: The term born from man means born from a human.

original: bu'i sdug yin te /
analyzed: bu'i sdug yin te /
translated: The term beloved son means a son who is loved.

original: dper na ma de la rjes su brtse bar byed pa de bzhin du brtse bar mdzad do //
analyzed: dper na ma de la rjes su brtse bar byed pa de bzhin du brtse bar mdzad do //
translated: Just as a mother is affectionate toward her child, so he is affectionate toward them.

original: bzang po mthong bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni thams cad du shis pa myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bzang po mthong bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni thams cad du shis pa myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “They will see what is good” means they will experience what is auspicious in every way.

original: dor ba'i chos can zhes bya ba ni zas la sogs pa dor ba'i rang bzhin du 'o //
analyzed: dor ba'i chos can zhes bya ba ni zas la sogs pa dor ba'i rang bzhin du 'o //
translated: “They have the quality of giving up” means they have the nature of giving up food, etc.

original: btang ba'i chos can zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: btang ba'i chos can zhes bya ba la /
translated: “They have the quality of relinquishing” means

original: sbyin pas yongs su dor ba'i chos can du'o //
analyzed: sbyin pas yongs su dor ba'i chos can du'o //
translated: they have the quality of relinquishing through generosity.

original: phyi bzhin du zhes bya ba ni rgyab kyi phyogs su phyi bzhin du'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: phyi bzhin du zhes bya ba ni rgyab kyi phyogs su phyi bzhin du'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “They follow” means they follow behind, i.e., they go behind.

original: bcom ldan 'das sngon du gshegs shing de nas dge slong dag phyis char gyi rnam pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sngon du gshegs shing de nas dge slong dag phyis char gyi rnam pa lta bu'o //
translated: The Blessed One goes first, and then the monks follow like a cloud.

original: brtsig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'du shes pa rnam par gzhag pa'i sgo nas bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: brtsig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'du shes pa rnam par gzhag pa'i sgo nas bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: “They should be built” means they should be accomplished by means of the establishment of perception.

original: chu bo chen por 'jug pa'i gnas ni chu dogs yin no //
analyzed: chu bo chen por 'jug pa'i gnas ni chu dogs yin no //
translated: A ford is a place for entering a great river.

original: so phag la sogs pa'i 'jug pa'i thabs su gyur pa'i them pa byed ba ni them pa sbyar ba yin no //
analyzed: so phag la sogs pa'i 'jug pa'i thabs su gyur pa'i them pa byed ba ni them pa sbyar ba yin no //
translated: The steps which are the means of entering into the water, such as bricks, etc., are the bridges.

original: dbus kyi thog nas zhes bya ba ni shin tu dbus kyi cha nas so //
analyzed: dbus kyi thog nas zhes bya ba ni shin tu dbus kyi cha nas so //
translated: From the middle of the bridge means from the very middle part.

original: shing shal ma li bzhogs pa ni shing shal ma li'i spang leb yin te /
analyzed: shing shal ma li bzhogs pa ni shing shal ma li'i spang leb yin te /
translated: The raft of silk-cotton trees is the raft of silk-cotton trees.

original: de shin tu yang ba nyid kyis chu rgal ba'i thabs nyid yin pa de'i nye bar sbyor bar byed do //🔽gu ba'i tshogs phan tshun sbrel ba ni ku ba'i gzings @191b so ;
analyzed: de shin tu yang ba nyid kyis chu rgal ba'i thabs nyid yin pa de'i nye bar sbyor bar byed do // gu ba'i tshogs phan tshun sbrel ba ni ku ba'i gzings @191b so ;
translated: Because it is very light, it is the means of crossing the water.🔽The raft of gourds is the raft of a collection of gourds bound together.

original: / shing bal gyis bkang ba'i nang tshangs can ni shing bal gyi khres po yin no //
analyzed: / shing bal gyis bkang ba'i nang tshangs can ni shing bal gyi khres po yin no //
translated: The raft of cotton wool is the raft of a bag filled with cotton wool.

original: rkyal pa ni pags pa las byas pa'i rgal ba'i thabs su gyur pa'o //🔽pha rol du 'gro bar byed pa ni phar rgal ba yin no //
analyzed: rkyal pa ni pags pa las byas pa'i rgal ba'i thabs su gyur pa'o // pha rol du 'gro bar byed pa ni phar rgal ba yin no //
translated: The raft of skin is the means of crossing the water made of skin.🔽Going to the other side is crossing over.

original: tshu rol du rgal bar byed pa ni tshur rgal ba yin no /
analyzed: tshu rol du rgal bar byed pa ni tshur rgal ba yin no /
translated: Going to this side is crossing back.

original: sha chu zab mo'i nang du 'gro ba bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir chu'i rgyun nyid las sa dang 'dra bar mi 'bying ba yin no //
analyzed: sha chu zab mo'i nang du 'gro ba bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir chu'i rgyun nyid las sa dang 'dra bar mi 'bying ba yin no //
translated: In order to establish beings in the profound Dharma of the Buddha, the water does not drown them, but is like earth.

original: dge slong gi dge 'dun dang thabs cig tu zhes bya ba ni dge slong gi dge 'dun gyis kyang bcom ldan 'das kyi rdzu 'phrul gyi mthus pha rol gyi 'gram du phyin par gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: dge slong gi dge 'dun dang thabs cig tu zhes bya ba ni dge slong gi dge 'dun gyis kyang bcom ldan 'das kyi rdzu 'phrul gyi mthus pha rol gyi 'gram du phyin par gyur pa yin no //
translated: Together with the community of monks means that the community of monks also reached the other shore by the power of the Buddha's supernormal powers.

original: gang dag ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gang dag ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: As for those who have crossed over, etc.,

original: gang dag rgal ba ni gang zhig da ltar rgal ba'i phyir spobs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang dag rgal ba ni gang zhig da ltar rgal ba'i phyir spobs pa yin no //
translated: those who have crossed over are those who have crossed over now, and are therefore confident.

original: rgya mtsho ni chu 'dzin yin la /
analyzed: rgya mtsho ni chu 'dzin yin la /
translated: The ocean is the holder of water.

original: mtsho 'am rgya mtshor 'jug pa'i chu bo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mtsho 'am rgya mtshor 'jug pa'i chu bo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is a lake or ocean, meaning a river that enters it.

original: zam pa dang bcas pa ni chu lon brtsigs pa la sogs pa'i tshul du zam pa btags nas 'dam rdzab spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: zam pa dang bcas pa ni chu lon brtsigs pa la sogs pa'i tshul du zam pa btags nas 'dam rdzab spangs pa yin no //
translated: With bridges means that bridges have been built in the manner of dikes, etc., and the swamp has been removed.

original: rgal ba ni lteng ka la sogs pa chus khyab pa'i phyogs las so //
analyzed: rgal ba ni lteng ka la sogs pa chus khyab pa'i phyogs las so //
translated: Crossing over is from a place flooded by a pond, etc.

original: de'i 'og tu ci zhig byed ce na /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu ci zhig byed ce na /
translated: What does he do after that?

original: smras pa gzings bcas pa ni rtsa ba dang yal ga dang lo ma la sogs pa btsags nas sngon du chu la 'jal bar byed pa'am /
analyzed: smras pa gzings bcas pa ni rtsa ba dang yal ga dang lo ma la sogs pa btsags nas sngon du chu la 'jal bar byed pa'am /
translated: He says: Having built a boat, he crosses the river,

original: gru la sogs pa la skye bo de dag yang dag par brten nas so //
analyzed: gru la sogs pa la skye bo de dag yang dag par brten nas so //
translated: having boarded it, together with other people,🔽having taken hold of it, or having reached the other shore.

original: kha cig ni chu bo gang gra rgal bar 'dod pa de'i phyir gru la sogs pa yongs su len pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: kha cig ni chu bo gang gra rgal bar 'dod pa de'i phyir gru la sogs pa yongs su len pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: Some people, desiring to cross the river, take hold of a boat, etc.

original: rgal ba ni pha rol gyi 'gram du phyin pa'o //
analyzed: rgal ba ni pha rol gyi 'gram du phyin pa'o //
translated: Having crossed, they reach the other shore.

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: skye bo yid gzhungs pa ste /
analyzed: skye bo yid gzhungs pa ste /
translated: The wise people.

original: gang dag mkhas pa dang gsal ba de dag mi 'gro bar byed pa nyid kyi phyir dang por rgal ba yin no //
analyzed: gang dag mkhas pa dang gsal ba de dag mi 'gro bar byed pa nyid kyi phyir dang por rgal ba yin no //
translated: Those who are wise and clear do not make it so that they do not cross, and so they are the first to cross.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni skye bo yid gzhungs pa thams cad kyis gces pa 'dzin pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni skye bo yid gzhungs pa thams cad kyis gces pa 'dzin pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The Bhagavat is the most cherished of all wise people,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni rgal nas su zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni rgal nas su zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: and so he says, “The Bhagavat, the Buddha, having crossed, etc.”

original: nyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas pa spangs pa'i phyir dang / chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du thugs su chud pa'i phyir go rims bzhin du spangs pa dang ye shes phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas pa spangs pa'i phyir dang / chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du thugs su chud pa'i phyir go rims bzhin du spangs pa dang ye shes phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: Because of the abandonment of the afflictions together with their traces, and because of the complete understanding of all things in all aspects, the perfection of abandonment and the perfection of knowledge are taught, respectively.

original: thams cad kyi dang por rgal ba de yang tshangs pa yin la /🔽rgyun mi 'chad par tshig gi don la gzhol bar byed pa'i sgo nas phyi rol du yid phyogs pa nyid kyi phyir thugs @192a * //
analyzed: thams cad kyi dang por rgal ba de yang tshangs pa yin la / rgyun mi 'chad par tshig gi don la gzhol bar byed pa'i sgo nas phyi rol du yid phyogs pa nyid kyi phyir thugs @192a * //
translated: Brahma is the first to cross over,

original: mchog ces bya'o //
analyzed: mchog ces bya'o //
translated: and because he is the one who turns the mind outward by means of uninterrupted engagement with the meaning of the words, he is called the Supreme Mind.

original: skam la bzhugs pa ni chu bo gang g-ya'i ngogs na bzhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: skam la bzhugs pa ni chu bo gang g-ya'i ngogs na bzhugs pa yin no //
translated: Standing on dry land means standing on the bank of the river Ganges.

original: dge slong dag 'dir khrus byed ces bya ba ni dge slong dag pha rol gyi 'gram du rgal nas chus lus yongs su rlan par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag 'dir khrus byed ces bya ba ni dge slong dag pha rol gyi 'gram du rgal nas chus lus yongs su rlan par byed pa'o //
translated: The monks bathe here means that after crossing to the other shore, the monks moisten their bodies with water.

original: gzings 'cha' ba ni nyan thos gang dag da ltar yang ma rgal ba phyis 'ongs pa'i dge slong de dag gzings lon par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gzings 'cha' ba ni nyan thos gang dag da ltar yang ma rgal ba phyis 'ongs pa'i dge slong de dag gzings lon par byed pa yin no //
translated: The raft is for the monks who have not yet crossed over, who will come later.

original: 'di ltar de la 'di skad du brjod pa'i tshigs su bcad pa'i don de ltar 'dir yang don mtshon par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de la 'di skad du brjod pa'i tshigs su bcad pa'i don de ltar 'dir yang don mtshon par bya ba yin te /
translated: The meaning of the verse is to be understood in this way.

original: gang dag rgal bar byed pa ni rgal bar 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: gang dag rgal bar byed pa ni rgal bar 'dod pa'o //
translated: Those who are crossing over are those who desire to cross over.

original: rgya mtsho ni 'khor skyed par byed pa'i mtsho'i dba' glong yin no //
analyzed: rgya mtsho ni 'khor skyed par byed pa'i mtsho'i dba' glong yin no //
translated: The ocean is the ocean of cyclic existence, with its waves of rebirth.

original: zam pa dang bcas pa ni mthong ba'i lam mngon du byas pa yin no //
analyzed: zam pa dang bcas pa ni mthong ba'i lam mngon du byas pa yin no //
translated: The bridge is the path of seeing.

original: 'dam rdzab spangs pa ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dam rdzab spangs pa ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa yin no //
translated: The swamp is the afflictions that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: skye bo gzings 'cha' ba ni de'i bag la nyal spang bar bya ba'i phyir bsgom pa'i lam sgom par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: skye bo gzings 'cha' ba ni de'i bag la nyal spang bar bya ba'i phyir bsgom pa'i lam sgom par byed pa yin no //
translated: The raft is the path of meditation, which is cultivated in order to abandon the latent afflictions.

original: lam gnyis kyis kun nas 'ching ba'i tshogs spangs pa'i phyir rgal ba yin no //
analyzed: lam gnyis kyis kun nas 'ching ba'i tshogs spangs pa'i phyir rgal ba yin no //
translated: One has crossed over by abandoning the mass of bondage through the two paths.

original: yid gzhungs pa ni /
analyzed: yid gzhungs pa ni /
translated: The wise ones are

original: 'phags pa'i gang zag dag yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i gang zag dag yin no //
translated: the noble persons.

original: rgal ba'i gtso bo gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: rgal ba'i gtso bo gang yin zhe na /
translated: Who is the chief of those who have crossed over?

original: smras pa / sangs rgyas zhes bya ba la sogs pas rang byung nyid bstan to //
analyzed: smras pa / sangs rgyas zhes bya ba la sogs pas rang byung nyid bstan to //
translated: It is said that the one called the Buddha, etc. teaches self-arising.

original: skam sar bzhugs pa zhes bya ba ni phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa yin te /
analyzed: skam sar bzhugs pa zhes bya ba ni phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa yin te /
translated: The one who dwells on dry land is the nirvana with remainder,

original: mdo sde las pha rol gyi dogs ni phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings de'i tshig bla dag yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: mdo sde las pha rol gyi dogs ni phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings de'i tshig bla dag yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: for the sutra teaches that the word “dry land” is a synonym for the realm of nirvana with remainder.

original: bzhugs pa zhes bya ba ni snying rje chen po ston par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: bzhugs pa zhes bya ba ni snying rje chen po ston par byed pa yin te /
translated: The one who dwells is the one who teaches great compassion,

original: de med par bcom ldan 'das srid par skad cig kyang bzhugs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de med par bcom ldan 'das srid par skad cig kyang bzhugs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: for without that the Lord would not remain in existence even for a moment.

original: dge slong dag 'dir zhes bya ba la sogs pas mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa bstan to //
analyzed: dge slong dag 'dir zhes bya ba la sogs pas mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa bstan to //
translated: The one who is called a monk, etc. teaches the happiness of dwelling in the present life.

original: gzings 'cha' zhes bya bas ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa las gnas nas mthong ba'i lam la sogs pa mngon sum du byed pa yin pa de bas na 'dis ni zhugs pa ston pa yin no //
analyzed: gzings 'cha' zhes bya bas ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa las gnas nas mthong ba'i lam la sogs pa mngon sum du byed pa yin pa de bas na 'dis ni zhugs pa ston pa yin no //
translated: The term who have boarded the ship indicates that they have gone beyond the stage of the aids to penetration and have realized the path of vision, etc. Hence, this refers to those who have entered the stages.

original: de'i phyir zhugs pa bzhi dang 'bras bu bzhi la gnas pa'i dge slong de dag ni yon gnas rig pa dang rkang pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhugs pa bzhi dang 'bras bu bzhi la gnas pa'i dge slong de dag ni yon gnas rig pa dang rkang pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, those monks who have entered the four stages and who abide in the four fruits are worthy of offerings, for they possess the knowledge of the stages, the feet, and samadhi.

original: char gyi 'byung gnas ni zhing khyad par can sgrub par byed pa'i phyir dga' ba skyed par byed do //
analyzed: char gyi 'byung gnas ni zhing khyad par can sgrub par byed pa'i phyir dga' ba skyed par byed do //
translated: The rain-cloud produces joy because it causes the special field to be cultivated.

original: tshul khrims 'di zhes @192b bya ba ni mngon sum du gnas pa dag yin te /
analyzed: tshul khrims 'di zhes @192b bya ba ni mngon sum du gnas pa dag yin te /
translated: The term this morality indicates that they abide in the direct realization of the Dharma,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos thams cad mngon sum du gzigs pa de nyid kyi phyir de skad ces bstan to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos thams cad mngon sum du gzigs pa de nyid kyi phyir de skad ces bstan to //
translated: because the Lord has directly perceived all dharmas.

original: so sor thar pa dang / bsam gtan dang / zag pa med pa'i sdom ba'i rang bzhin dag yin no //
analyzed: so sor thar pa dang / bsam gtan dang / zag pa med pa'i sdom ba'i rang bzhin dag yin no //
translated: They are of the nature of the prātimokṣa, dhyāna, and untainted vows.

original: ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba la /
translated: What is called “samādhi” is as follows.🔽

original: ting nge 'dzin gsum ste ;🔽rtog pa dang bcas pa dang dpyod pa dang bcas pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gsum ste ; rtog pa dang bcas pa dang dpyod pa dang bcas pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The expression concentration refers to the three concentrations.🔽They are the concentration that is accompanied by conceptualization and accompanied by delight, the concentration that is devoid of conceptualization but accompanied by delight, and the concentration that is devoid of both conceptualization and delight.

original: shes rab 'di zhes bya ba ni thos pa las byung ba dang / bsams pa las byung ba dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba dang / zag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab 'di zhes bya ba ni thos pa las byung ba dang / bsams pa las byung ba dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba dang / zag pa med pa'o //
translated: The expression wisdom refers to the wisdom that is derived from hearing, reflection, and meditation, as well as the uncontaminated wisdom.

original: tshul khrims yongs su bsgoms pas zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims shin tu rnam par dag pa bsgoms pa ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims yongs su bsgoms pas zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims shin tu rnam par dag pa bsgoms pa ste /
translated: The phrase having cultivated morality means that one has cultivated morality in a pure manner.

original: rgyud la tshul khrims rnam par dag pa skye bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyud la tshul khrims rnam par dag pa skye bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the arising of pure morality in one's mind-stream is the result of having cultivated morality in a pure manner.

original: ring du gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni yongs su gzhom pa'i phyir rung bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: ring du gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni yongs su gzhom pa'i phyir rung bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: The phrase it will last a long time means that it will be suitable to be destroyed.

original: shes rab bsgoms pa ni bstan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab bsgoms pa ni bstan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The expression having cultivated wisdom means that one has cultivated the wisdom that is derived from hearing, reflection, and meditation.

original: yang dag rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: yang dag rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ba nyid yin te /
translated: The phrase he will attain complete liberation means that he will not retrogress.

original: de ltar dge slong dag gang spangs pa de ni 'phags pa'i shes rab kyis spangs pa yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar dge slong dag gang spangs pa de ni 'phags pa'i shes rab kyis spangs pa yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, monks, that which is abandoned is abandoned by the noble wisdom.

original: kunydzi ka'i gnas zhes bya ba ni drang srong kunydzi kas byas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽'og ma'i cha dang mthun pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: kunydzi ka'i gnas zhes bya ba ni drang srong kunydzi kas byas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro // 'og ma'i cha dang mthun pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The place of Kunjika is so called because it was created by the sage Kunjika.

original: 'og ma'i cha dang mthun pa ni mi dge ba'i chos thams cad dang ldan pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i khams yin la /
analyzed: 'og ma'i cha dang mthun pa ni mi dge ba'i chos thams cad dang ldan pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i khams yin la /
translated: The factors associated with the lower realm are so called because the desire realm is associated with all unwholesome factors.

original: de dag kyang de dang rjes su mthun pa yin pa de bas na 'og ma'i cha dang mthun pa yin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang de dang rjes su mthun pa yin pa de bas na 'og ma'i cha dang mthun pa yin zhes bya'o //
translated: And since they are in accordance with that, they are called factors associated with the lower realm.

original: de dag kyang 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems dang / 'jig tshogs su lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom dag yin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems dang / 'jig tshogs su lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom dag yin no //
translated: They are desire for sense objects, malice, the view of the transitory collection, holding a discipline and ritual to be paramount, and doubt.

original: rdzus te skye ba zhes bya ba ni de na skye gnas gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzus te skye ba zhes bya ba ni de na skye gnas gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is said to be born supernaturally because there are no other modes of birth there.

original: de nyid la rtsol lo zhes bya ba dang brtson 'grus rtsom mo //
analyzed: de nyid la rtsol lo zhes bya ba dang brtson 'grus rtsom mo //
translated: He exerts himself in that, he makes an effort in that.🔽He holds his mind,

original: sems 'dzin te //🔽rab tu 'dzin to zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sems 'dzin te // rab tu 'dzin to zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he holds it fast.

original: brtson 'grus brtsams pa ni mi dge ba'i chos rnams spang bar bya ba'i phyir dang / dge ba'i chos rnams bsgom par bya ba'i phyir shin tu spro ba dang bcas par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams pa ni mi dge ba'i chos rnams spang bar bya ba'i phyir dang / dge ba'i chos rnams bsgom par bya ba'i phyir shin tu spro ba dang bcas par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: One who has begun an effort is one who has great enthusiasm in order to abandon the unwholesome and to cultivate the wholesome.

original: sems 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni yul ma yin pa las bzlog par byed pa dang / yul la rab tu 'jug par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: sems 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni yul ma yin pa las bzlog par byed pa dang / yul la rab tu 'jug par byed pa yin no //
translated: He holds his mind means he turns it away from objects that are not objects and he turns it toward objects that are objects.

original: rab tu 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni rgyun gyis yul la sems 'dzin par @193a * //
analyzed: rab tu 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni rgyun gyis yul la sems 'dzin par @193a * //
translated: He holds it fast means he holds his mind to the object by means of continuity.

original: byed pa yin no //🔽dge ba'i chos zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /🔽'bras bu 'dod pa nyid kyi phyir dge pa yin no //
analyzed: byed pa yin no // dge ba'i chos zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / 'bras bu 'dod pa nyid kyi phyir dge pa yin no //
translated: He makes it one-pointed means he makes it one-pointed in order to attain the one-pointedness of mind.

original: mi brjed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dran ba rmongs pa'i nyes pa bzlog par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi brjed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dran ba rmongs pa'i nyes pa bzlog par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order not to forget, in order to avoid the fault of confusion of memory.

original: goms par byed pa ni bsgom pa yin la /
analyzed: goms par byed pa ni bsgom pa yin la /
translated: Cultivation is meditation.

original: bsgom pa dag yongs su rdzogs pa ni bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs pa yin te /
analyzed: bsgom pa dag yongs su rdzogs pa ni bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs pa yin te /
translated: The completion of meditation is the completion of cultivation.

original: bsgom pa 'grub pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgom pa 'grub pa de'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the accomplishment of meditation.

original: yang dang yang du bsgom pa ni phyi phyir bsgom pa yin te /
analyzed: yang dang yang du bsgom pa ni phyi phyir bsgom pa yin te /
translated: Repeated cultivation is cultivation again and again.

original: chung du'i rnam pa grub pa'i phyir yang nas yang mngon sum du byed do //
analyzed: chung du'i rnam pa grub pa'i phyir yang nas yang mngon sum du byed do //
translated: Because of the accomplishment of the small type, one realizes again and again.

original: 'phel ba ni 'bring gi rnam pa grub pa yin no //
analyzed: 'phel ba ni 'bring gi rnam pa grub pa yin no //
translated: Increase is the accomplishment of the medium type.

original: rgyas pa ni chen po'i rnam pa grub pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyas pa ni chen po'i rnam pa grub pa yin no //
translated: Expansion is the accomplishment of the great type.

original: yang na bsgom pa yongs su rtogs pa ni chung du'i rnam pa grub pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na bsgom pa yongs su rtogs pa ni chung du'i rnam pa grub pa yin no //
translated: Or else, the completion of cultivation is the accomplishment of the small type.

original: phyi phyir bsgom pa ni 'bring gi rnam pa grub pa yin no //
analyzed: phyi phyir bsgom pa ni 'bring gi rnam pa grub pa yin no //
translated: Repeated cultivation is the accomplishment of the medium type.

original: 'phel ba ni chen po'i rnam pa grub pa yin no //
analyzed: 'phel ba ni chen po'i rnam pa grub pa yin no //
translated: Increase is the accomplishment of the great type.

original: dus ring por rgyun gyis rjes su 'jug pa ni rgyas pa yin te /
analyzed: dus ring por rgyun gyis rjes su 'jug pa ni rgyas pa yin te /
translated: Expansion is the long-lasting continuity of the great type.

original: dus ring por khyab par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus ring por khyab par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it pervades for a long time.

original: 'gro ba dang 'ong ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa dag gi rnam par bshad pa ni bram ze'i khye'u aam ba sta'i mdo'i rnam par bshad par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba dang 'ong ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa dag gi rnam par bshad pa ni bram ze'i khye'u aam ba sta'i mdo'i rnam par bshad par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The explanation of “going and coming” and so on should be understood as in the explanation of the Ambattha Sūtra.

original: nang gi lus la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bshad pa ni mngal du 'jug pa'i mdo bshad pa lta bur rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nang gi lus la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bshad pa ni mngal du 'jug pa'i mdo bshad pa lta bur rig par bya'o //
translated: The explanation of “the internal body” and so on should be understood as in the explanation of the Garbhāvakrānti Sūtra.

original: shing rta re re la zhon te zhes bya ba ni shing rta so so tha dad pa la zhon nas so //
analyzed: shing rta re re la zhon te zhes bya ba ni shing rta so so tha dad pa la zhon nas so //
translated: “Each mounted on a chariot” means that they are mounted on separate individual chariots.

original: rta sngon po zhes bya ba la sogs pa rta bzlog pa'i thabs su gyur pa srab yin no //
analyzed: rta sngon po zhes bya ba la sogs pa rta bzlog pa'i thabs su gyur pa srab yin no //
translated: “The blue horse” and so on are the means of controlling the horse.

original: lcag ni 'gro bar byed pa'i thabs su gyur pa'o //
analyzed: lcag ni 'gro bar byed pa'i thabs su gyur pa'o //
translated: The whip is the means of making it go.
